response: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix first 8 ingredients together in bowl. Add milk and stir until well combined. Spread in greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Cook sausage and drain in a collander. Sauté onions in the drippings until translucent. Add celery and sauté for 2 minutes. Add flour to the pan and cook 2 minutes more. Add broth and cook until mixture thickens slightly. Stir in sausage, sage and salt and pepper to taste. Fold in the cooked mushrooms, add more broth if necessary. Pour into a 2-quart baking dish. Top with a layer of cubed bread and dot the surface of the sausage mixture with the remaining cubes of bread. Bake until golden brown, about 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray. In small bowl combine bread cubes, turkey, cheese, onions, eggs, milk, poultry seasoning. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until lightly browned. Let stand about 5 minutes before removing ring from pan. Serve with vegetables.

Cook noodles according to package instructions. Meanwhile, bring water to a boil. Add broccoli and cook until bright green. Stir in sauce until blended. Drain noodles and add to sauce. Cook for 2-3 minutes. Add broccoli and stir. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes before serving. Sprinkle with garlic and red pepper.

Boil macaroni for 4 minutes. Drain well. Set aside. Mix mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, non-dairy milk substitute, and salt and pepper in a medium bowl. Add macaroni and toss well. Divide mixture into 4 bowls. Top each with bread crumbs. Serve warm.

Boil water in a pot. Stir in french onion soup mix. Add sausages and parsley. Remove from heat. Let stand for 20 minutes. Add bacon. Mix in frozen mixed vegetables. Pour into greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Bake in 350 degree oven for 40 minutes.

For the whole wheat bread, cut it in half lengthwise. Spread crunchy peanut butter evenly on one side of each piece of the whole wheat bread. Top each piece with a slice of white bread. For the goldfish crackers, separate them into piles of four crackers each. Spread grape jelly evenly on each pile of crackers. Layer crackers on top of the peanut butter-covered bread. To serve, cut the sandwiches in half diagonally.

Rinse and pat dry the chicken breast halves. In a large resealable plastic bag, add the flour, 1 tablespoon of the soy sauce, the sugar, pineapple chunk and parsley. Add the chicken breast halves to the bag. Seal the bag and turn the bag several times to coat the chicken halves thoroughly with the spice mixture. Refrigerate the chicken for about 2 hours to marinate. Remove the chicken from the refrigerator 1 hour before cooking it. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Heat a large skillet over medium heatspray it lightly with non stick spray. Add the remaining soy sauce to the skillet and bring it to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, then add the rice. Cook for about 5 minutes until the rice is tender. Meanwhile, place the chicken breast halves skin side down in a baking dish large enough to hold the rice. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the breast halves are cooked through. Place a small sprig of

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Sift the flour and add it to the butter and sugars. Beat until well combined. Add the egg and the vanilla and beat until well combined. Stir in the water and the salt and beat until well combined. Add the semi-sweet chocolate chips and mix until they are evenly distributed. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes or until the edges begin to brown. Cool on a wire rack.
Fill a highball glass 3/4 full of ice. Pour grapefruit juice over the ice. Add maraschino cherries, vodka and white sugar to taste. Pour over lime wedges to serve.

In a saucepan, combine all the ingredients. Cook and stir over low heat until sugar dissolves. Continue to cook until mixture is reduced to 1/4 cup. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla. Serve hot or cold. Store any leftover mixture in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.

Whisk eggs with milk and salt and pepper to taste. In medium fry pan heat oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add eggs to pan and cook until eggs are set but still soft. Stir in green onions and jalapenos. Serve immediately.

Put strawberries in blender. Add ginger ale, milk, sugar, lemon juice and vanilla extract. Blend until smooth. Refrigerate until serving time. Just before serving stir in the sour cream. Serve in tall glasses. Garnish each glass with a strawberry.

Pour hoisin sauce into a large bowl, add orange juice. Stir until the hoisin dissolves. Add honey, stir until it dissolves. Add salmon fillets, stir gently to coat the salmon. Cover with plastic wrap and place salmon into the refrigerator for at least an hour. Remove the salmon from the refrigerator 30 minutes before you plan on grilling the salmon. Preheat your grill on medium high heat. Grill salmon for about 10 minutes or until cooked through. Serve immediately.

Spoon 1/2 cup pesto into a bowl. Add remaining pesto ingredients and toss to combine. Set aside. Remove stems from roasted red peppers and cut peppers into small pieces. Thread chicken breast over 12 metal skewers. Dip one side of the skewer in the pesto mixture and arrange in a single layer on a baking sheet. Broil 5 in. from heat about 8 minutes per side until chicken is no longer pink. Serve on a plate with the remaining pesto on the side for dipping. Makes 4 servings.

For the vegetables, slice the tomatoes into thin slices. Slice the zucchini into thin slices. Slice the yellow squash into thin slices. Slice the red bell peppers in half lengthwise. Slice each half into thin slices. For the blue cheese butter, melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the lemon juice. Stir in the salt and pepper. Add the blue cheese. Stir until the blue cheese is melted. Then stir in the olive oil. Add the basil leaves. Turn the heat down to low. Stir in the vegetables. Cook until the vegetables are tender.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place roast on rack in a shallow roasting pan. Rub seasonings onto roast and place into oven. Cook for 1 hour. Remove roast from oven and reduce oven temperature to 350 degrees f. Increase oven time to 1 hour and 30 minutes. Remove roast from oven and transfer to serving platter. Discard all pan juices from oven. Wipe out roasting pan and place it back into oven. Place 1 stick of butter and 2 minced garlic cloves into pan. Return pan to oven and roast for about 5 minutes. Transfer pan to stove top. Add 2 minced garlic cloves and 2 tablespoons of olive oil into pan. Place pan back into oven for 10 minutes. Remove pan from oven. Increase heat to high and add 1/2 cup of flour. Whisk vigorously for 2 minutes. Return pan to oven and roast for 30 minutes. Remove pan from oven and transfer to stove top. Add 2 cu

To make crust, combine flour and sugar in large bowl. Add butter and cut with fork or pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Stir in water and vinegarturn out onto lightly floured surface. Knead lightly just until dough cleans hands and bowl. Shape into ball and flatten into disk. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 1 hour. Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Peel and core pears. Slice thinly and toss with brown sugar. Roll out half of dough into rectangleplace pear slices on rectangle and roll up jelly-roll style. Transfer roll to ungreased baking sheetcut into 8 slices. Place roll pieces crosswise on baking sheet. Repeat procedure with remaining dough and pears. Place one roll piece in each of four ungreased 6-inch glass pie plates. Place figs in shallow pansprinkle with water and add lemon juice. Cover and let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes. Increase heat to 375 degrees f.

Preheat oven to 350. In medium bowl combine butter and brown sugar. Add vanilla and beat well. Add flour and graham cracker crumbs. Blend well. Press into bottom of ungreased 9x13 baking pan. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes, or until lightly browned. Cool completely. In medium bowl combine remaining ingredients. Pour over crust and spread lightly. Bake at 375 for 25 to 28 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely before cutting.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Combine oats, almonds, wheat germ and craisins in a large bowl and mix with a fork until well combined. Mix in the honey and cinnamon, then add the nutmeg and vanilla and mix well. Put mixture in a baking dish and bake for 25 minutes, or until golden brown and firm. Let cool completely before breaking into pieces. Store in an airtight container in a cool dry place.

For every one of these little liqueur oranges you will need three large organic navel oranges that are freshly picked from your tree. For best results try not to pick them until they have fully ripened. Preparing them is easy - just remove all the peel from one of your navel oranges and cut in half, then remove any seeds you find inside the fruit. Take one half of your fruit and cut it into small sized segments so you can see inside. Place your navel orange segments in an empty jar along with your caster sugar and vanilla bean. Top them off with your chosen liqueur (I prefer Grand Marnier) and then top them off again with brandy. You may have some space in your jar but that is OK - just make sure you cover all of your fruit segments with your brandy. Leave your jar somewhere cool (in your fridge if possible) and leave it there over night. The next day you will notice that your fruit has swollen up into little juicy liqueur oranges which are ready to be eaten straight from the jar. You can also eat these little liqueur oranges straight from your jar as well as serve them as g

Cream margarine in large bowl with electric mixer. Add sugar, beat until light in color. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add vanilla and beat until light in color. Add cocoa, beating until well blended. Add flour, stirring until well blended. Stir in nuts, coating nuts with the batter. Spoon batter onto waxed paper or parchment paper lined baking sheets. Drop in chocolate chips. Bake at 325 for 16 - 17 minutes or until centers spring back when lightly pressed in center with finger. Let cool on wire racks.

Cream together 1/2 cup butter and 1/2 cup sugar substitute. Add 1 cup milk and beat until well blended. Add 1 whole egg and 1 egg white. Add 1 cup crushed pineapple (with juice), 1 3/4 cup flour and 1 teaspoon baking soda. Blend well. Add 1 teaspoon vanilla and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Butter an 8-inch square baking dish. Whisk together flour, baking powder and salt. In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat butter until smooth. Add sugars and beat until fluffy. Scrape down sides of bowl. Add vanilla extract and beat until incorporated. Add eggs one at a time. Gradually add flour mixture. Add chocolate chips. Spread into prepared dish. Bake until just set and center is still soft, about 20 minutes. Cool completely on wire rack. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Combine sugar and vinegar in a medium bowl and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Add Miracle Whip and stir well. Add the broccoli and onion. Mix well. Fold in cheese and bacon. Serve immediately or chill for a few hours to blend flavors.
Fill glasses halfway with crushed ice. Pour Bacardi Limon directly into glasses. Top with Lemonade Mix. Fill with crushed ice. Add Lime Juice. Garnish with lime wedges.

Cut orange in half. Squeeze out juice into small glasses or small bowl. Dry the orange halves. Place in glasses. Pour 1/4 cup port wine in each glass. Place one cherry in each glass. Arrange 1/2 cup currant jelly around each cherry. Place one blueberry in each glass. Place 1/2 cup currant jelly around each blueberry. Place one strawberry in each glass. Place 1/2 cup currant jelly around each strawberry. Place 1/2 cup currant jelly around each raspberry. Place 1/2 cup currant jelly around each blackberry. Arrange 1/2 cup currant jelly around each mint leaf. Arrange 1/2 cup currant jelly around each orange half. Place one mint leaf in each glass. Top with 1/4 cup port wine. Decorate with remaining currants and jelly.
Cut mangoes into halves. Juice. Add to blender with orange and lime juices and club soda. Blend until smooth. Pour into 2 glasses and serve.

Preheat the oven to 220C/425F/Gas 7. Mix the cereals together in one bowl. Mix the coconut, almonds and seeds together in another. In a third bowl mix together the dried fruit and condensed milk. Combine the cereals and the fruit mixture in the bowl. Stir until evenly mixed. Transfer to the prepared baking tray and press down gently with a spoon. Bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and leave to cool on the tray.

In a large bowl, combine the cornmeal, flour, sugar and salt. In a small bowl, beat together the eggs and beerstir into cornmeal mixture just until moistened. Fold in the onion and jalapeno pepper. Using a 1/4 cup measure, drop batter by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a greased or paper-lined baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 8 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot.

Slice challah lengthwise into 4 pieces, spreading each slice with butter. Layer tomatoes on one slice of bread with one tablespoon brie slices, a few fresh basil leaves and one more tomato slice on top. Place second piece of bread on top, buttered side down, and press gently to meld all the ingredients together. Cut into four wedges to serve.
Mix together all ingredients, add meat and marinate for 6 hours or overnight. Grill or broil to desired doneness. Garnish with lemon slices.

Place the zucchini in a food processor. Add the garlic, lime juice, salt, chicken broth, dried oregano and parsley. Process until smooth. Transfer to a 9-inch square baking dish. Bake for 20 minutes or until tender.

In a small bowl mix sugar and 3 tablespoons of olive oil until blended. Stir in mayonnaise and remaining olive oil. Add the prepared and stone ground mustards. Stir in garlic powder and dill. Serve with assorted pretzels.

Preheat oven to 425f. Remove the core from the pears. Wrap the bacon around the pears and secure with a toothpick. Place in a single layer in a roasting pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until the bacon is crisp and browned. Remove from the oven and discard the toothpicks. Transfer the pears to a serving platter. In a large bowl toss the salad greens with enough dressing to lightly coat. Add the bacon wrapped pears, pecans and parmesan. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees and grease an 8" square casserole dish with cooking spray. In a medium bowl, beat together eggs, milk and salt and pepper until frothy. Add jalapeno jack and cheddar cheeses and stir until melted. Place bread slices in the bottom of the casserole dish and top with jalapeno jack cheese and cheddar cheese. Pour egg mixture over cheeses and top with bacon strips and remaining bread slices. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Remove from refrigerator and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Combine green peppercorns, lemon rind and juice in a food processorpulse until coarsely chopped. Melt 1/2 tablespoon of the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the lemon rind mixture. Stir for 1 minute. Add the fish filletscook for 4 to 5 minutes per inch of thickness or until just done. Transfer the fillets to a platter. Add the remaining 1/2 tablespoon of the butter to the skilletcook for 1 to 2 minutes or until the butter is melted. Place the fillets on top of the scallops. Stir in the remaining lemon juice. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl, combine all-purpose flour, baking soda, and salt. Set aside. Cream butter in a medium bowl with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in granulated sugar and brown sugar until well combined. Beat in egg yolks one at a time until well combined. Add the vanilla. Slowly beat in the dry ingredients until the batter is smooth. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop the dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto greased cookie sheets. Bake 12-15 minutes or until the edges begin to brown. Let the cookies cool on the cookie sheet for 10 minutes before removing with a spatula to wire racks to cool completely.
Mix together cream cheese, sugar and frozen dessert topping. Pour into prepared graham cracker crust. Refrigerate overnight. Top with cherry pie filling.

Melt butter in 2-quart saucepan over medium heat. Stir in bouillon. Cook 3 minutes. Add onion powder. Cook 3 minutes longer. Stir in rice. Cook 3 minutes longer. Stir in lemon juice. Cook 2 minutes. Add warm water. Bring to boiling. Cook 5 minutes. Stir in cooked orzo. Cover. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve warm. Makes 4 servings.
Wash and dry vegetables. Cut into bite-sized pieces. Mix together dressing ingredients. Toss vegetables with dressing. Cover and refrigerate. Serve cold.

Preheat a baking sheet in a preheated 400 F oven for about 10 minutes. Wash sweet potatoes under cool water. Pierce the skin on each side of the sweet potato with a paring knife. Place each on a baking sheet and sprinkle with sesame seeds and garlic cloves. Bake until tender, about 45 minutes depending on size. Remove from the oven and let cool slightly. Cut each in half lengthwise. Place half of the cut sides of each sweet potato on a cutting board and spread with a layer of soy sauce mixture and top with a thin slice of nori. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and garlic cloves and drizzle with sesame oil. Repeat with the remaining sweet potato halves. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the clams and wine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 1 minute. Add the cherry tomatoes and cook for about another minute or until the tomatoes are softened. Add the parsley and season with salt and pepper. Serve with french bread and butter. Enjoy!

In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour and seasonings. Pour the oil in a large skillet and heat to 350 degrees. Dip the chicken in the flour mixture and shake off the excess. Fry the pieces until they are golden brown on both sides.

In a small baking dish, arrange pear halves cut side up. Sprinkle lightly with raisins. Place in preheated oven and bake for 15 minutes. While baking, sprinkle the pear halves with maple syrup. Remove from oven when tender when pierced with a fork or a knife. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Top with a dollop of whipped cream if desired.
Cut carrots into 3/4-inch cubes and boil in stock until just tender. Add garlic and cook for 5 more minutes. Drain and mash. Add seasonings and stir. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit and spray an 11 x 7 baking dish with non-stick cooking spray. Cut biscuits in half and place them in the dish in rows, alternating the biscuit cut side down and cut side up. In a large bowl, beat together the cream cheese and the brown sugar until smooth and spreadable. Spread the mixture evenly over the biscuits. Bake 10 to 12 minutes until the top is lightly browned and the biscuits are tender. Meanwhile in a small bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder and cinnamon. Stir in the egg and beat just until blended. Pour over the biscuits and bake until the topping is browned, about 10 more minutes. Cool for 5 minutes and serve warm or chilled.

Spread out the potatoes on a sheet of aluminum foil. Cut an X with the knife at one end of the potatoes. Rub the potatoes with olive oil and sprinkle with taco seasoning mix. Sprinkle with shredded mexican blend cheese and wrap tightly in foil. Bake for about 40 minutes or until potatoes are tender. You can eat the potatoes with just the foil on or with the foil removed and the cheese melted.
In a large bowl combine the milk and oatmeal. Stir in the cinnamon and bananas. Top with cereal if desired. Heat in the microwave for 2-3 minutes or until hot.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add turkey and cook until browned. Add remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 15 min. Stir in cheese.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain well. Put sour cream, milk, 1 tsp of the seasonings into the cooked potatoes. Mash. Add the remaining seasonings, mix well. Refrigerate 1 hour or until you are ready to serve. Put 1/2 cup of the potato mixture into each of 8 greased ramekins or custard cups or 1-1/2 qt casserole dish. Sprinkle 1 cup of corn flakes over each filling. Top each casserole with 1/2 cup of the remaining filling mixture. Sprinkle each one with remaining corn flakes. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Place the lentils in a large saucepan. Add the water and bay leaves. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to low and cook until tender, about 35 minutes. Drain the lentils and transfer to a large bowl. Roughly chop the orange. Peel the orange with a paring knife. Quarter the orange and thinly slice the sections. Add the orange to the lentils. Toss the fennel and red onion with the orange and lentils. Whisk the vinegar with the olive oil in a large bowl. Season with the salt and black pepper. Toss the dressing with the vegetables. Serve the lentils with the orange slices.

Melt butter in a sauce pan. In another bowl combine the dry ingredients. Add the dry mixture to the melted butter and mix well. Add the eggs, vanilla and walnuts. Mix. Add the chocolate chips and peanut butter. Stir and pour into a greased pan. Bake at 350 for about 25 minutes.

Spread about 1/4 cup of vegetable oil in a large casserole dish and heat in the microwave for about 2 minutes or until hot. Dip one end of each tortilla in the oil and then lay them flat on a plate until ready to use. Heat about a tablespoon of oil in a large skillet and saute the onion and garlic for about a minute until softened. Add the enchilada sauce and simmer for a few minutes, stirring occasionally until the sauce is thickened. Pour the sauce into the casserole dish and top with the onion and garlic, and the cheese. Bake at 400 degrees for about 25 minutes or until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and place foil into large casserole dish and pour oil into pan. Coat pan with oil and place into oven to heat. Cut up the baby carrots and place into pan as well. Cut up potatoes and slice up onion. Crumble up hamburger and mix with olive oil and onion soup mix and add to pan with everything else. Place into oven and cook for 25 to 30 minutes or until meat and carrots are cooked through and veggies are tender. Serve and enjoy!

In a small skillet heat the bacon over medium heat until it begins to crisp. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the green onion and cook until softened. Add the flour to the butter mixture and cook for about a minute to cook out the raw flour taste. Stir in the milk slowly to make a gravy. Remove from heat. Add the cooked bacon to the gravy along with the seasoning salt and the diced sweet onion. Add the egg mixture to the skillet, stirring constantly until the top is set. Add the cheddar cheese to the top. Bake in a 350 degree f. preheated oven for about 20 minutes until the top is lightly browned and the egg is set on the bottom.

Preheat oven to 375f. Grease 9x13x2 inch pan. Mix margarine and sugars with an electric mixer. Add eggs one at a time. Add flour and cocoa. Stir in white chocolate chips. Spread batter evenly in greased pan. Bake for 30 minutes.

Boil the potatoes in salted water for about 15 minutes. Drain. Mash the potatoes with a potato masher. Drain the green beans and chop them into small pieces. In a large pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the potatoes and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the green beans. Add the pesto sauce. Cook for 1 minute. Drain the pot of pasta. Put the pasta in a large bowl. Add the green bean mixture. Mix well. Serve.

Boil macaroni in water according to package instructions until tender but still firm to the bitedrain well. In a large bowl, beat eggs with 1/4 cup flour until blended well. Whisk in milkstir in remaining flour until blended. Pour over macaronimix well until coated with liquid. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 inch baking dishtop with shredded cheddar. Bake at 375 degrees for 35 minutes or until a light golden brown. Serves 6 to 8.
In a 4 qt pot, combine all ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to med low. Simmer uncovered for 35 minutes. Serve with cornbread.

Sort the dried kidney beans to make sure there are no small rocks, screws etc. in them. In this recipe I used Great Northern Beans. (Dried kidney beans will work as well.) Put the dried beans in a large pot and add 1 cup of boiling water and the sea salt. Cover and soak for 30 minutes. Add the rest of the boiling water. Cover and let soak overnight. Drain. Add the 1 cup of boiling water to the soaked beans. Cover and let soak 4 hours. Add the rice, TVP and soaking liquid to the pot. Stir well. Add the onion and the garlic and stir. Cover and simmer 1 to 1 1/2 hours until the rice is done. Add the chili powder and the cumin and stir to mix well. Remove from heat. Serve.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain and crumble. Reserve 2 tablespoons drippings. Saute peas and onions in bacon drippings until tender. Remove from pan and set aside. Cook bacon in reserved 2 tablespoons of bacon drippings until crisp. Remove and drain. Saute garlic and reserved peas and onions in bacon drippings until tender. Stir in cooked pasta, ricotta, cream and pepper. Simmer over low heat until sauce is thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in bacon and parsley. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Wash the parsnips, cut them into four equal parts and put them into the olive oil and bring them up to the boil in the sauce pan. Add salt and the coarse grain mustard with the parsnips and cook for another ten minutes or until the parsnips are soft. Wash the parsley and cut it into fine strips. Dice the onion finely. Peel the garlic and cut it into thin slices. Wash the thyme and cut it into small pieces. Put the parsnips into a roasting dish or roasting tin, put the onions into the saucepan and add the chicken thighs with the skin on them. Season the chicken thighs with salt and pepper. Peel the lemon and cut it into four wedges. Wash the parsley and cut it into fine strips. In the sauce pan add the vegetable broth with the parsley and the thyme. Heat the oil in the frying pan until it starts to smoke. In the pan add the garlic and

Mix sugar, butter and milk in a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and add peanut butter and vanilla. Stir in cocoa. Remove from heat and cool for 20 minutes. Add quick cooking oatmeal. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 10 minutes.
Mix light rum, apricot brandy, triple sec in a shaker. Add ice cubes. Strain into a glass with crushed ice. Add orange and pineapple juices. Garnish with cherry and orange wedge.

Combine carrot and butter in a large skillet. Cook over medium heat until tender. Add brown sugar and stir well. Add cider and stock and bring to a simmer. Cook for 4 minutes. Stir in the mustard and season with salt and pepper. Serve garnished with the fresh chopped parsley.

Heat a large skillet over medium-low heat and add olive oil. Add the onion and cook for about 5 minutes or until the onion is soft. Add the mushrooms and cook for another 5 minutes or until the mushrooms are softened. Add the peppers and cook for another 5 minutes or until the peppers begin to soften slightly. Remove from the heat and place in a food processor or blender along with the cooked pasta and blend to a coarse consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste and a sprinkle of onion powder and garlic to taste. Pour the mixture back into the skillet and cook over low-medium heat for about 5 minutes or until the mixture becomes a bit creamy. Serve immediately over hot cooked pasta and garnish with Parmesan cheese if desired.

Mix 1/2 cup water and 3 cups milk in a large bowl. Add 1 lb. of bulk sausage and 1 lb. of lean ground beef. Add 1 tsp. of oregano and 1 tsp. of garlic powder and 1 tsp. of worcestershire. Stir to combine. Spread mixture in the bottom of a greased 13x9 pan. Top with 12 rounds of miniature rye rounds. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with additional oregano and garlic powder. Makes 8 servings.

Place the eggplant in the microwave on HIGH for about 8 to 10 minutes. Add the onion and roasted red peppers to the microwave with the eggplant. Microwave for about 8 to 10 more minutes. Drain the liquid from the microwave. Mix the diced tomatoes with the olive oil. Place the onion, roasted red peppers, diced tomatoes, and the eggplant in a mixing bowl. Mix to combine. Serve on your favorite bread. Add cheese if desired.
Combine all ingredientsshape into 24 balls. Chill 2 hours or until firmroll balls in walnuts. Serve with assorted crackers or with pita bread triangles.

Cover a cookie sheet with foil. Lay tortillas on foil. In a 9x13 pan add water and taco seasoning mix and bring to a boil. Stir in ground beef. Cook on low for 20 minutes. Stir every 5 minutes. Remove foil from tortillas. Spread refried beans on tortillas. Spoon 1/3 cup of ground beef mixture on each tortilla. Roll tortillas and place in 9x13 pan. Pour enchilada sauce over tortillas and sprinkle with shredded cheese. Place in 375 degree oven for 10 minutes or until heated through. Remove from oven and top with onions and sour cream. Makes 6.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Coat an ungreased 9-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. In a large bowl combine carrot, onions, mayonnaise, water, horseradish and peppermix well. Pour into prepared baking dish. Top with breadcrumbs, cheese and buttersprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with foil and bake for one hour. Uncover and continue baking for an additional 15 minutes or until heated through and golden.
Cream together butter and cheese until fluffy. Add the flour slowly with worcestershire sauce and tabasco sauce. Add the rice crispies. Drop by teaspoon on cookie sheet. Bake at 375f for 8-9 minutes.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add a generous amount of salt to the water. Add the angel hair to the water and cook until just tender, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain the angel hair into a large serving bowl. Add the oil to the hot pan over medium heat. Add the garlic to the pan. Cook for about 30 seconds, stirring frequently. Add the basil to the pan. Cook for another 30 seconds. Add the avocado to the pan. Cook for 30 seconds. Add the tomato to the pan. Cook for 30 seconds. Add the cooked angel hair to the pan. Cook for 30 seconds. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Serve.

Combine the bread crumbs and the seasonings. In a shallow dish, combine the bread crumb mixture and the melted butter. Dip the orange roughy in the seasoned butter and then coat with the bread crumb mixture. Arrange the orange roughy in an ungreased baking dish. Dot with the remaining butter. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes or until flaky. Sprinkle with parsley and serve with lemon wedges.

Cook frozen carrots in boiling salted water for about 7 minutes or until tender-crisp. Drain in colander and rinse under cold running waterdrain again. Return carrots to same saucepan and add hot water to covercook over low heat for 4 minutes to loosen peel. Place carrot halves in shallow serving dishes and keep hotdrain any excess water from carrots. In small saucepan over low heat, mix together the lemon zest and orange juicebring to boiling, stirring constantly. Remove from heatadd the dark corn syrup and corn starch mixturestirring constantly with whisk to dissolve the starch mixture. Pour hot glaze over carrotstoss and serve immediately or chill and serve cold. Garnish with parsley before serving if desiredor serve with your choice of garnish if desired.

Wash and slice potatoes. Place in saucepan. Add water to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until tender. Drain and mash. In another saucepan, combine peas with butter. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook until tender. Add mashed potato. Add marjoram and thyme. Cook until heated through. Add pepper. Transfer to serving dish. Sprinkle with diced bay leaves.

Heat butter in large skillet and brown sausage over medium heat. Drain grease. In saucepan, melt flour. Stir in cold water and cook over medium heat until thickened. Add sour cream and pepper. Continue cooking over medium heat until thickened. Add milk. Stir in salt. Heat over medium heat until warm. Serve with omelets.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Beat together the butter, granulated sugar and brown sugar in a large bowl with an electric mixer on medium-high speed for 3 minutes or until light and fluffy. Add the eggs to the bowl one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in the vanilla extract. Sift together the all-purpose flour and saltadd to the bowl with the other wet ingredientsmix well with a rubber spatula to combine. Place a piece of waxed paper over the bowl of dough and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Line three cookie sheets with parchment paper or silicone bakeware. Using a small cookie scoop or two spoons, drop the dough onto the cookie sheets in a 3 inch circle shape. Bake 8 to 10 minutes, or until the edges are set and the centers are still soft. Place a piece of waxed paper over the cookie sheet to keep the dough from sticking to it while the cookies are cooling.

Fill teapot half way with boiling water & steep teabags for 5 minutes. Remove teabags & discard. Add remaining teapot contents to blender with orange & lemon juices, orange & lemon zest & splenda sweetened cranberry juice. Blend until smooth. Reheat over low heat & add sugar until desired sweetness is achieved. Serve hot with whole cloves & cinnamon sticks for garnish or cold with orange & lemon slices garnish.

Cut potatoes into 1/4 inch thick slices and arrange in one layer on an ungreased baking sheet. Drizzle with melted butter and sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake in 425 degree oven for 40 minutes until tender. Turn potato slices half way through baking for even browning. Sprinkle with cajun seasoning before serving.

In a large pan over medium heat, saute the bacon until crisp. Remove from pan. Set aside. Add the butter to the pan. Add the asparagus. Sprinkle with worcestershire sauce. Stir constantly until the butter melts. Remove from heat. Add the brown sugar. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Place 1 piece of bacon over the top of each bundle. Transfer to platter. Serve hot.

Melt 1/2 cup of the unsweetened chocolate in a double boiler over hot water. Remove from heat and add 1/2 cup of light corn syrup and 1/2 cup of whole milk to the melted chocolate. Mix together until smooth. Set aside to cool slightly to lukewarm. Cream together remaining 1/2 cup unsweetened chocolate and 1/2 cup of light corn syrup and 1/2 cup of whole milk until smooth. Fold in 1 cup of cooled chocolate mixture to the warmed chocolate mixture until smooth. Fold in 2 cups of powdered sugar until smooth and glossy. Spread between two sheets of parchment paper to flatten. Remove top sheet of paper to use as a transfer sheet. Refrigerate 30 minutes or until firm enough to spread on cake or cupcakes.

Place the raisins in a small heat proof bowl. Pour boiling water over the raisins and let soak for 10 minutes. Drain. Meanwhile, cut the bread slice up into small cubes. Heat up 2 tablespoons of the olive oil on medium heat and saute the bread cubes until golden. Drain. Heat the remaining olive oil in the pan and saute the pine nuts until they begin to turn golden color. Add the spinach, garlic, and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 1-2 minutes until the spinach starts to wilt. Stir in the drained raisins. Transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle with the croutons and serve hot.

Prepare a chocolate syrup by mixing 2 cups of granulated sugar with 2 cups of hot water over medium heat. Cook until thickened. Remove from heat, cool to lukewarm. Combine 3/4 cup of syrup with 2 cups of ice cream and 2 cups of coffee. Blend in 1/2 cup of hot coffee and 1/2 cup of hot water to ice cream syrup. Pour into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Top with 2 shots of whipped cream and 2 shots of chocolate syrup. Serve immediately!

Slice potatoes in half. Scoop out some of the potato to make room for the filling. In a bowl, combine ham, soup and cheese. Spoon mixture into potato halves. Sprinkle with paprika. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400f. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin or line with paper liners. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy, about 3 minutes. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add buttermilk to butter mixture in batches, beating well after each addition until combined well. Add in dry ingredients until just combined. Do not overmix. Spoon batter into prepared muffin pan or lined cups, filling almost to the top of the cups to allow for puffing in the oven. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of each muffin comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before removing from the panserve warm or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350f. Prick eggplants and bake until tender when pierced with a fork. Peel skins from hot eggplants and finely mash. In large bowl, combine breadcrumbs, cheese and seasonings. To eggplants, add 3/4 cup milk, egg and olive oil and mix well. Shape mixture into long strips. Roll strips in breadcrumbs and bake on greased cookie sheet for 15 minutes or until crisp. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees f. Place sun-dried tomatoes in a food processor with the garlic, tomatoes, sugar, and basil. Blend until smooth. Put the mixture in an ovenproof bowl. Place the bowl in the oven for 20 minutes. Remove bowl from the oven. Stir in the cheeses. Add the pasta. Spoon the mixture over the pasta. Bake until the cheese is melted. Sprinkle the pasta with fresh chopped parsley.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add in fillets and cook until just done (about 10 minutes). Drain and set aside. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add in garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add in marmalade and stir to coat. Add in orange zest and juice. Whisk in soy sauce and stir to combine. Add in salt and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Place fish in a baking dish and pour orange marmalade over top. Cover with foil and bake at 325 degrees F for 15-20 minutes.

Drain sweetbreads of liquid and pat dry with paper towels. In a skillet over medium heat, saute bacon until fat is rendered and crisp and bacon is golden brown and crisp. Remove bacon to a paper towel-lined plate to drain and cool slightly. In a medium bowl mix flour and garlic powder. In a small bowl mix vinegar and water. Combine bacon and bacon fat with flour-garlic mixture and set aside. In a skillet over medium heat, add enough oil to coat the bottom of skillet. When oil is hot add sweetbreads to skillet and saute until golden brown and crispy on bottom. Turn sweetbreads over and saute until golden brown and crispy on bottom side as well. Remove to plate with bacon and set aside. In a small bowl combine 1/2 cup of vinegar-water mixture and 1/4 cup of butter and melt. Remove from heat and pour over sweetbreads and bacon to coat. Garnish with parsley and serve hot with steamed vegetables or potatoes. Serve 4 as

In skillet, heat oil over medium heat and saute onion until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in squash and apples and cook for 10 more minutes. In large bowl combine cooked squash and apples, rice, cinnamon and nutmeg. Add enough apple juice to moisten and coat rice mixture and set aside. Dry meat with paper towels and coat with flour, salt and pepper. In large nonstick skillet brown meat over medium heat, about 3 minutes per side. Add 1/2 cup of rice mixture and stir to coat. Pour remaining rice mixture into skillet and cover with lid. Cook for 5 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

Melt butter in medium pan over medium heat. Add ham and cook until browned, about 3 minutes. Add bell pepper and cook 4 minutes. Add 1 cup heavy cream and season with salt and pepper. When cream is heated add egg mixture. Stir until scrambled. Remove from heat. Add chili powder and garlic powder to taste. Stir to combine. Add cheddar cheese and stir until melted. Serve immediately.

Melt butter and golden syrup in saucepan. Add honey and porridge oats. Cook over medium heat until the porridge is cooked. Spoon the flapjacks onto greased trays and press down lightly with the back of a wooden spoon. Bake in hot oven for about 10 mminutes or until lightly browned. Leave on trays and allow to cool. Sift icing sugar over. Store in an airtight container.

Cream together sugar cookie mix, eggs and oil with a mixer at medium speed until smooth and creamy about 1 minute. Stir in water until well blended. Press dough into a greased 11x13 pan and bake at 375 degrees for about 12 minutes or until edges are set. Cool completely and frost with cream cheese frosting and sugar free raspberry jam.

Mix all dry ingredients together in a large bowl. Mix all the wet ingredients together in a large bowl. Combine the dry and wet ingredients together and mix thoroughly. Pour batter into greased 8 x 4 x 2 inch loaf pan. Bake in preheated oven at 375 F degrees for about an hour or until done.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Place semi-sweet chocolate chips and pecan pieces in a large, shallow pan. Melt over low heat. Remove from heat and drizzle melted chips over pan. Set aside. Prepare yellow cake mix according to package directions. Pour batter into two 8x2 inch round pans. Bake according to package directions. Remove from oven and cool completely. In a medium bowl beat together half and half and egg. Stir in half and half and egg. Stir in 1/3 cup kahlua. Frost with remaining kahlua and half and half mixture. Drizzle coconut over top and garnish with pecans. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray an 8-inch square baking pan with cooking spray. Trim 1 inch from both sides of each asparagus stalk to remove tough tipsdiscard tips. Trim 1 inch from each end of asparagus stalks and cut into 1-inch pieces. Place asparagus and 1 tablespoon olive oil in prepared pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon each salt and peppertoss to coat. Arrange in single layer on prepared pan. Bake for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Bake for 5 minutes or until tender and heated throughtoss halfway through cooking time to coat with oil and seasoning again. Transfer to a large bowldrizzle with remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil and toss gently to coat. Arrange in single layer on prepared pansprinkle with toasted almonds and remaining 1/2 teaspoon each salt and peppertoss to coat. Bake for

In large saucepan heat margarine to melt it then add eggs and beat well. Add flour to margarine mix. Gradually add milk stirring constantly. Add rice and stir well with wooden spoon until well mixed. Cook over low heat for about ten minutes stirring often. Add vanilla then add remaining flour to mixture. Cook until mixture thickens stirring constantly. Add margarine to the top and serve warm.

Mix flour, paprika and poultry seasoning. Add margarine and mix well. Dip chicken in beaten egg. Dip in flour mixture. Shake off excess flour. Place on greased cookie sheet or broiler pan. Bake at 400 for 15-20 minutes.

Remove all visible fat from pork. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place pork in a skillet coated with cooking spray. Brown pork over medium-high heat for about 5 minutes. Sprinkle with rosemary and flip over. Bake uncovered for 45 minutes at 350 degrees. Remove from oven and brush with liquid honey. Combine wine and remaining ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Pour over pork and return to oven for about 30 minutes. Bring to room temperature and serve.

Heat oven to 450F. Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. In a large skillet brown chicken in butter. Add remaining ingredients and mix. Pour into pan. Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until heated through.

In a small bowl, whisk together apple cider vinegar, maple syrup and 2 tablespoons of water until well blended. Set aside. To make dressing, whisk together remaining 2 tablespoons of water and apple cider vinegar with remaining water and apple cider vinegar with remaining water and apple cider vinegar with remaining water and apple cider vinegar in a small bowl until well blended. Set aside. In a medium mixing bowl, combine greens and apple halves and quarter pecan halves. Sprinkle with cheese and dressing. Toss to coat and serve.

Using a food processor or blender process the herbs with the lemon zest and garlic until well combined. Slowly add the olive oil and blend until combined well. Add the salt and pepper and blend well. Pour mixture into a glass bowl and cover the top with plastic wrap and let sit for at least 3 hours at room temperature before serving or overnight in the refrigerator if you want it extra flavorful and creamy. Serve with roasted potatoes, grilled steaks or with your favorite sandwiches on good bread!

Cook butter in a large pot on medium heat. Once melted, add in garlic. Cook for 30 seconds or so. Whisk in heavy cream, salt, pepper and nutmeg. Bring mixture to a simmer. Add in the elbow pasta. Cook until tender. Drain. Stir in grated parmesan and shredded cheeses. Mix to combine. Transfer to a baking dish. Top with grated pecorino romano. Bake for 20 minutes or so.

In a 3-quart slow cooker combine all the ingredients except the sour cream. Cover and cook for 4-5 hours. Remove the lid. Stir the sour cream into the cooked food. Reheat the food if needed before serving. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a large mixing bowl combine goat cheese, white pepper, salt and garlic powder. Stir until smooth. Place the chicken breast halves in a 9x13 inch baking dish. Spoon goat cheese mixture on the breast halves and sprinkle with mozzarella. Top with spaghetti sauce. Bake at 350f for 15 to 20 minutes or until chicken is done.

Add beans, olives, tomatoes, celery, green onions, parsley and dressing to a large mixing bowl. Combine with the tuna and add salt and pepper to taste. Serve on a bed of lettuce leaves. Garnish with hard boiled eggs.

In a skillet brown ground turkey with celery and onions. Drain and set aside. In a large pot boil the beef broth and water. Add in the ground turkey. Stir in the tomato paste. Add in the barley and water. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with a salad and a bun.
Drain the chickpeas, then place in a food processor. Add the remaining ingredients and process until smooth. Serve with warm pita bread.

Combine all ingredients in a large plastic bag. Seal the bag and shake to mix all the ingredients. Marinate for 6 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. Preheat the grill. Grill for 20 minutes until cooked.

Halve watermelon crosswise, scraping seeds out with spoon. Slice into thin rounds. Put watermelon, strawberries and sugar into blender with 3 cups water. Blend until smooth. Strain through strainer into pitcher (discard seeds). Add remaining water and blend with frozen lemonade. Stir in fresh lemon juice and stir in lemon slices. Chill until ready to serve.

Mix together all ingredients in a large plastic bag. Remove chicken from packaging and add to the bag. Shake bag until all the pieces are coated. Place in a baking dish and pour melted butter over chicken. Cover with foil and bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes. Remove foil and bake for 10 minutes more until browned.

Saute onion and bell pepper in a large ovenproof pan over medium-high heat until soft and translucent. Add the eggs and cook, stirring constantly until the eggs are just set (about 4 minutes). Stir in sour cream and cook for 1 minute more. Top each tortilla half with a spoonful of the egg mixture and fold the tortillas in half (like a taco). Place in the hot oven for 10 minutes or until the tortillas are golden brown and the egg mixture is set (watch carefully so the tortillas don't burn). Sprinkle the casserole with grated cheese and bake for 2-3 minutes longer. Serve hot.

Cream butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add eggs and almond extract. Sift in dry ingredients. Fold in cherries. Pour into greased 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Cool completely. Make glaze by beating together powdered sugar and milk. Drizzle over top of cooled cake.
Brown meat drain. Add soup water and milk. Stir in tater tots. Add sliced green beans. Bake uncovered at 350 for 25 minutes. Top with cheddar cheese.

Place beef in 1-qt saucepanadd sauces. Stir to combine and heat over medium-low heat until warmed through. Season with salt as desired. Place on top half of hoagie rollstop each sandwich with cheddar cheese. Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately.

Cream butter and sugar together with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in egg and almond extract until well blended. Stir together the flour, baking soda and salt and add to the butter mixture alternately with water, mixing after each addition until smooth. Stir in the almonds and egg white until blended and then drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees f for 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks and store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 9 x 13 glass pan. Cut a cross in 4 slices of bread and place in bottom of pan. Next layer 4 slices of ham on bread slices in pan, then 4 slices of mozzarella cheese on top of ham slices. Next layer 12 slices of tomatoes on cheese slices, then layer 6 slices of green onions on top of tomatoes. Finally, layer 6 slices of bread on green onions. Pour milk over bread layer. Whisk together 5 eggs, 2 Tablespoons of milk, 1 teaspoon of garlic salt, 1 teaspoon of pepper in a separate bowl. Pour egg mixture over bread mixture in pan. Cover pan with foil and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees. Remove foil for last 15 minutes of cooking to brown top of strata lightly. Remove strata from oven and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake until cheese is melted.

In a small bowl combine oil, lemon juice and sugar. Add artichokesmarinate 30 min. Cook rice as directed. Drain. Toss artichokes, tomatoes, red pepper and parsley with riceadd oil mixture. Stir in capers. Chill at least 1 hour. Makes 6 servings.
Mix all ingredients together and apply to chicken. Let stand at room temperature for at least 1 hour.

Boil water in a saucepan until steamy. Drop in a few eggs at a time and let sit for 2 minutes before removing them with a slotted spoon to cool on paper towels. Once eggs have cooled, whisk until whites are smooth again and then set aside. In a saucepan on medium-high heat, add sugar, water, and a pinch of salt. Bring mixture to a boil, then lower to a simmer and cook until sugar is dissolved. Turn off heat, add in the cinnamon. Place half of the egg whites into the caramel mixture and whisk to combine, then pour back into the pan. Once the egg whites are completely incorporated, turn off the heat, add the remaining whites, and whisk until the mixture is smooth. Once the egg whites are fully incorporated, stir in the pecans into the caramel mixture. Let sit for 2 minutes until the pecans are completely coated by the caramel mixture, then remove the pan from the stove top and place on a cutting board. With a rubber spatula or wooden spoon, scrape the sides of the pan so that the pecan mixture

In a large bowl mix pineapple and orange juices. Mix in gelatin. Refrigerate about 5 minutes. Beat in eggs. Fold in the pineapple mixture. Pour into a 9 inch pie shell and refrigerate for several hours. To serve top with whipped topping.

Blend cream cheese, imitation crabmeat, garlic powder and pepper. Spread about 1 teaspoon of filling on each wonton wrapper. Fold in half and press edges together. Heat 1 inch of oil in a deep-fat fryer to 375 degrees. Fry wontons 3 or 4 at a time for 2 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm with sweet and sour sauce.

Combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom of a 9 inch springform pan. Bake for 5 minutes. Mix cream cheese and fat-free cream cheese with lime juice. Blend in eggs. Add to cheesecake mixture and blend well. Pour mixture into prepared pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Cool completely and chill.

Preheat broiler. Cook wild rice as directed by package instructions. Add corn kernels to a saucepan of boiling water. Cook until tender. Drain and set aside. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add butter. When butter has melted add flour. Whisk until smooth. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Gradually add cream. Bring to a boil. Cook and stir for 1 minute or until thickened. Stir in salt, black pepper and cayenne pepper. Remove from heat. Stir in cooked corn kernels. Gently stir in cooked wild rice. Place in a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake in preheated broiler for 5 minutes or until cheese is bubbly. Serve immediately.
In a skillet over medium heat combine olive oil, garlic and salt. Add green pepper rings to hot pan. Cook 3 minutes then add black pepper. Serve with any entree.

Mix all the dry ingredients together in a small bowl. Add cabbage to a large mixing bowl. Pour the dry ingredients over cabbage. Toss to coat. Add carrots. Add mayonnaise. Toss. Sprinkle with peanuts.

In a small bowl, combine poppy seeds and 1/2 cup water. Cover and let stand for 1 hour. Drain seeds. In a small saucepan, stir together remaining 2/3 cup water and sugar until dissolved. Add onion juice and cider vinegar. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat and add poppy-seed mixture. Stir to blend. Cool completely. In blender, puree until smooth. Strain through a fine-mesh strainer into a large bowl. Discard solids. In small bowl, whisk canola oil, 1/2 cup poppy-seed mixture and remaining 1/4 teaspoon salt until combined. Stir into poppy-seed mixture. Refrigerate until well chilled. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Prepare one unbaked refrigerated pie crust according to package directions. Pour fruit filling into partially baked crust. Place second crust on top of fruit and seal. Using a fork, crimp edges. Cut several slits in the top crust. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving. Store covered in refrigerator.

Cook and drain the chicken. Drain the green chilies. Add the soup and stir. Blend the cream cheese and the hot sauce. Add the creamed mixture to the soup mixture. Stir in the cumin and the garlic. Add the shredded cheese and mix in. Serve with tortilla chips.

Remove stems from spinach. Place in a large bowl. Add ricotta and pepper. Mix until well blended. Divide mixture evenly among four wonton wrappers. Moisten edges of each wrapper with water. Place one wrapper over the other. Press to seal. Place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Spray tops with cooking spray and sprinkle with Parm. Bake at 400 degrees for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Let stand for 1 minute before removing from cookie sheet. Serve hot.
Salmon fillets. Sprinkle salt and pepper over salmon. Mix together all other ingredients in a small bowl. Spread over top of each fillet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

Rinse chicken and pat dry. Place chicken in the centre of the foil. Season with salt and pepper. Place lemon juice, lemon zest and chopped tomato around chicken. Place a couple of olives around chicken. Place two small pieces of garlic in the foil. Place chicken skin side down in the middle of the foil. Place 500 g of potato around chicken. Place a few small pieces of garlic around potato. Tightly close the foil and place in the centre of a pre-heated grill for 10 minutes. Transfer chicken to serving plate. Serve immediately with salad and potato.

Mix bacon with extra virgin oil in a large skillet and saute until crisp and cooked through. Add onions and garlic and saute until tender. Transfer bacon mixture to a large bowl. Add black beans and sauteed vegetables along with all remaining ingredients. Stir well and serve immediately with hot sauce and sour cream as condiments. If you are using a slow cooker, saute everything but the bacon in a skillet or pot and then transfer everything to the cooker and cook on low for about an hour, or until heated through.

Prepare the polenta in a large saucepan according to directions on package. Add salsa and cooked beef and simmer for 10 minutes, stirring often. Spoon into a large bowl and add the prepared polenta and stir well. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased casserole dish. Top with the shredded cheese and bake for about 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly and casserole dish is hot.

Boil yukon gold potatoes until tender. Remove from heat, drain well and set aside. Melt the butter over medium heat, add half-and-half and cook until hot. Add the soft goat cheese until it melts. Add the cooked potato pieces and mix well until they are coated with the buttery sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in the basil.

Drain and rinse oysters. Place oysters on top of teriyaki sauce. Place 2 teaspoons each butter and olive oil on top. Place steaks on top. Bake at 450 degrees for 10 minutes. Remove and place on platter. Serve.

Place all of the ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring mixture to a simmercook 3 minutes or until slightly thickened, stirring frequently. Remove from heatstir in chopped walnuts. Yield 1 cup sauce.

To make the lemonade honey dressing, combine the lemonade concentrate and honey in a large nonmetallic bowl and whisk to blend. Chill until ready to serve. In a large nonmetallic bowl toss the grapes with the dressing until they are lightly coated. Add the watermelon and nectarines to the grapes and toss again. Add the pears to the mixture and toss. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 180c. Beat together softened butter and both sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time until light and fluffy. Add both flours and baking powder. Add half the milk. Mix until combined. Add the rest of the milk. Fold through the chocolates until just combined. Drop the mixture by rounded teaspoons onto the lined baking trays. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until they are firm. They will still be soft when they come out of the oven. Cool on the tray for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.
Peel and cube the potatoes. Place in a large bowl and toss with oil. Sprinkle with cajun seasoning. Place on a cookie sheet and bake for about 25 minutes. Flip halfway through. Serve with ketchup.

In a food processor pulse artichokes until coarsely chopped. Transfer to a large bowl. Add parmesan cheese and thyme leaves. Using a paring knife make 3 deep slits in each chicken breast. Insert one chopped artichoke heart into each slit. Place chicken in a shallow baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover and bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until cooked through.

Slice asparagus spears diagonally into 3 inch lengths. Steam, covered until just tender-about 5 minutes. Drain, and cool under running water. Dry well. Cut slices into pieces about 1 inch long. Arrange spears in a single layer on a baking sheet. Drizzle with dressing. Sprinkle with almonds. Bake in preheated oven until crisp and golden brown-about 15 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large bowl, combine all the dry ingredients and mix together. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt the butter and pour it in with the honey and cinnamon. Stir until the butter and honey have melted and combine the wet and dry ingredients together. Transfer the mixture onto a baking sheet that has been greased with cooking spray and press it down with your hands and a spatula. Bake for about 25 minutes until golden brown and allow it to cool completely before breaking into pieces or cutting into squares and serving. I store it in the refrigerator and it lasts about a week or two before it gets stale. I recommend storing it in the freezer if you want it to last longer because it lasts a lot longer than a week or two!

In a large skillet cook edamame with water and salt for 3-4 minutes or until just tender. Drain and discard the water. In a bowl combine the edamame with the cayenne and cajun seasonings. Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with freshly squeezed lemons. Enjoy!

In a food processor, puree braunschweiger and cream cheese until smooth. Add the onions and process until onions are finely chopped. Add the garlic and process until chopped into very tiny bits. Add the parsley and the chives and process until blended into the mixture. Add the worcestershire sauce and pulse just until combined. Transfer the pate to a bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

Rinse and dry fish. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Dip fish in whisked eggs. Dip in bread crumbs. Place in pan. Bake at 375 for 25 minutes. Meanwhile, heat chicken broth and add mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add cream and mustard. Season with salt and pepper. Cook until sauce is thick. Pour sauce over fish. Garnish with thyme.

Cream the butter and barbecue sauce together in a large mixing bowl. Add in sugar, and beat until well combined. In another bowl whisk together flour, baking soda and spices. Gradually add flour mixture to barbecue sauce mixture and beat until well blended. Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto greased cookie sheets and bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before transferring to wire racks to cool completely.

Bring the champagne and cream to a simmer in heavy medium saucepan. Remove from heat. Beat cornstarch and the other 4 tbsp of brie cheese with electric mixer in medium bowl until smooth. Add cornstarch mixture and beat until smooth. Add champagne mixture in batches. Whisk until smooth. Stir in the remaining brie and the almond extract. Set aside. Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Saute bread cubes 10 minutes or until golden brown and tender. Dip into the chilled fondue and serve with apple and french bread sticks.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Clean tuna and flake it into a bowl. Drain beans. Blend beans with the rest of the ingredients. Pour into 9-inch round ovenproof pan. Bake for about 30 minutes. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Slice eggplants in half lengthwise. Brush both sides of each slice with extra virgin olive oil. Sprinkle salt and pepper on both sides. Place slices on baking sheet. Bake until tender, about 40 minutes. Cool on baking sheet. Preheat grill. Slice peasant bread in half. Place 1 slice of grilled eggplant on one half of the bread. Sprinkle with a little salt. Top with thin slice of mozzarella. Place on grill until golden brown. Repeat with remaining slice of grilled eggplant. Serve on bottom half of peasant bread. Top with basil leaves. Sprinkle with coarse sea salt.

Preheat oven to 425f. Grease pie pan. Fill pie crust with crushed shortbread cookie crumbs (or graham cracker crumbs). Bake pie crust for 8 minutes. Remove crust from oven and spread crumbs evenly in pie pan. Set aside. In large mixing bowl, beat together cream cheese and sugar with electric mixer. Add eggs and beat until well blended. Add frozen orange juice concentrate and blend well. Pour mixture into crust. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until center is set. Cool completely on wire rack. Arrange mandarin oranges in center of pie. Sprinkle with brown sugar to taste. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving. Makes 1 9-inch pie.

Slice carrots into 1/2 inch thick pieces. Mix carrots with 1 cup of the sugar and 1/4 cup of the butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook until carrots are tender, about 30 minutes. Transfer the carrot mixture to a large bowl and stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of butter, the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar and the spices. Stir in the drained pineapple and the cooked pear slices. Pour the mixture into a large baking dish coated with cooking spray. Cover the baking dish with foil and bake until the carrots are tender, about 1 hour. Transfer the cooked carrots to a blender or food processor. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of butter, the remaining 1/4 cup of sugar and the reserved cooking liquid from the pan. Blend until smooth. Transfer the blended carrot mixture back into the pan over medium heat and cook until thickened, about 10 minutes. Stir in the cooked pears and cook for 5 minutes longer. Pour the carrot

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook the garlic until it turns light brown, about a minute. Add the ground chicken and cook until it is no longer pink and browned. Drain the fat from the skillet and set the cooked ground chicken aside for later use. Add the remaining ingredients except the cheese into the skillet and stir constantly over medium heat for about 10 minutes or until the salsa is heated through and the chili powders have melted. Spread the mixture into a greased baking dish and top with the grated cheese. Bake the dish for about 20 minutes or until the cheese has melted and is bubbly. Serve hot with corn tortillas and sour cream, if desired.

Cream together the butter and sugars with an electric mixer. Add the egg and beat until well mixed. Add the dry ingredients to the butter mixture and blend with a wire whisk. Divide the dough into two pieces. Wrap each piece in plastic wrap and chill for 2 hours in the refrigerator. Remove one piece from the refrigerator. Roll the dough into a log about 1/2 inch in diameter. Cut the log into 1/4 inch slices. Shape into a ball and then roll in the remaining raspberry jam. Place the balls of dough about 2 inches apart on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool the cookies on a rack. Place another ball of dough on the back of a spoon and roll in more jam. Continue until all of the dough is rolled into balls. Place the balls on a cookie sheet and repeat the process until all of the dough is used. Bake the cookies for about 10 minutes. Remove from the oven. Place a raspberry on top of the cookie. Roll the cookies in confectioner'

Peel the red potatoes. Cut them into quarters. Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot add the cut up potatoes. Cook the potatoes for about 15 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Remove the potatoes from the skillet. Place the skillet over the stove on high heat. When the skillet is hot add the sea salt. Stir until the sea salt is dissolved. Add the ground black pepper. Stir until the seasoning is dissolved. Add the cut up garlic to the skillet. Cook for about one minute. Return the potatoes to the skillet. Sprinkle the potatoes with the fresh rosemary. Toss the potatoes around in the skillet. Turn the heat on the stove down to low. Cook the potatoes for another 10 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.

Cut off the bottoms of each sprout and discard. Slice each half in half lengthwise and then slice the halves in half again lengthwise to create small rectangles of about 2 inches by half an inch each (about 3 inches total). Place the rectangles on a baking sheet with the flat side facing up and drizzle with about 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle with a little salt and place in the oven for about 25 minutes or until the sprout halves are golden brown and crisp tender. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the honey and lime juice until the honey is dissolved and the sauce is smooth and warm (about 5 minutes). To serve, place a sprout half in each of four bowls and top with a dollop of the sauce and a pinch of the chopped red onion and cilantro.

Preheat the oven to 180°C. Grease a large baking tray. In a bowl beat the eggs together with the icing sugar and kirsch until light and creamy. Beat in the salt and the ground aniseed. Add the flour and beat well until the mixture is smooth. Spoon the mixture onto the tray. Make a well in the middle and add the remaining kirsch. Cook for about 15 minutes or until the cookies are lightly browned on top. Cool the cookies on the tray and then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

Bring the water and sugar to a full rolling boil. Add the cream of tartar. Stir until dissolved. Add the salt. Stir well. Continue cooking for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly. Pour into heat proof container. Pour into heat proof container. Store in the refrigerator or freezer.

Pre heat oven to 350. Grease and flour two 9 inch pans. In a large bowl, cream together oil and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs until well blended. Mix in flour and vanilla. Add bananas and mix well. Pour batter into prepared pans and bake for 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Let cakes cool in pans for 10 minutes and then remove to wire racks. Drizzle with icing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 5-quart oval roaster with nonstick sprayset aside. Combine soup mix and water in a bowl and stir until smooth. Pour over meat and place in the prepared oval roaster. Bake 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until a meat thermometer registers 150 degrees for rare or 160 for medium-rare for the meat is done. Slice meat thinly and serve with au jus on the side.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees f. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat. Coat the bottom of the pan with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Place the veal scallopini in the pan. Cook until browned on both sides and remove to a plate. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon of the oil to the skillet and heat over medium heat. Add the butter and cook until it melts. Add the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the chopped tomatoes and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the oregano and season with salt and pepper. Drain the scallopini and add to the sauce with the wine. Heat through and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from the heat. Serve over the prepared pizza crust. Top each slice with a sprinkling of parsley. Makes 4 servings.

Slice onions and mushrooms. In a frying pan, saute onions in 1/2 tablespoon oil until tender. Add remaining oil and brown mushrooms until tender. Add flour and cook 1 minute. Add soymilk and cook for 1 minute. Add garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Add french-fried onions and green beans. Cook 5 minutes.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Spray the baking sheet with cooking spray. Lay out the broccoli on the baking sheet. Sprinkle the garlic all over the broccoli. Drizzle the teriyaki sauce all over the broccoli. Sprinkle with black pepper. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Put the rice in a saucepan with the water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the sugar, maraschino cherry and vanilla. Divide the mixture between 4 serving dishes and top with the marshmallows. Scatter the almonds and crushed pineapple around the marshmallows. Drizzle the cream on top. Sprinkle the top with the remaining sugar. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. In a large skillet or casserole dish, saute the bell peppers, mushrooms and onion with a drizzle of oil for 5 minutes. Add the diced tomatoes and chicken stock. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Add the chicken and cook for 10 minutes. Add the spinach and stir until it wilts. Add the cheddar cheese and stir until it is completely melted. Stir in the pasta and season with salt and pepper. Transfer to a 9x13 baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through. Uncover and sprinkle with additional cheese. Return to the oven for 5 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Trim the bottoms off the brussel sprouts and potatoes and cut in half lengthwise. Peel the onion and cut into thin wedges. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for about 5 minutes or until they begin to soften and turn translucent. Add the potatoes and the brussel sprouts and cook for another 5 minutes or until the potatoes begin to soften slightly and the vegetables become a little tender. Add the bay leaf and chicken stock and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer until the potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes more or until the vegetables are fork tender. Season with salt and pepper and stir in the parsley. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Mix all the vegetables together in a large bowl. Place in a baking dish. Add the beets and 1/2 teaspoon vinegar to a blender and puree to make a thick paste. Pour the paste over the vegetables. Toss well to coat. Toss with the remaining vinegar. Add the beets and 1/2 teaspoon vinegar to a blender and puree to make a thick paste. Pour the paste over the vegetables. Toss well to coat. Toss with the remaining vinegar. Bake 15 minutes or until tender. Serve hot.

Prepare a charcoal or gas grill for medium heat cooking. Combine soy sauce, green onion, sesame oil, ginger, black pepper and 1/4 teaspoon of kosher salt. Add garlic and marinate the chicken for 10 minutes, turning often to coat evenly with the marinade. Heat grill to medium high heat. Grill chicken for 10 to 12 minutes or until cooked through, turning often to cook evenly. Serve with steamed white rice.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook sausages until brown. Drain on paper towels. In a large bowl, mix together the sausages and margarine. Spread half of mixture evenly on each half of each english muffin. Top with egg and cheese. Spread remaining sausage mixture on top. Fold over and press edges to seal. Cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until egg white is set and yolk is thick.

Cut the top sirloin into 2-inch-long strips. Season with salt and pepper. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown the meat strips. Drain. Transfer to a 3 quart slow cooker. Add the sliced mushrooms and onions. Top with water. Cover. Cook on low 8 to 10 hours or until meat is tender. Remove the lid. Stir the soup with a whisk until it is combined. Add the mustard. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens. Serve with cooked rice. Sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Boil the potatoes in the amount of water necessary to cover them until just tender. Drain them. Peel them and cube them. In a large bowl, mash the radishes and grate the carrot. Mix together the cucumber and onion. Drain and mash the potatoes. Add the other ingredients and mix thoroughly. Serve.

In a small bowl, combine oil, vinegar and dried basil. Mix together well. Add garlic powder and dried parsley. Sprinkle this mixture over the chicken. Place chicken into 4 qt. slow cooker. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Add minced onions. Cover and cook on low for 2-3 hours. Remove chicken and shred. Add back to slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 1-2 more hours. Serve hot or cold. Makes 6 servings.

Mix dates with walnut pieces. Add candied cherries and mix well. Add flour and salt. Add baking powder, sugar and eggs. Beat well. Add vanilla. Pour into greased pound cake pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for approximately one hour. Cool completely. Remove from pan. Decorate with candied cherries if desired.

Melt butter in pan. Add cooked bacon and lightly brown. Spread butter over one piece of bread. Layer with 1/4 slice of tomato and 1/4 slice of cooked bacon. Spread butter over second piece of bread and add remaining tomato and cooked bacon. Top with monterey jack pepper cheese. Cook until cheese is melted on each side.

Preheat oven to 350. In a blender combine eggs, nutmeg, salt, and sugar. Blend until creamy. Add butter and blend. In a medium saucepan heat the water to boiling. Add the rhubarb. Cook until soft (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat. Stir in the egg mixture. Pour into unbaked crusts. Place in the refrigerator to set (about an hour). Top with the whipped cream.

Mix together all ingredients except milk and egg. Pour into a greased 9×13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 minutes. Once done remove from oven and add in beaten egg and milk. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for additional 20 minutes. Serve.

Cook pasta until al dente according to package directions. Drain and keep warm. Cook the chicken in the olive oil until it is white and cooked through. Drain the excess fat from the pan and set aside to cool. In the same pan saute the chopped garlic and lemon juice with the broccoli florets until the florets are slightly wilted and tender. Combine the cooked pasta with the sauteed broccoli mixture and the cooled chicken. Toss and garnish with the basil and ground black pepper to taste. Serve warm with additional grated parmesan cheese if desired.

Remove the tough outer part of the lemongrass stem. Cut lemongrass in half lengthwise and peel the outside of the stem. Cut the stems into 2-inch pieces. Grind the stems in a mortar and pestle until a paste forms. Place the lemongrass paste in a small bowl and stir in the peanut oil. Add the lime rind and the coriander leaves. Thread the chicken pieces onto the skewers. Coat each piece with the lemongrass paste and marinate for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Preheat a barbecue grill to medium-high heat. Grill the chicken for 4-5 minutes per side or until the chicken is cooked through. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter and let it rest for 5 minutes before serving. To make the sauce, add the lime juice and the bird's eye chiles to the peanut oil in a small saucepan. Heat over medium heat until the peanut oil starts to smoke. Immediately remove the saucepan from the heat and pour in the raw sugar. Let the sau

Cook polish sausage according to package directions. Drain and remove casing. Combine sausage and 1 cup of the oil in a small saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir until sausage is browned. Drain. In a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish, layer half of the ziti pasta, half of the sausage mixture and half of the tomato sauce. Repeat layers. Top with remaining ziti, remaining sausage mixture and remaining tomato sauce. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a pitcher combine the tea and the boiling water. Let steep for 5 minutes. Strain through a sieve into a pitcher and add the lemon juice and the oranges. Chill until the mixture is cold. Just before serving add the ginger ale and the honey. Stir. Serve over ice. Garnish with orange slices and a straw.

Add warm water, white sugar, oil, skim milk powder to bread machine pan in recommended order. Set on dough cycle. Check consistency of dough add additional water or flour if necessary. At end of cycle remove dough and knead by hand if desired. Divide into two pieces and shape into loaves. Place in greased pan and let rise until doubled. Bake at 375 degrees F for 50 minutes.

Remove any excess fat from the pork butt. Rub with ginger ale and barbecue sauce. Place in the refrigerator overnight. The next day remove the meat from the refrigerator and let sit out at room temperature for one hour. Remove from refrigerator and place over medium heat. Cook until the liquid begins to reduce. Remove from the heat and cover with aluminum foil to keep warm. Refrigerate until ready to serve.
