Melt butter in a sauce pan over low heat. Add mini marshmallows to the butter. Cook on low heat for 2-3 minutes, or until marshmallows are soft. Add chocolate chips and nuts to the mixture. Stir together until combined. Line a cookie sheet with wax paper. Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Press a mini marshmallow into the center of the cookie. Let cool, then place a toothpick through the marshmallow into the center of the cookie to hold it in place. Cool completely before removing from the cookie sheet.

Add meat and onions to a crock pot. Add bouillon cubes. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste over top. Add 1 cup of dry red wine. Add water. Cover. Cook 2 hours high and 8 hours low. Make a slurry with water and cornstarch. Pour slurry into crock pot. Stir to thicken. Stir in noodles.

Boil dark corn syrup with water for one minute to dissolve sugar and corn syrup. Stir in blanched almonds. Cook 5 minutes or until hardened. Pour onto waxed paper to cool. Once hardened, remove from waxed paper. Roll into small balls with your hands. Melt the blanched almonds by placing them in a skillet over low heat. When they start to crackle, remove from heat and pour over hardened almonds to coat. Refrigerate until firm for several hours before serving.

Rub garlic cloves with salt and pepper and place in a bowl to be crushed by a large spoon or mortar and pestle. In a small bowl mix egg yolk and vinegar together and set aside. Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat and add bacon and cook for 2-3 minutes until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and reserve bacon grease for another use. Add garlic to pan and sauté for 1 minute, until lightly golden and softened. Add bacon grease back to pan and add worcestershire sauce to pan and cook until mixture begins to thicken. Add garlic and vinegar mixture to pan and cook until vinegar is reduced and sauce thickens to your liking. Remove pan from heat and allow sauce to cool slightly (but not too cool as it will thicken more as it cools). Stir in Parmesan cheese until it melts and begins to thicken sauce. Place bacon pieces in a bowl and add lettuce leaves to bowl and toss to coat lightly in bacon grease and then add warm sauce to coat. Garn

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add a little cooking oil if your skillet is not non-stick. Add the jalapenos to the skillet and cook for 1 minute. Add the thyme and stir well to incorporate. Add the chicken to the skillet and cook for 10 minutes, turning frequently. Sprinkle the salt and pepper on the chicken and cook for 1 minute longer. Meanwhile, put the honey and lemon juice in a small bowl and mix to combine. Add this mixture to the pan and cook for 1 minute longer. Serve immediately.

Beat butter with salt, sugar, eggs and milk. Stir in baking powder and then gradually add flour mixture to wet mixture. Stir in cornmeal. Spoon into greased muffin cups or 2 inch round cake pans. Bake in 400 oven for 20 minutes. Test for doneness with toothpick.
Brown meat in a little oil. Drain off fat. In a small bowl, combine all remaining ingredients. Pour over meat. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours. Shred meat. Serve over cooked rice or pasta.

Cream together the butter, sugars and the vanilla. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well with each addition. Then add the flour and the baking powder. Fold in the chocolate and the walnuts. Drop by rounded tablespoons on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for about 10-12 minutes. Cool for about 30 seconds on the cookie sheet before removing the cookies to a wire rack.
Beat eggs until foamy. Add salt and sugar. Beat in mashed banana. Add potato flour. Bake at 350 for 35 minutes.
Place sausage in crock pot. Cook until done. Drain. Shred. In another container mix the cheeses with the rotel. Pour over sausage. Cook on low for 2 hours. Serve with crackers.

In a large saucepan over medium heat combine the oil, garlic and onions and cook until the onions are tender and translucent about 10 minutes. Add the wine and cook until the wine is completely reduced about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and stir in the bacon. Add the beet greens and cook until the greens are just wilted about 2 minutes more. Stir and serve immediately with a drizzle of good olive oil and some freshly ground pepper and salt.

Prepare caramel ice cream topping following package directions. Drizzle half of the ice cream topping over the graham cracker crust. Gently spread to coat bottom and sides. Freeze until firm. Meanwhile, combine pudding and milk following package directions. Gently spread pudding into prepared crust. Set aside six chocolate-covered English toffee bars for garnish. Spread remaining chocolate-covered English toffee bars evenly over top of the filling. Drizzle with remaining ice cream topping. Garnish with reserved chocolate-covered English toffee bars. Cover and freeze for two hours or until firm. Remove from freezer 15 minutes before serving.

Combine all the ingredients in a large resalable plastic bag. Seal the bag and refrigerate for several hours. Remove from the refrigerator 30 minutes before grilling to allow the flavors to blend. Preheat the grill to medium-high heat. Grill the marinated chicken strips until they are thoroughly cooked through and browned. Serve warm.

Steep barley in boiling water for about 12 minutes. Drain, reserving about 2/3 cup water. Combine barley, corn, water, vinegar, basil leaves and 1 tablespoon of the olive oil. Mix well. Chill. Just before serving, add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil. Toss gently to mix. Garnish with the chopped basil leaves. Serve.

Trim any excess fat from the brisket. Place the meat into the crock pot. Pour the honey mustard over the meat. Add the sweet onions to the crock pot. Add the salt-free lemon pepper to the meat. Add the spicy brown mustard to the meat. Pour the bourbon over the meat. Pour the hickory barbecue sauce over the meat. Cook the meat on low for 8 to 10 hours. When the meat is done, shred the meat. Mix the meat with the honey mustard. Put the meat back into the crock pot. Pour the bourbon barbecue sauce over the meat. Cook the meat for 1 1/2 hours. Serve the meat with white rice.

In a large mixing bowl combine rolled oats, golden raisins and chopped walnuts. In another bowl combine brown sugar with honey and mix with cinnamon. Stir in olive oil and vanilla. Pour over the rolled oats. Mix well with a spoon. Press mixture into a lightly greased 12 x 17-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 50 minutes until golden. Cool for 5 minutes and remove from pan. Makes about 10 cups.

Cream margarine and sugar until fluffy. Add eggs and beat well. Add flour, powdered sugar and lemon juice. Mix well. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly. Sprinkle with lemon peel and flaked coconut.

In bread machine pan, place the first five ingredients in order suggested by manufacturer. Select basic bread setting. Choose crust color and loaf size if available. Bake according to bread machine directions. Just before final kneading, add the fresh blueberries if desired.

Remove green stems from berries. Spoon cream cheese into a pastry bag fitted with a large star tip and pipe into each berry. Place a small piece of walnut half into each berry. Place on parchment paper on a cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Combine Splenda and orange flavor in a small bowl and add enough boiling water to make a thin syrup. Brush berries lightly with syrup. Let cool to room temperature, then refrigerate until ready to serve.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onions until tenderadd garlic. Add tomatoes, green peppers, and rotel tomatoesbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer, covered, for 5 minutes. Stir in sauce, and add beef. Cook until meat is no longer pinkdrain. Add shredded cabbagecook 2 minutes longer. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over rice.

Place the dried chiles in a plastic bag. Crush them by pounding them with a meat mallet or rolling them with a rolling pin. Set aside 2 Tablespoons of ancho seeds for later use. In a large heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat, combine the oil with 2 crushed ancho seeds. Cook for 1 minute. Add 4 whole ancho peppers to oil in pan along with garlic cloves, onion and peppercorns. Cook until softened, about 2 minutes. Add the remaining ancho seeds to pan along with oregano and crushed peppercorns. Cook for 1 minute longer. Remove pan from heat. Let mixture cool for 5 minutes then add the meat to the pan. Let marinate for at least one hour, turning the meat occasionally. Marinate for no more than 4 hours as it will begin to toughen the meat. Remove meat from marinade and grill or broil to desired doneness. Remove meat from pan and set aside to cool for 5 minutes. Tear meat into small pieces then add to remaining marinade in pan along with reserved ancho se
Put all the vegetables in a large bowl. Place the dressing in a jar with a tight fitting lid and shake well. Pour over the vegetables. Toss to coat and serve.

In a large saucepan, saute the onion in olive oil until translucent. Add the ginger and cook for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add carrots and simmer until done. Remove from heat and puree in batches in an immersion blender or transfer to a blender. Season to taste with honey and salt. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place squash cut side up on a cookie sheet. Add 1/2 cup water. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool slightly. Remove seeds. Place 1 tablespoon butter and 2 tablespoons brown sugar on top of each squash half. Place back in oven and cook for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Cut the filet into 1-inch thick pieces. Sprinkle each piece with flour and shake off the excess. Sauté in butter until a nice brown color. Add the beef stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook for 30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the mustard and continue cooking for 15 minutes. Stir in the onion and mushrooms. Cook for another 5 minutes. Serve over noodles or rice. Serve with sour cream.

In a large bowl mix butter, flour and seasonings together using a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Shape into a ball. Add milk and mix with a fork until it comes together. Shape dough into two balls. Press each ball into a circle about 10-inches wide on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Flatten dough slightly with your hand to make it thinner (about 1/8-in thick). Bake at 400 degrees for about 10-12 minutes until golden brown on top (dough will be soft). Cut a slit along one side of each crust (about 1/8-in deep). Place a small piece of canadian bacon into each slit. Place a chicken piece on each crust (skin-side down). Sprinkle with swiss cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20-25 minutes until chicken is cooked through.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Melt the butter and add the celery and green onions. Cook and stir for 5 minutes or until the vegetables are tender. Add the orange juice and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, uncovered for 15 minutes or until the liquid is almost absorbed. Stir in the orange slices and the cooked rice and cook for 5 more minutes stirring constantly. Remove the pan from the heat and sprinkle with the slivered almonds and the salt. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Cook meat in large skillet. Drain. Add soup and water. Simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in taco seasoning. Add macaroni noodles. Mix well. Fold in the remaining ingredients. Pour into greased 9- by 13-inch baking dish. Bake at 350f for 30-40 minutes or until heated through.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and lightly flour two 8 inch round baking pans. Combine all ingredients except for the eggs in a large bowl. Beat on low speed with an electric mixer until combined. Beat on medium speed until fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 40 minutes. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes before removing from pan.
In a shallow baking dish, combine mushrooms, shallots, olive oil and vinegar. Season to taste. Cover and marinate for 2 hours. Remove from marinade and serve.

Bring broth to boiling in large saucepan. Stir in tunacook until heated through. Drain in sieve. Meanwhile, heat 2 tbs. of oil in large skillet. Add garlicsauté 30 seconds. Stir in broth mixturebring to boiling. Stir in tuna. Season with cayenne. Cook over medium heat until heated through. Drainplace in large serving bowl. Cook pasta in large pot of boiling salted water 12-14 minutes or until tender. Drainreturn to pot. Stir in 2 tbs. of the remaining 2 tbs. of oil. Stir in parsley. Add pasta mixturetoss well. Stir in tuna mixture. Serve at once.

First prep your veggies by peeling the skin off the cucumbers using a vegetable peeler and remove the seeds with a spoon. You can also slice the peeled cucumbers into thin slices but i prefer to slice them into small cubes (you can make this the night before). Next cut the tomatoes into small cubes and cut the dill into small pieces (i cut mine into small strips). Now youre ready to begin! Toss the cucumber cubes with apple cider vinegar, lemon juice, flax seed oil (if using) and season with salt and pepper to taste. In a separate mixing bowl combine the tomatoes with dijon mustard, garlic clove and fresh dill (if using). Once the tomatoes have been combined with the dijon mustard and garlic clove you can mix the two together and taste for seasoning (i like to add more lemon juice to the tomato mixture if necessary). Enjoy!
Place all ingredients in a blender container. Cover and blend on high speed until frothy. Pour into glasses and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease a 12-cup muffin tin with butter and set aside. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Add the egg and stir. Add the milk and stir. Stir in the chopped strawberries and the rhubarb. Spoon the mixture into the prepared muffin tin and bake in the center of the oven till brown and crusty, about 45 minutes.

Cut off the crust of the bread. Slice it in half. Spread butter or margarine over each slice. Place the slices of bread buttered side up in an ungreased 1 quart baking dish. In a large bowl, beat eggs with milk. Beat in the dry mustard and pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the bread. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes. Serve with French fries and ketchup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a mixing bowl, combine seasoned stuffing mix and parmesan. Stir in garlic. Butterfly each breast half. Spread stuffing mixture evenly over both sides of each breast. Place in a greased 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes or until the breast is cooked through.

Combine all ingredients in jar with tight fitting lid. Shake vigorously. Place fish fillet in baking pan with marinade over it. Cover with lid. Refrigerate overnight. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes until fish is flakey and white throughout. Serve with rice or pasta.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Line 8-inch baking dish with aluminum foil. Place pears in dish. Sprinkle pears with pumpkin spice. Drizzle pears with melted butter. Roast in preheated oven until tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Sprinkle with chopped almonds. Serve warm.

Bake 1 (10 1/2 inch) deep dish pie plate at 375 degrees F 40 to 45 minutes or until crust is golden brown and a knife inserted near center comes out clean. In a large saucepan cook sausage over medium heat until browneddrain off fat and discard. Stir in apples and cook for 1 minute. Pour in sweet potatoes, sugar, flour and cinnamonstir to coat. Add water and bring to a boil, stirring frequently. Reduce heat to medium lowcook uncovered for 20 minutes stirring often. Add butter and serve.

Place the salmon in a baking dish. Pour the dressing over the salmon and top with sliced tomatoes and mushrooms. Bake at 375 degrees F for 25 minutes or until done. Let stand for two minutes before serving.

Place large skillet over medium heat. Add olive oil and butter. Add parsley and lemon juice to the skillet. Add salt. When the mixture begins to boil, add the garlic and green onions. When the mixture starts to boil again, add the shrimp and let cook until the shrimp is pink and opaque. Add the Parmesan and serve.

Melt butter in a shallow 11-in. by 9-in. baking dish. Add leeks. In a large bowl, beat eggs lightly with a fork. Add flour, nutmeg, milk, salt and black pepper. Pour egg mixture over leeks. Cover with foil. Bake in a 350 degree f oven for one hour. Remove foil to brown top.

Peel the ginger root (the easiest way is to cut off the root end of the ginger with a sharp knife, then slice the root to loosen the skin). Cut the skin off the root into thin strips or very thin slices and soak in rice vinegar for 15 minutes or until you have the desired consistency. Drain well on paper towels. Mix in sugar to taste. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for a few days to allow the pickling process to complete. Pickled Ginger will keep in the refrigerator for several weeksjust keep the lid on the container tightly closed to prevent pickling liquid from evaporating.

Toast the dried dates gently in the oven until they are softened slightly and take the edge off the sugar. Place the dates and ginger in a medium bowl and mix together with the butter and sugar until well combined and smooth. Add the flour and the bicarbonate of soda and stir again until the mixture is fully combined and smooth. Add the egg and beat with a fork until well combined. Pour the mixture into the prepared tray and level with the back of the spoon. Cook in the preheated oven for approximately 25 minutes. Check after about 20 minutes as the cooking time may vary depending on the size of your tray. Once cooked, leave the cake in the tray for a few minutes and then turn out onto a serving plate and allow to cool for 5 minutes before serving with a little cream if you like. This cake is also delicious served with a dollop of ice cream.

In a large skillet, melt 1 Tbsp. butter. Add green bell pepper, garlic powder, salt, pepper and mushrooms. Cook until tender. Add tomatoes. Remove from heat. In a large pot, melt 2 Tbsp. butter. Add remaining 4 Tbsp. butter. Add rice. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Add 1 1/2 cups chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low. Add mushroom mixture. Cook, covered, for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Uncovercook until tender. Remove from heat. Let stand 5 minutes. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Thaw spinach in microwave. Cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Chop bacon into small pieces. In large bowl, combine spinach, bacon, brown sugar, onion, jalapeno, vinegar, salt and black pepper. Mix thoroughly. Pour mixture into greased 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Trim bottoms off of each brussel sprout and then cut in half. In a large skillet, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat until the butter is just beginning to brown. Add the yellow onion and sauté for about 3 minutes. Add the cut brussel sprout halves and continue sautéing until they start to brown. Add the balsamic vinegar and cook for about one minute until it bubbles and thickens slightly. Turn the heat to low and add the grated parmigiano. Cook for about one minute more until the parmigiano melts and the liquid is reduced slightly. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper and serve hot. Serves four.

Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F. Place sunflower seeds on a baking sheet and roast for 30-40 minutes or until slightly golden brown. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 10-15 minutes. Place the seeds into the blender or food processor and blend until the seeds are crushed. Add the sunflower oil and blend until the mixture is smooth and creamy, about 15-20 minutes. Add the salt and blend until smooth. Transfer the mixture into a food storage container and store in the refrigerator for up to one week.
Melt butter in saucepan. Add caramel corn ingrediants. Cook on high for 2 minutes. Remove from heat and stir until smooth. Pour over microwave popcorn. Let cool. Store in airtight container.

Combine the cheddar cheese and flour in a small bowlstir well and set aside. In a separate large bowl combine the eggs and milkbeat well with a wire whisk. Add the ham and stir in the cheddar mixture and the salt and pepper. Pour the egg mixture into the pie shell and bake for 45 minutes or until set.

Pour the vodka and lime juice into a shaker half-filled with ice cubes. Shake well. Strain into a highball glass almost filled with ice cubes. Top with cranberry juice cocktail. Float a lime wheel on top of the drink, and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line a 9x9 pan with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, combine garbanzo beans and granulated sugar and mash together with a fork until very smooth. Add oil and vanilla extract and stir until well combined. In a large bowl combine beans mixture, eggs, baking powder and salt. Stir in ground cinnamon. Fold in old fashioned oats and semisweet mini chocolate chips. Spoon batter into prepared pan. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool completely before slicing and serving.

Mix together olive oil and apricot jam. Put the pork cutlets in a 10-inch ovenproof skillet and sprinkle with the breadcrumbs. Cook in the oven for 15 minutes. Remove skillet and add the stock. Brush the cutlets with the apricot sauce and place in the oven until the cutlets are light brown. Serve over rice.

In a large saucepan over medium-high heat, melt the butter. Add the onion, mushrooms, carrot, and thyme, and saute until the onion is just translucent, about 4-5 minutes. Add the broth and mashed potatoes. Stir until potatoes are mostly dissolved and broth is smooth. Add the turkey and bring to a simmer. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook, stirring occasionally, until heated through, about 10 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Cut 3 tortillas in half. Lay one half in the bottom of a greased 8x10 baking pan. Sprinkle the top half generously with the crumbled Monterey Jack cheese and cover with the other half of the tortillas, buttered side down. Arrange one chicken breast on the top half of the tortillas in the pan. Sprinkle half the green pepper and half the onion over the top half of the tortillas. Layer the remaining 3 tortillas in the pan, buttered side up. Sprinkle the remaining Monterey Jack cheese on top. Pour the cream mixture over the top half of the tortillas. Cover with the remaining 3 tortillas. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle the top of the casserole with the remaining green pepper and onion before serving. Serve with the hot sauce on the side.

In a shallow pan or bowl combine the eggs substitute, milk and spices. Add bread cubes and mix well. Let soak for at least two hours or overnight. In a skillet or griddle over medium heat cook the cubes until golden brown on both sides. Drain the cubes on paper towels. Serve warm with syrup or jam.

In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine the cream cheese and dressing. Fold in the black olives. Pour into a 4-quart casserole dish that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Place a layer of parsley over the top of the filling. Refrigerate until serving time. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before serving. Serve with crackers or toasted bread.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Lightly grease a 15x10 inch pan. In a large mixing bowl combine the crumbs, flour, baking powder and condensed milk. In another bowl cream the margarine, add the coconut and nuts and mix well. Gradually add the dry mixture to the wet mixture, blending until well combined. Press into pan, top with additional coconut and nuts if desired. Bake for 20-22 minutes or until lightly browned on top. Cool before cutting into squares.
Put steaks in ziploc bag with all the ingredients. Marinate for 24 hours. Remove steaks from bag. Grill over medium heat for 5 minutes per side. Slice and serve.

Drain the beef. Add all the ingredients except the breadcrumbs and stir well. Pour the meat mixture into the hollowed out peppers. Add the breadcrumbs. Place the stuffed peppers in a baking dish and add a little water in the bottom. Sprinkle with the remaining coarse salt and bake in a moderate oven for about an hour or until the peppers are soft. Serve with lemon slices.

Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the curry paste and cook until fragrant. Add the beans and stir-fry for 2 minutes. Add the shrimp and cook for 1 minute. Add the stock and fish sauce and cook until the liquid has almost evaporated. Add the sugar and cook until the sauce is thick and glossy. Taste and adjust the seasoning. Serve hot.

Cut breast in half lengthwise and place between two sheets of wax paper. Using a meat pounder, flatten to about 1/8 inch thickness. Place a slice of bacon and a slice of cheese on top. Roll up tightly. Secure with toothpicks. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Place stuffed breast in skilletcook 6 minutes on each side or until juice runs clear when juice is pierced with a fork. Place on a platter and garnish with parsley.

Prepare limeade according to package directions. Prepare lemonade mix. Combine all the ingredients in a punch bowl or large pitcher. Add limeade concentrate to the bowl or pitcher just before serving to prevent it from over-concentrating the punch. Serve in large plastic cups or mugsgarnish with lime slices if desired.

Combine all ingredients for the filling in a large bowl. Spoon into 8 inch pie shells. Bake at 425 degrees for 1 hour or until set. If making the custard filling, beat the egg and milk in a small bowl. Stir into the filling mixture. Pour into the prepared pie shells. Bake at the same temperature for about 20 minutes. Let cool for about 15 minutes. Serve.

In a large bowl, beat the eggs and milk together until blended. Add the remaining ingredients and beat until blended and smooth. Pour into a 9x13 sprayed pan and bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Serve warm topped with whipped cream and fruit.

Combine all ingredients except for the shrimp in a shallow bowl. Add the shrimp and stir until well coated. Heat a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shrimp and cook for 3 to 4 minutes on each side. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with sauce from pan. Add a little butter if you like.

Mix tapioca with water. Microwave on high for about 2 minutes until tapioca is clear. Add sugar and cook on high for another minute. Add water and lemon juice and cook on high for another minute. Add cinnamon. Add berries and sour cream. Pour into prepared pastry and bake at 450 degrees for about 35 minutes. Cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 180c (160c fan forced). Grease and line 22cm x 30cm tray. In a small saucepan, melt the copha and butter together and set aside. In a large saucepan, melt the golden syrup and condensed milk together and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the biscuit crumbs and slivered almonds together and set aside. In the large saucepan over low-medium heat, add the condensed milk and golden syrup mixture and stir continuously for 2 minutes or until combined and smooth. Remove from the heat and add the copha mixture and stir to combine. In the large saucepan, stir the biscuit and almond mixture into the condensed milk and golden syrup mixture until evenly combined and then spread evenly into the greased and lined tray. Refrigerate for 15 minutes, then cut into 15 bars and store in an airtight container for up to 1 week or until you need them.

Mix the egg with the mayonnaise and seasonings, then fold in the zucchini and onion. Add the bread crumbs and fold in again, gently. Fill a greased muffin tin with the mixture and bake at 400 for about 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve warm with cocktail sauce or a side of tartar sauce.

Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). Lightly grease 8 muffin tins with the vegetable oil spray. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the whisk attachment or whisk by hand, beat together the butter, 2/3 cup (150g) of the sugar and the egg until smooth and creamy. Add the dry ingredients to the bowl of the mixer and beat until combined. Beat the orange juice, 1/2 cup (125g) of the remaining sugar, the zest of the orange and the vanilla extract until smooth. Add the orange mixture to the dry ingredients and beat until smooth. Divide the batter evenly among the muffin tins (about 1/3 cup [80ml] for each). Place the muffin tins on the middle rack of the oven and bake until the puddings are puffed and golden brown on top, 15 to 20 minutes. Cool the muffins for 10 minutes before serving with the orange cocoa sauce. In the bowl of
Mix first four ingredients in sauce pan. Boil one minute. Remove from heat. Stir in oats. Add remaining ingredients. Drop onto wax paper and let cool.

Preheat the oven to Gas mark 4. Beat the softened butter and the brown sugar with the eggs in a bowl until pale and creamy. Sift together the plain and self-raising flours and mix with the spices. Add the spiced flour mixture and the treacle to the butter and beat until smooth. Spoon into a greased and lined loaf tin and smooth the top with the back of a wooden spoon. Bake for about an hour until firm and golden. Leave in the tin to cool.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Add onions and cook and stir until softened and lightly browned, about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, heat water in a saucepan over medium heat and add 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon black pepper. Bring water to a boil and add all of the corn and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Transfer the onions and corn with the broth to the blender and puree until smooth. Transfer the puree to a medium bowl and add the eggs and stir to combine. Add the cheese and stir until cheese melts and mixture thickens slightly. Pour the batter into an ungreased baking dish and bake in the preheated oven until set and golden brown on top, about 45 minutes.
In a microwave-safe dish, combine vegetables. Heat on HIGH for 12 minutes. Let stand 2 minutes before serving.

Heat the milk in a heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-high heat to scalding (not boiling). Remove from the heat and add the brown sugar, stirring to dissolve. Slice the gingerroot into thin strips or grate the gingerroot if you have a grater that can handle it (you can also use 1 teaspoon of ground ginger). Put the gingerroot into a large tea strainer or cheesecloth-lined sieve. Pour the hot milk mixture over the gingerroot and allow to steep for 5 to 15 minutesthe longer the better. Heat the mixture again to scalding (not boiling) in the saucepan. Meanwhile, in a medium bowl whisk together the egg yolks with the honey until smooth and blended. Pour the hot milk mixture over the egg yolks in a thin stream while whisking constantly. Return the egg-honey mixture to the saucepan and cook over medium heat whisking constantly until it reaches 160 degrees F (71 degrees C). Remove from the heat and strain the custard through the gingerroot into a

In a medium saucepan heat the skim milk and honey on medium-low heat, stirring constantly until honey is dissolved. Stir in the ginger and cloves. Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring constantly. Add the unsweetened cocoa and vanilla extract. Stir until smooth. Remove from the heat. Ladle the hot chocolate into two cups and top with a dollop of whipped cream. Sprinkle each cup with ground red pepper. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Add spaghetti and saute for 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and saute for 2 minutes more. Add turkey and cook for 2 minutes. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add sour cream and parsley. Heat through. Top with fresh parsley. Serve over pasta.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Toss to coat. Serve with carrots.

Place oil in skillet and brown chops lightly on each side. Drain well on paper towels. Mix together soup mix and broth in saucepanadd water, vegetables, rice. Bring mixture to a boil over high heatstir in chops. Coverreduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Serve in warm bowls.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and coat it with cooking spray. Add the oil and butter to the skillet and heat until bubbles form around the edge. Add the mushrooms and cook, stirring occasionally, until they begin to soften. Add the garlic and chives and cook until softened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

In a medium saucepan over medium-high heat, combine the instant tea with the sugar and cinnamon. Stir until the sugar is completely dissolved. Pour in the milk and cook until the mixture starts to bubble and steam and the cinnamon pieces are floating on the surface. Remove from the heat and let cool slightly. Pour the mixture into serving glasses or mugs. Top with whipped cream.

Brown onion and garlic in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the passata, turmeric powder and garam masala. Mix in water. Simmer over medium heat until onion is tender. Add a little salt if needed. Remove from heat. Blend the mixture in a food processor. Return to the saucepan and simmer over low heat. Stir in the oil and adjust seasonings. Serve over rice.

Combine shallot, 2 tbsps butter and 2 tbsps paprika. Cook 1 min on medium heat. Add tomatoes and cook for 15 minutes. Stir in stock. Season with pepper and salt. Cook for 15 min. Blend with a hand blender. Transfer to saucepan. Melt remaining 4 tbsps butter and saute onions. Add onions to tomato mixture. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Season with pepper and salt. Mix in sour cream. Cook for 5 minutes. Add 2 tbsps paprika.

In an ungreased baking dish, spoon one and one-half cups of refried beans. Arrange one and one-half tortilla on top of the refried beans. Spread one-half cup of enchilada sauce over the top of the tortilla. Sprinkle with one and one-half cups of shredded cheddar cheese. Cover and bake at 350 degrees f for one hour. Serve with additional enchilada sauce and shredded lettuce. This can also be made as an enchilada casserole.

Trim stems and cut into florets. Place the broccoli into a pot and cover with water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Stir in the pepper and garlic. Simmer until the pepper is tender. In a small bowl, mix the oil and the dark soy sauce. Stir this into the broccoli. Remove from the heat and sprinkle with salt. Enjoy.

Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add chicken and cook 10 minutes per side. Add mushrooms and saute 2 minutes. Turn off heat and sprinkle with garlic salt. Stir in soup and add sour cream. Mix together. Cover with swiss cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 160 C/gas 3. Put 1/4 cup of sugar in a small pan and add 2 tablespoons of water. Heat gently until the sugar has dissolved and turn off the heat. Put 1/3 of the cream into a bowl and beat until it holds soft peaks. Put 3 tablespoons of the lemon juice into a bowl and add 3 tablespoons of sugar. Mix together. Beat in 3 tablespoons of lemon zest and then beat in 1/3 of the cream. Pour into a bowl and refrigerate for 15 minutes. Repeat with 2 more batches. Whip up remaining 1/4 cup of cream and fold into the bowl with the lemon cream. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Spoon into individual bowls and serve with shortbread biscuits.

Melt the butter in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add the scallions, parsley and garlic. Cook for about 5 minutes over medium heat until the scallions are tender. Add the white wine. Increase the heat to high and cook for about 4 minutes or until the liquid has evaporated. Add the scallops and cook for about 3 minutes. Add the salt, pepper and cream. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium low and simmer for about 5 minutes or until the sauce has thickened. Serve the sauce over the scallops.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a large bowl beat the eggs with a fork until well combined. Add the cheese and beat until well combined. In a separate bowl combine the chocolate cake mix and the brown sugar. Add the egg and cheese mixture and beat until well combined. Form the dough into a ball and flatten the ball with a rolling pin. Roll the dough out 1/8 inch thick. Cut the dough with cookie cutters. Place the cookie dough on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 15 minutes until the edges are set. Remove the cookie sheet from the oven. Let the cookies sit on the cookie sheet for 1 minute. Transfer the cookies to a rack and let the cookies cool completely. Repeat the process until all the dough is used up. Makes 4 dozen.

Remove the stems from the tomatoes with a knife & scrape out any seeds from inside & discard. Place tomato halves on a plate & sprinkle with some of the breadcrumbs & cheese mix & press to stick. Add a little more breadcrumbs & cheese mix & press again to stick to each half. Heat some olive oil in a frying pan over a medium heat & saute gently until golden brown on both sides. Serve immediately.

Drain pineapple chunks from canned pineapple, reserving juices. Peel pineapple chunks and cut into bite-sized pieces. Drain mandarin orange segments from juice and chop into pieces. Sprinkle each serving with sour cream and 1/2 tablespoon chopped pineapple chunks. Top with 1/2 cup chopped mandarin orange segments. Garnish with bananas and flaked coconut. Place lettuce leaf on the plate and place the salad on the lettuce leaf. Decorate with maraschino cherries around the edge of the plate.

Saute onion in hot oil. Add pork. Cook until brown. Add soy sauce to cover pork. Cook 3 minutes. Add green onion and stir. Add corn starch to 1 cup chicken broth. Bring to boil. Pour into pan. Stir well. Add ground ginger. Cook 5 minutes. Add pork mixture. Add remaining broth. Cook 15 minutes. Add chow mein noodles. Cook 3 minutes. Add cabbage. Cook 2 minutes. Serve hot.

Heat olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Saute until onion is softened. Add baby spinach. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Whisk in creme fraiche until smooth. Season with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Stir in the feta. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Remove chickens' necks and giblets from cavity. Rinse chickens inside and out under cold water. Drain well and pat dry with paper towels inside and out. Place chicken breasts down and cut out wings and drumsticks to make chickens flat. Place chickens flat-side down into a 9x13-inch baking dish and season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with 1/3 cup of dry bread crumbs and drizzle with 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup of romano and 1/4 cup of parsley. Place chickens in oven and bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until fully cooked through. Remove from oven and serve.
Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain. Add remaining ingredients. Mix lightly. Cover. Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.

Cut slices of white bread into strips 4-5 inches long by 1/4 inches thick. Place strips on greased cookie sheet or in shallow pan. Lightly coat strips with margarine or butter. Sprinkle with onion or garlic salt and parmesan cheese. Bake 20-25 minutes at 400 degrees until browned. Serve warm.

Beat the yolks in a large bowl until they are pale yellow (do not separate). Slowly add the milk. Stir in the maple syrup and salt. When the mixture has cooled slightly, add the beaten egg whites. Beat on high speed until stiff peaks form. Transfer the mixture to a clean bowl and refrigerate for at least one hour or overnight. Remove the custard from the refrigerator about 15 minutes before serving. Gently spoon the custard into 4 cups or ramekins or individual dessert glasses. Garnish with whipped cream if desired. Serve with maple syrup for dipping.

In a large skillet cook and crumble the ground beef. Add the green pepper and the mushrooms. Cook over medium heat until brown. Drain the fat. Add the ketchup and relish. Stir in the mustard and the Worcestershire. Fold in the cheddar. Stuff the hot dog buns with the mixture.

In a medium bowl combine all of the ground pork mixture. Add in the green onion and hoisin sauce. Mix together well. Divide the filling into 16 equal portions. Place one portion of filling in center of each wrapper. Fold up the dumpling wrapper around the filling and pinch the edges to seal. Place 4 dumplings at a time in the hot oil. Fry until golden brown on both sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with hoisin dipping sauce.

Bake or broil chicken until done, about 5 minutes per side. Let cool slightly before cutting into cubes. In a small bowl combine vinegar, soy sauce and brown sugarmix well. Add oil to vinegar mixture and whisk well to blend. Pour over the cubes and allow to marinate at least 1 hour and up to 1 day in the refrigerator. When ready to assemble the sandwiches, spread the bottom half of the bun with butter and place the roll top down on the counter to form a sandwich. Add a layer of the chicken cubes to the bottom half and top with half the Monterey Jack Cheese. Add the rest of the roll top up and cut the sandwich in half.

Pour the milk into a large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat. Stir in the butter. Blend in the flour. Cook, stirring constantly for 1 minute. Stir in the creamy sauce until smooth. Stir in the dried parsley flakes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add the cubed chicken. Cook, stirring occasionally for 10 minutes. Add the penne rigate. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the parmesan. Serve.

Saute onion and garlic in oil until softened. Add pepper and cayenne. Saute until fragrant. In food processor, pulse the bread crumbs with the bacon until they are crumbly. Add the crumbled bacon and the sauteed vegetables to the oyster shell and fill with oyster. Dust with the crumbled cheese and broil until the cheese is melted and golden. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Saute the onions and mace in the butter until the onions are tender. Whisk in the flour until smooth and cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in the broth while gradually adding the milk to make a smooth paste. Cook over moderate heat for 20 to 30 minutes until it thickens slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir the egg yolks with the parsley until blended. Stir into the hot soup to thicken the sauce. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat melt butter with orange liqueur and orange rind. Add pecans and toss until coated. Remove from heat and add salt. Stir until coated evenly and cool completely on wax paper. Store in an airtight container for up to one week.

Sprinkle the meat all over with the cumin, pepper and brown sugar. Mix the vinegar and water together in a small bowl. Dip the meat in the cider mixture. Grill the meat for about 10 minutes per side for medium rare. The meat should be juicy and tender. Serve with your favorite side dish.

Preheat the broiler. Slice a tomato in half lengthwise, then place the cut-side down in the center of a slice of whole wheat bread. Place a slice of swiss cheese over the top of the tomato half. On the other slice of whole wheat bread place another slice of swiss cheese with a slice of yellow bell pepper in the center. Then place another slice of whole wheat bread on top, with the pepper/cheese side facing down. Spread the margarine over the top half of the whole wheat bread tops. Broil for 5 minutes or until the bread is golden brown. Serve immediately.

Boil carrots and peel. Melt butter in a large frying pan. Saute the carrots and onion until softened. In a medium bowl combine flour and dry mustard. Add milk gradually until blended. Pour into carrots in frying pan and heat until thickened. Add salt and pepper. Pour mixture into a one-quart square casserole and sprinkle with cheese. Bake until the top is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly. Serve with fresh bread crumbs.

Rub chickens with olive oil and seasonings. Grill until juices run clear. Meanwhile, in a small bowl combine apricot preserves with soy sauce and water. Set aside. In another small bowl combine ginger, scallions and sugar. Set aside. Serve chickens with reserved apricot preserves and ginger mixture on the side as dipping sauces.

Mix all ingredients together well. Form into small meatballs about the size of a golf ball. Place on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350 degrees f for about 30 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with pasta and/or spaghetti sauce.

Preheat the oven to 450 degrees f. Remove the pheasants from the refrigerator and season liberally with salt and pepper. Dip each pheasant into the egg and then into the breadcrumb mixture. Place pheasants breast side down in the roasting pan and roast until the internal temperature reaches 165 degrees f, about 35 to 45 minutes. Let the pheasants stand for at least 5 minutes before serving. Drizzle the pan juices over the birds and serve. Sprinkle the pheasants liberally with tarragon and thyme and serve immediately.

Melt butter and olive oil in saucepan over medium heat. Stir in edamame and corn until heated through. Reduce heat and stir in onion. Cook for about 5 minutes or until onion is tender. Stir in basil and sherry wine. Season with salt and pepper. Serves 4.

Put plums and water into a large, heavy saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook until plums are soft. Drain plums and reserve liquid. Dissolve sugar and lemon juice in reserved liquid. Add ginger and rind. Cook over low heat until liquid is reduced to a thick syrup. Pour into sterilized jars and seal. Process for 10 minutes. Store covered at room temperature for up to one week or refrigerate for up to three months.

Melt the butter. Add the peanuts, peanut butter chips, sweetened condensed milk and marshmallows. Mix well. Spread into a greased pan. Bake at 275 for 20 minutes. Let cool before cutting into squares.

Cover and stir all ingredients into a large saucepan and cook over medium heat for approximately 8 minutes stirring frequently. Remove from heat and pour onto a large plate to cool. Drain well and spread out on paper towels. Store in airtight container in refrigerator for several days. Makes about 16 servings.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet and brown the carrots and onions. Add the water and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 20 minutes. Add the sour cream and milk and bring to a simmer. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Add the chicken and simmer for about 30 minutes. Serve with rice. This can be made with bone-in cuts as well.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, beat the eggs and milk until light and fluffy. Stir in the brown sugar and beat until combined. Add the crackers and coconut and stir until well combined. Stir in the baking powder and all-purpose flour. Press the mixture firmly into the bottom of a greased 11 by 7 inch baking pan. Bake for about an hour or until the cracker squares are brown and set. Transfer the cracker squares to a wire rack and let them cool for at least 2 hours before cutting into squares. (If you want the cracker squares to be less crispy, you can refrigerate them for about an hour before cutting them into squares.) Serve the cracker squares with ice cream or a scoop of vanilla frozen yogurt.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute poblano pepper halves until tender. Remove from heat. Spoon 1 cup enchilada sauce into each prepared poblano. Top each poblano with 1/2 cup diced potatoes and 1/2 cup chorizo. Cover with aluminum foil and bake 15-20 minutes or until heated through. Remove from oven and top with slices of Monterey Jack cheese. Bake 5 more minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with additional sauce.

Slice the lemon into 4 wedges. Season the salmon with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Heat the unsalted butter & oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms & saute for 3 minutes. Add the wine & lemon juice to the skillet. Bring to a boil. Add the salt & freshly ground black pepper to taste & the lemon wedges. Reduce the heat to medium-low. Add the salmon & cook for 2 minutes. Remove the pan from the heat & keep warm. In a separate pan over low heat melt the butter. Add the heavy cream & bring to a simmer. Add the fresh tarragon & simmer for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat & add the salt & freshly ground black pepper to taste. Stir in the lemon juice. Place the mushrooms & salmon over the tarragon sauce. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Peel potatoes and dice into 1/2-inch cubes. Put cubes into crock pot, add evaporated skim milk, cream of mushroom soup, black pepper to taste. Add slices of pimiento and onions (dice or slice to preference). Cook until tender 4-5 hours on low heat setting or 2 1/2 hours high heat setting. Add 8 ounces low-fat shredded cheddar cheese to the crock pot when the potatoes are tender to serve.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees Celsius. Beat the butter until it is creamy. Gradually add the sugar. Add the egg yolks one by one. Mix well. Sift the flour, baking powder, almonds and the vanilla into the butter mixture. Fold in the egg whites. Spread the batter in a greased round baking pan. Bake for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. Let the cake cool. Cut the strawberry jam into small cubes. Cut the butter into small cubes. Mix the butter with the strawberry jam. Fill the cream with the butter and strawberry jam. Top the cake with the cream. Decorate the top with the almonds.

Peel and cut potatoes into medium sized cubes. Place cubes into saucepan and cover with water. Bring to boil and cook for 10 minutes or until potatoes are tender when pierced with fork. Drain well and place into large bowl with margarine. Add green peppers and onion and stir in onion soup mix until thoroughly combined. Serve hot as a side dish or with your favorite meat.

Cook the peas according to directions on package. Drain thoroughly. Add the onion, eggs and mayonnaise. Season with salt and pepper. To serve, put in a bowl or platter and garnish with a slice of pimiento.

Melt the butter in a skillet and saute the chopped onions until tender. Add the condensed soups and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the milk and half and half. Cook until bubbly and thickened. Add the crabmeat and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the dry sherry and cook until it is absorbed. Add salt and pepper to taste. Pour into bowls and serve. Makes 4 to 5 servings.

Prepare pomegranate seeds. In a glass, combine the orange juice, pomegranate seeds, 1 tablespoon pomegranate syrup and 1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice. Add strawberry. Serve in martini glasses over ice. Garnish with mint leaves.
Fill a cocktail glass with crushed ice. Add all the ingredients together with the ice. Stir well. Garnish with lime twist.
Wash herbs well. Place herbs in a blender. Add sugar and blend to form a smooth paste. Add balsamic vinegar slowly to taste. Serve with lamb or chicken or as a dip with toasted baguette.

Cook 16 hamburgers. Place in a greased 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle 1 cup mild cheddar cheese over the hamburgers. In a small bowl, beat 2 eggs. Pour into the pan. Add 1 cup skim milk. Mix well. Add 1/2 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Add 1/2 cup mild green chilies. Top the mixture with 1 cup mild cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease and line a 9 x 13 pan with parchment paper. Beat together butter and sugars. Beat in eggs and orange extract until smooth. Gradually mix in dry ingredients until smooth and no streaks remain. Fold in orange zest and juice. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely before cutting into squares. Dust with powdered sugar. These bars are best served warm. Enjoy!

Slice the onions thinly. Put them in a bowl. Sprinkle with the sugar. Add the salt and pepper. Put a few drops of oil into the onions. Stir to combine. Add the self-raising flour. Mix in the onions. Divide the mixture into 12 balls. Flatten the balls into small patties. Heat the remaining oil in a large frying pan. Fry the patties until golden brown on both sides. Serve with a green salad. Makes 12 servings.

Boil some water in a pot and drop in the shrimp. Cook for 2 minutes. Remove from water and dry with paper towels. In a skillet melt the olive oil over high heat. Add the garlic and spices and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add the lime juice and stir to combine. Add the shrimp and cook until heated through and pink. Serve with rice or french fries and salad.

Add a little water to the pan and boil the carrots for a few minutes until just tender. Drain. Then add the water and the rest of the ingredients (except the parsley) to the pan. Cook for about 2 minutes stirring constantly. Sprinkle with parsley just before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray 12-cup muffin tin with nonstick spray. Divide 1/4-inch prosciutto slices among 12 prepared cups. Press down to make a rectangle around the bottom of each cup. Top each rectangle with 1 tablespoon olive oil, 1 tablespoon melted butter, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, 1/3 cup mixed greens (like arugula or watercress) and 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar. Divide 4 ounces fresh mozzarella into 12 equal portions. Press each portion of mozzarella into a ball with your fingers. Place each ball of mozzarella in the center of the prosciutto rectangle and fold over to form a triangular pouch. Use toothpicks to secure each pouch into place (a bit of prosciutto will stick out from each side). Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until bubbling at edges of pouches. Remove from ovenplace pouches

Wash the cauliflower well. Trim the ends. Cut the cauliflower in small florets. Put the florets in a bowl. Add the margarine to the cauliflower. Mix well. Put the floret mixture into a baking dish. Mix the italian seasoned breadcrumbs with the garlic powder and oregano. Sprinkle the mixture over the top of the cauliflower. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 to 35 min.

Peel radishes and dice them into small pieces. Cut yellow bell peppers into thin strips. Finely chop carrots. In a medium bowl, add the radishes, yellow bell peppers, carrots, and white wine vinegar. Season with sugar and toss well to coat the vegetables. In a small bowl, whisk the mustard oil, mustard seed, dill, salt and pepper. Add the mixture to the vegetables. Toss well to coat the vegetables with dressing. Chill for at least an hour to allow the flavors to blend.

In a large saucepan, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add sausagecook 5 minutes or until brown. Add onioncook 8 minutes or until softened. Add carrotscook 2 minutes. Stir in seasoning. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer 10 minutes or until kale is tender. Stir in ditalinicook 5 minutes or until tender. Ladle into 4 bowls. Top with parmesan cheese if desired. Serve with additional parmesan cheese, if desired.

Heat the pine nuts and cumin seeds in a dry pan until they smell fragrant, then add the vegetable stock and the couscous. Bring to the boil and simmer for 5 mins or until the couscous is cooked and the liquid has absorbed. Stir in the red onion and then the chicken. Place a sheet of kitchen paper over the surface of the couscous to prevent the red onion from turning the couscous green. Once the chicken is cooked and the liquid has absorbed into the couscous, stir in the dried apricots and sultanas and add the fresh mint. Place the couscous into a large bowl and cover it with the french dressing. Mix well and serve.

Season fillets evenly with salt and black pepper. Place fillets in a 9x13 inch glass baking dish. Pour dressing over fillets until they are covered completelycover dish with plastic wrap. Place in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork. Serve immediately garnished with sliced mushrooms.
Wash and dry melons. Remove seeds. Cut melons into balls. Place in blender or food processor. Add lime juice. Blend until smooth. Stir in yogurt. Serve.

Bring a pot of water to the boil. Add the fish fillets and cook for 3 mins until just cooked through. Drain and set aside. Heat a wok or frying pan over a high heat. Add the vegetables and stir-fry for 1 minute until bright in colour. Add the fish fillets and cook for 1-2 minutes until warmed through. Drain. Add the sauce and stir-fry for 1 minute until warmed through. Add the noodles and stir-fry until heated through. Serve immediately.

Cover a medium saucepan with water. Bring to a boil. Add beanscook for 5 minutes. Drain. Heat margarine in a large skillet. Saute shallots until translucent. Add green beanssaute until crisp tender, about 3 minutes. Add chicken brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatsimmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes. Stir in salt. Sprinkle with Parmesansimmer for 1 minute. Serve.

In shallow dish mix the buttermilk with the flour. Dip each fish fillet into the buttermilk mixture, then coat the fish with the cornmeal mixture. Shake off the excess cornmeal. In a heavy skillet or deep fryer cook the fish in the hot vegetable oil until golden brown and cooked through, about 5 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with tartar sauce on the side.

Hull strawberries and cut in half. In a small bowl, mix together the sugar and sour cream. Stir in the strawberries. In a large bowl, beat the whipped topping until it is fluffy. Fold into strawberry mixture. Spoon into serving dishes. Garnish with strawberry halves if desired. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Add water to cover rice and salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook until rice is tender. Add mushroom and onion. Cook until soft. Add eggs and cream cheese. Pour into greased 1 1/2-quart casserole dish. Spread with evaporated milk. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.
Melt chocolate in double boiler. Stir in water, splenda and milk. Remove from heat and add rest of ingredients. Stir till blended. Pour into 6 mug sized cups. Top with whipped cream if desired.
Boil spaghetti according to instructions. Fry bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Toss together all remaining ingredients. Toss. Taste and add more pesto if necessary. Serve.

Bake 1 9-inch square cake pan (13x9) of biscuit doughcool. Cut dough into 16 squaresset aside. In large bowl, beat eggs until thickstir in onion, green pepper and red pepperset aside. In large saucepan, cook bacon over medium heat until crispdrain on paper towels. Increase heat to highadd eggs and stir until eggs are set. In each biscuit square, layer half of the bacon, half of the onion mixture, half of the red and green peppers, half of the cheddar cheese and half of the colby cheesesprinkle with paprika. Fold over each square to make an envelope. Place 1 envelope on top of each biscuit squarepress to seal. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until heated through and biscuits are golden brown. To serve: cut each envelope down the middle to opensprinkle with parsley.

To roast red peppers: place over an open flame or under broiler until charred. Wrap in foil and let cool. Peel and remove stem. In food processor, blend chickpeas until smooth. Add red peppers and blend until smooth. Add feta and blend until smooth. Transfer to a bowl. Stir in hot red pepper sauce and pepper. Garnish with pita chips and serve with pita wedges and/or vegetables.

Bring coconut milk to a boil in a medium pan, whisking frequently to prevent burning or scorching. Add crushed red pepper flakes, whole cloves, and cinnamon sticks to boiling milk. Simmer on medium heat for 5 minutes. Add coarsely ground coffee beans to boiling mixture and continue to simmer for 20 minutes. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. Allow mixture to cool for a few minutes to allow beans to settle at the bottom of pan. Pour mixture through a fine mesh sieve or cheesecloth-lined strainer into a pitcher. Strain again to remove any remaining beans or spices if desired. Add 1 teaspoon of honey per cup for sweetening. Serve hot or cold as desired. For a spicier version of this drink, try using a different ratio of spices (more red pepper flakes or whole cloves) or add additional spices such as ginger or garlic. This recipe makes 6 servings (1 cup each). To reheat the spiced coconut coffee in the morning, warm it on a low setting in a mic

Bring a large pan of water to a boil. Add the potatoes and cook for 10-15 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool slightly. Cut the bacon into small pieces. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook until crisp. Drain the bacon and reserve. In a large bowl, whisk together the broth, the remaining dressing ingredients and the potatoes. Stir in the bacon. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with the chopped green onions and the chopped parsley. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and lightly flour a 9 x 13 inch pan. In large bowl, combine 2 cups flour with the baking powder and saltset aside. Beat together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and vanillabeat well. Add the dry mixture and blend thoroughly. Stir in the chocolate chunks. Pour into prepared pan and bake for 30-35 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.

Place boneless, skinless chicken breasts in 9 x 13 baking dish. Sprinkle with cumin and pepper. Pour in 1 cup hot chicken broth and 1 cup cold water. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. In a medium skillet saute peas and raisins in 1 tablespoon butter. Serve chicken over peas and raisins. Sprinkle with couscous and more pepper and cumin if desired.

Toast bread in a sandwich press or under the broiler until golden brown. Remove from sandwich press or broiler. Spread butter on one slice. Cover butter side with salami, mortadella and ham. Cover meat slices with olive salad. Sprinkle provolone evenly over all. Add remaining bread slice, butter-side-up. Toast until golden brown. Serve immediately. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Mix the sugar and salt in a bowl and set aside. Bring the honey, water and oil to boil in a saucepan. Add the almonds. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes stirring frequently. When the liquid is practically gone, add the sugar and salt and continue stirring on low heat until sugar has turned reddish-brown approximately 5 more minutes. You will recognize the honey roasted almond look. Take off heat and spread in one layer on a cookie sheet or foil until it cools. Break into pieces and store in an airtight container.

1. Pre-heat the oven to 180c/350f/gas 4. 2. Line 12 x 12cm/4½ x 4½in square cake tins with greaseproof paper. 3. In a large bowl or stand mixer (with whisk attachment), whisk together the whole egg and caster sugar to make an eggy mixture. 4. In another large bowl sift together the flour and salt then stir through the amaretti biscuits to combine and add to the egg mixture. 5. Fold through the melted butter with a metal spoon to form soft pliable dough. 6. Spoon into the prepared cake tins and press down so they are evenly filled. 7. Bake in the oven for 12-15 minutes until firm to the touch and golden brown. Remove from the oven and allow to cool for 5 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. 8. For the white chocolate sauce - in a saucepan melt the white chocolate with the cream over a

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Cook the noodles as instructed. Meanwhile, in a large skillet cook the meat and the onions until the meat is no longer pink. Drain. Add the sauce and mushrooms to the meat and cook until the sauce thickens. Transfer the meat and sauce to an ungreased 2 qt casserole dish. Top with the noodles. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake until the noodles are heated through and the cheese is melted.
Place all ingredients in a large kettle. Simmer uncovered 2 to 212 hours until tender. Use vegetables as desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place butter in a Dutch oven or other heavy large pot. Cook over medium heat until butter is melted. Add remaining ingredients. Stir until corn is tender. Cover pot, reduce heat, and cook 50 minutes or until rice is tender. Fluff with fork before serving. Serve warm with barbecued beef.

Preheat oven 200f. Line a cookie sheet with parchment paper. In a bowl combine the sugar, cinnamon and vanilla together and mix well. In a shallow dish beat egg white with a fork until frothy. Dip each almond in the cinnamon vanilla mixture then roll in the egg white until covered. Place on the cookie sheet in a single layer. Sprinkle lightly with salt. Bake 20-25 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Cool then store in an airtight container.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the bell pepper and cook until it begins to soften and turn a bright red color. Add the chopped garlic and cook until just beginning to turn brown. Add the cooked spinach and cook until it begins to wilt. Add the hot pepper flakes and cook until heated through. Season with a pinch each of salt and pepper.

Cook ziti according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat the butter and cream cheese over low heat just until the butter melts. Stir in the milk until smooth. Stir in the garlic powder, seasoning with salt and pepper. Stir in the ziti and cook just until heated through, about 2 minutes. Sprinkle the top with the parsley flakes. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Remove kernels from cob. In a large saucepan over high heat combine water, corn kernels and chipotle chiles. Bring to boil. Cover and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Stir in salt and serve with feta cheese.

In a saucepan combine the refried beans and the tomatoes and cook for a few minutes over medium heat until the tomatoes are soft. Add the onion and the jalapenos and cook for a couple of minutes more. Spoon the mixture onto a baking sheet and spread the mixture evenly over the top of the corn tortilla chips. Sprinkle the monterey jack and the pepper jack cheeses over the top of the mixture. Bake for about 20 minutes. Serve with the chopped tomatoes and the sliced green onions on the side.

Heat oil in heavy-bottomed pan to 375F (190C). Lightly dust pork with flour, then brown in pan over medium-high heat. Remove to a plate. Add mushrooms and onions and saute 2 minutes. Stir in red wine and simmer 3 minutes. Add parsley and cracked black pepper. Stir well to coat pork in sauce. Cover and cook 1 hour. Reduce heat to low and simmer 30 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to cool 10 minutes. Cut into 2 inch cubes. Serve with potatoes and sauerkraut.
Boil water with okra pods. When half done add a little salt. To serve, drain very well, pour into a hot dish and add melted butter and lemon juice.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine the egg yolks and the sugar. Stir constantly for 5 minutes or until mixture is thick and pale yellow in color. Remove from the heat and stir in the key lime juice. Set aside until ready to use. Pour the sweetened condensed milk into a 9 inch pie plate. Place the pie plate in a large pan filled with 1 inch of water. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until a knife inserted into the center of the pie comes out clean. Remove the pie from the oven and allow to cool slightly. Once the pie has cooled, refrigerate for at least 3 hours. Top the cooled pie with the reserved egg yolk mixture and refrigerate for another 30 minutes. Top with whipped cream and garnish with a lime slice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease and lightly flour a bundt pan. Stir together the flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl. Cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add the flour mixture alternately with the vegetable oil and milk to the batter. Fold in the rhubarb and brown sugar. Pour the batter into the prepared pan and sprinkle with the oats and the cinnamon. Bake for 60 to 65 minutes in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping if desired.

Beat white sugar with butter until well blended. Add eggnog to butter mixture. Mix together egg yolks and vanilla extract. Add to butter mixture. Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture alternating with eggnog mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 8-9 minutes or until set. Cool on wire racks.

Bring large saucepan of salted water to boil. Add macaronicook 8 minutes or until tender. Drain and keep warm. Melt butter in saucepan. Add flour. Gradually stir in milk. Add cooked macaronistir to combine. Stir in cheeses. Stir in seasoning. Pour into buttered 2 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees f for 30 minutes. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 350°F. In a shallow dish combine lemon juice, oil, soy sauce and ginger. Add chickens and marinate for 30 minutes at room temperature. In a medium bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Rub mixture over the chickens. Arrange on a rack in a roasting pan. Cover and roast 1 hour and 15 minutes or until done. Remove from oven and tent with foil. Let stand for 5 minutes. Carve and serve.

Brown pork sausage and ground beef in large pot. Add all remaining ingredients except rice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Serve over rice. You may want to use two cups of long grain rice. You may want to use two cups of long grain rice. If you prefer more of the sausage, add more. If you prefer more of the beef, add more.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Line 2 8-inch round cake pans with parchment paper. Sift flour, sugar and cardamom into large mixing bowladd baking powder and saltmix well. Add butter and eggbeat well. Gradually add preservesbeat well. Add oatmealbeat just until combined. Divide batter between prepared pansspread batter evenly. Bake for 30 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool in pans on wire racks for 15 minutes. Remove from panscool completely on racks. Spread Lingonberry preserves on top of each layer. Sprinkle with oatmealtop with streusel.

Drain 4 cups of kosher pickles into a large bowl. Add 1 cup of sugar, 1/2 cup of Tabasco sauce, 4 chopped garlic cloves, 1 teaspoon of salt, 1/2 teaspoon of ground pepper, 1/2 cup of red wine vinegar, and 1/2 cup of apple juice. Stir together. Pour mixture over pickles and let stand overnight.

Mix all of the ingredients except the potatoes together well. Set aside. Peel potatoes. Boil potatoes until tender. Cut potatoes into thin strips. Dip potatoes into the batter. Fry in oil on medium heat. Turn over when golden brown. Repeat with the rest of the potatoes. Serve with apple sauce.

In a microwaveable bowl combine the pumpkin, evaporated skim milk, light brown sugar, ground cinnamon, ground ginger, ground nutmeg and salt. Microwave on high for 6 minutesstir and microwave for an additional minute. Whisk the egg and egg white together and fold them into the mixture in the bowl. Microwave on high for 1 minutelet stand for one minute, then fold in the egg-white mixture. Microwave on high for 30 secondslet stand for one minute. Mix thoroughly again and microwave for an additional minute, or until the mixture is thickened. Serve immediately or let stand for up to an hour before serving. Serves six. Recipe makes two servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Generously spray an 8 x 8 inch baking dish with cooking sprayset aside. Whisk together flour and seasonings in a shallow bowl. Whisk together the other ingredients in another shallow bowp. Dip each chicken breast half in flour mixtureshake off excess. Next, dip each in the sour cream mixtureshake off excess. Place breasts in prepared baking dish. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the liquid gravy browner over medium heat until hotstir well to dissolve all the grains in it. Spoon liquid gravy browner evenly over chicken breasts. Bake uncovered for an additional 20 minutes or until golden brown and tender throughout. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet heat the olive oil. Saute the zucchini until tender. Add the onion and garlic. Saute until soft. Add the diced tomatoes. Then add the diced roasted red pepper. Add the cod and saute for 5 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle the diced fresh parsley over the dish just before serving. Serve hot.

In a small sauce pan combine sugar and cocoa powder and stir until combined. Add in milk and vanilla and stir until combined and all powder is dissolved. Set aside. In a medium bowl whisk together the egg and sugar until the egg is slightly frothy and the sugar is dissolved. In another bowl whisk together the heavy cream and honey until combined and the honey is dissolved. Add in the milk mixture and whisk until combined well. Add in vanilla and stir until combined well. Set aside. In the bowl of an ice cream maker combine the egg and sugar mixture and the heavy cream and honey mixture and whisk together until combined well. Add in the milk mixture and whisk together until combined well. Add in the cocoa powder and whisk together until combined well. Add in the marshmallow and graham crackers and whisk until combined well. Process according to the manufacturer's instructions until done.

Cook the potato in boiling water until tender (about 15 minutes). Drain and mash or pass through a ricer. Return to the pot and add the milk. Heat to boiling over low heat, stirring to blend well. Season with salt, nutmeg, and white pepper to taste. Combine the butter and worcestershire sauce. Pour into the hot milk mixture and stir until the butter is melted and blended. Add the cooked oysters and simmer until heated through (about 3 minutes). Serve hot.

Slice the yellow squash into 1/2 inch thick slices. Slice the onion thinly. In a large pot of boiling salted water cook the onions for about 15 minutes. Drain the onions. Place the squash into the pot of boiling water. Cook the squash for about 3 to 5 minutes. Drain the squash. In a large skillet over moderate heat cook the butter. Add the garlic when the butter is hot. Cook the garlic for about 30 seconds. Add the squash. Add the water, salt and pepper. Cook the squash for about 3 to 5 minutes. Sprinkle the fresh basil on the squash. Serve the smothered squash hot.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook the beans until tender but not mushy, about 4 minutes. Drain them well in a colander set over a bowl to catch any liquid that may drain from them. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the mushrooms until tender, about 2 minutes. Add 2 tablespoons of butter and saute until melted, about 1 minute. Add the sugar, seasoning salt and garlic powder to the mushrooms and saute until they are coated with the butter. Stir in the beans. Add the remaining butter to the panmelt over low heat until the butter is blended into the beans and mushrooms. Stir in the creamseason to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediatelysprinkle with parsley if desired.
Combine all ingredients in a gallon jug and stir until all sugar is dissolved. Chill until ready to serve. Serve over ice and garnish with lemon slices and mint sprigs if desired.

Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add cabbage. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Transfer cabbage to a 9x13 inch baking dish. Stir in apples and brown sugar. Top with bread crumbs. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt canola oil cooking spray. Add cabbage mixture. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake in a preheated 350 degrees fahrenheit oven for 30-40 minutes.

Break 6 large eggs into small bowl. Add 1 Tbsp light cream, 1/2 tsp of worcestershire sauce and 1 pinch each of salt and pepper. Whisk to blend well. Cook in a non-stick frying pan over medium-high heat for 1 to 2 minutes until just set and no longer runny.

In a small bowl combine mayonnaise, sour cream and 2 tsp of the paprika. Set aside. Dip halibut fillet into batter of breadcrumbs and egg. Dip into mayonnaise mixture and coat both sides well with crumb mixture and set aside. Heat oil and butter together until butter is melted and sizzling and brown fillet quickly over medium heat about 2 to 3 minuets per side. Transfer to a baking dish and bake at 350 degrees for about 15 to 20 minuets or until fish is done. Garnish with parsley or chives and serve with lemon wedges and rice.

Combine all the pesto ingredients in a blender or food processor. Pulse until the pesto is coarse. In a non-stick skillet over medium-high heat, add the olive oil. When hot add the pesto and bring to a boil. Turn off the heat. Add the shrimp to the pan and cook until the shrimp turns pink. Remove from the heat and drain off any excess liquid from the pan. Stir in the parmesan cheese. Transfer the shrimp to a serving platter. Sprinkle the pesto on top. Garnish the platter with the parsley leaves and the chopped cilantro. Makes 6 servings. This recipe is great over pasta or rice.

Stir together soy sauce, vinegar and chili sauce in small bowl. Heat 1 Tbs. vegetable oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat until hot. Add cashews and stir fry 2 minutes. Add remaining 1 Tbs. vegetable oil and ginger to panstir fry 10 seconds. Add radish and scallionsstir fry 2 minutes. Add snow peasstir fry 1 minute. Stir in soy sauce mixturecook 1 minute longer.

Place butter in a small saucepan over medium-high heatmelt until bubbles form on top. Whisk in flour and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in broth, dried cranberries, green onion and 4 teaspoons of fresh thyme. Bring to a boilreduce heat to medium-low and simmer 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice. In a shallow dish, combine remaining 2 teaspoons of thyme and 1/4 cup of flour. In a shallow dish, place pankostir in melted butter. Dip salmon fillets in flour mixture and then in butter mixture to coat. Place coated fillets on a greased baking sheet. Bake 10 to 15 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle with additional cranberries.

In a medium bowl whisk together the mayonnaise, lemon juice and zest until well combined. Set aside for the flavors to meld together. In another large mixing bowl, toss together the apples, celery, radishes, onions, cranberries and cashews. Add the mayonnaise mixture and toss well to coat the fruit mixture evenly with the dressing. Serve chilled with your favorite crackers.

Cream together marzipan and sugar. Add eggs and beat until well combined. Stir in the flour, salt, and butter. Press dough into a greased jelly roll pan. Spread currant jam evenly on dough. Sprinkle with poppy seeds. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

In a large saucepan bring cream-style corn and ginger to the boil, reduce heat and cook until corn is tender. Drain corn and transfer to a food processor with thyme and blend to a smooth purée. Stir in milk and egg. Blend in flour until mixture forms a thick batter. Stir in cooked sweet potato and butter until mixed well. Heat a little oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat and spoon 2 tablespoons of batter into the pan for each fritter. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side or until lightly browned and golden. Drain on absorbent paper. Serve warm with sour cream and chives and lemon wedges on the side.

Wash bulbs, removing stems. Cut lengthwise into 1/2 inch thick slices. Place in large bowl. In a small skillet over low heat, heat 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add garlic. Cook until softened. Drain on paper towels. Place the garlic in a small bowl. Add the remaining oil, the anchovies, red pepper flakes, and the black pepper. Stir to blend. Drizzle over the fennel. Serve the pasta with the sauce.
