Combine all the ingredients in a food processor. Puree until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl and chill for at least one hour. Serve with assorted crackers.

Make mayonnaise: Mix together all ingredients except lime juice. Slowly add lime juice, whisking until well blended. In a large skillet, heat 1 tsp oil over medium-high heat. Add turkey and cook 3 minutes or until cooked through. Slice into thin strips. Wrap each tortilla around a platter and cut each tortilla into 3 equal pieces. Heat a tortilla between two plates. Spoon 1/3 cup turkey and 2 tablespoons mayonnaise mixture onto tortilla. Top with lettuce. Fold tortilla over to enclose filling. Place wrap seam side down and cut into 3 pieces. Repeat with remaining tortillas and fillings.

Cook the pasta until tender. Drain. Rinse under cold water and drain again. Combine the cooked pasta with the peas, tomatoes and green onions. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the cooked chicken and mayonnaise. Add the roasted peppers and the diced fresh parsley. Add the pasta mixture. Toss together. Taste and season with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature. If you don't want to use the wine vinegar, just add a little fresh lemon juice and a little salt.

In a large saucepan, bring 4 quarts of water to a boil and add 1 tablespoon salt. Add beans and return water to a boilcook 3 to 4 minutes or until tender but still crisp-tender. Drain in a colander and rinse under cold running water until cool enough to handle. In a large skillet over medium heat melt 1 tablespoon of oil and cook onions for 5 minutes or until tender. Add remaining oil, salt, and peppercook 1 minute longer or until fragrant. Add cooked green beans to skilletcook 5 minutes or until heated through. Stir in parsley and serve.

Combine cooked chicken with mayonnaise in a large bowl. Add paprika, cranberries, celery and onions. Stir in green bell pepper and pecans. Season with seasoning salt and ground black pepper. Refrigerate until serving.

Rinse and drain lentils. Add to a large sauce pan with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Add celery ribs, onion and garlic. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes. Add pork hocks and brown sugar. Cook until meat is tender. Serve in warm bowls. This is a thick soup. You can serve with warm flatbread.

Boil potatoes until tender. Peel and cube. Heat margarine in a pan. Sauté onions until soft. Add potato to onions and stir until well mixed. Add all the herbs and seasoning to taste. Beat the eggs. Stir the flour into the milk. Add the flour/milk mixture to the potato mixture. Add the cheese and stir well. Pour mixture into a 2 litre (4 pound) ovenproof dish. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese. Bake in a preheated oven at 180c (350f) for 1 hour. Serve immediately.

Place all ingredients except egg whites in a pan and bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add egg whites. Beat until soft peaks form, about 2 minutes. Serve on fruit plate with marshmallows on top. Serves 4 to 6.

Combine all ingredients (except black olives) and mix thoroughly. Place mixture into a 1 quart casserole dish. Cover and refrigerate for 4 hours before serving with black olives on top of the mixture. Serves 12 to 16 people.

Cut the bisquick in half and combine with the marmalade and water. Knead together for a minute and let it stand for 15 minutes. Roll out between two sheets of plastic wrap to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut into squares. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before removing from pan.
In a mixing bowl cream butter. Add flour, sugars & baking soda. Add oatmeal & mix well. Drop by teaspoonfuls on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes.
Combine marmalade, lime juice, pineapple, soy sauce, dijon mustard, gingerroot and garlic in slow cooker. Add chicken and coat well. Cook for 6 hours until juices run clear. Serve with steamed rice.

Butter an ovenproof dish. Place the apples in it and add the wine and sugar. Cook gently until the apples are soft. In a separate bowl mix the eggs with the cream. Add the zest of one orange to the cream. Place the bread slices in the pan. Pour the cream mixture over the apples and sprinkle with caster sugar. Place the pan in the oven and cook until the apples are very soft and the custard has set. Serve warm.

Mix biscuit mix with cold water until soft dough is formed. Add a little milk if too dry. Fold gravy mix, onion gravy mix and worcestershire sauce into the dough. Roll dough out onto a baking sheet (I used a jelly roll pan). Spread the dough out until it covers the pan. I used a small can of biscuits for my rolls. I cut the biscuits in half so they were smaller and they fit better together. Bake for about 15 minutes at 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). You can also bake the biscuit dough about 10 minutes before the pudding is done so they are warm and soft when you put the pudding together. Remove from the oven and add the warm biscuits to the dough that has been baking for 15 minutes. Let the biscuits and dough cool slightly until you can handle them better. Then mix the hot biscuits together with the dough. I used a biscuit cutter and cut the biscuit dough into circles. Spoon some of the pudding mixture onto the

Mix all the ingredients except cornstarch in a small pot. Bring to a boil. Stir in cornstarch slowly. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes. Add water to adjust thickness. Serve over vegetables or chicken. This is great for any kind of poultry.

Combine dry ingredients in large bowl. Set aside. In another bowl combine wet ingredients and beat well. Pour wet mixture over dry mixture and stir until combined. Pour batter into two lightly greased loaf pans. Bake for 45 minutes at 400 degrees in preheated oven or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes in pan before removing to wire rack.

In large bowl combine brown sugar and cinnamon. Stir in berries and orange juice. Place mixture into prepared pie shell. Combine flour and brown sugarcut in butter until mixture resembles coarse meal. Sprinkle over berries. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until filling is bubbling and crumb mixture is brown.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) Grease 2 (4-cup) capacity round baking dishes with non-stick cooking spray. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, ricotta cheese, splenda, cinnamon and nutmeg until smooth. Pour into prepared baking dishes. Bake in the preheated oven until puffy and set, about 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl combine the rice krispies, egg whites, corn syrup, cocoa powder, baking powder and vanilla together. In a separate large bowl combine the rolled oats, sugar, flour and salt together with a wooden spoon or spatula. Gradually add the cocoa mixture to the flour mixture to combine well. Drop by rounded spoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake in preheated oven for about 10 to 12 minutes or until the cookies are golden on the bottom and set on top. Remove from the cookie sheet to a wire rack to cool.

Heat olive oil and add 2 minced garlic cloves to oil. Add 2 minced onions and 2 minced bell peppers to oil and cook until onion and bell peppers are tender. Add 1/2 tsp. ground cumin and 1/4 tsp. oregano to oil and cook until oil is fragrant. Add 2 diced hot chili peppers to oil and cook until oil is fragrant. Add 1/4 cup water to oil. Add 2 boneless skinless chicken breasts to oil and cook until meat is no longer pink. Add 1/4 cup water and 2 tbsp. lemon juice to oil and cook until oil is fragrant. Season with kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve over steamed rice.

Wash lentils thoroughly. Add them to a pot along with cumin seeds. Bring to boil then lower heat and cook for 10 minutes. Add oil and onions fry for about 2 minutes till light brown. Add black pepper, salt, cook for about 10 minutes or until lentils are tender. Add basmati rice stir through cook for about 20 minutes.

Saute the chopped garlic and green onions in the oil over medium heat until they begin to soften. Add the tomatoes and green chilies. Stir the mixture. Add the frozen spinach and stir until the spinach is thawed and the mixture is a bright green. Add the salt and pepper and cook for about 10 minutes. Stir in the cheeses and cook until the mixture is very smooth. Add the whole-milk half-and-half and the red wine vinegar. Stir until the mixture is thickened. Serve with corn tortilla chips.

Add sausage and onion to a frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook until sausage is fully cooked and onion is translucent. Set aside. Pour egg into a bowl and add cheese and spices. Beat until well combined. Fill crescent rolls with egg mixture and place on a baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes. Top with sausage and serve with scrambled eggs.

In a large saucepan, combine coconut milk, coconut extract, and 1/2 cup of the water. Heat to boilingstir in rice. Cook over medium heat 15 minutes. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup water. Cook 20 minutes more or until most of water is absorbed. Stir in sugar and salt. Cook 2 minutes longer. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 3/4 cup coconut milk. Let stand 20 minutes. Serve warm sprinkled with coconut flakes. Store in refrigerator. Reheat before serving.

Combine graham cracker crumbs and margarine in a medium bowl. Press into a 9-inch pie pan. Bake for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden. Cool on a wire rack. Cream together soy cream cheese and brown sugar. Add rum extract, ground spices and vanilla. Mix well. Pour into cooled crust. Chill for 3 hours before serving. Decorate with fresh fruit.
Mix eggs with the biscuit mix. Add the onions and mix. Then add the cheese and salt. Put in greased loaf pan and bake in the oven at 375 degrees for about 45 minutes. Makes one loaf.
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Brush the chops with the mustard mixture. Sprinkle them with the cumin, salt, and pepper. Bake for 30 minutes or until done.

Peel potatoes and boil for 15 minutes until soft. Drain. In food processor add potatoes, shredded coconut, almonds and vanilla. Blend for 30 seconds. Add powdered sugar and dark chocolate and blend for 1 minute. Spread in greased 13x9 pan. Refrigerate for 3 hours. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Unroll each dough triangle and separate into triangles. Cut each in half lengthwise forming two triangles. Place 1 boneless chicken breast down lengthwise on half of each triangle. Top each with a tablespoon cheddar cheese and about a tablespoon cream of chicken soup. Fold over and seal edges. Place on ungreased cookie sheet and bake at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with extra gravy if desired.

Cut the courgette in slices. Fry them with a drizzle of oil, the butter and the onion. Add the slices of pasta. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with grated parmesan. Cook for 30 minutes. Stir in the walnuts at the end. Sprinkle with the parsley. Serve warm.
Puree brown sugar and vanilla bean in coffee to taste. Blend together with bananas, almonds, and ice. Pour into serving glasses and top with whipped cream.

In a large mixing bowl combine turkey, cream of mushroom soup and egg. Stir in oats and garlic cloves. Mix well. Form mixture into a loaf. Place on an ungreased 11 x 7 x 2 baking dish. Pour tomato sauce over meatloaf. Bake at 350 for 1-1 1/2 hours.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Cook onion until tender. Stir in the ground turkey and seasoning. Cook until meat is no longer pink. Stir in the rice and beans. Cook over medium heat for 10 minutes or until heated through. Serve hot over rice or corn tortillas. Serves 4.

In a pressure cooker add 1 1/2 cups water. Place ham shank into water with garlic clove(s) Add potatoes, carrots, cabbage and celery. Cover and cook 40 minutes at high pressure. Once cooked remove lid, remove ham shank to cool, then shred into bite size pieces. Serve with cooking liquid on side as au jus.

Preheat oven to 375F. Sift flour and salt together in one large bowl. In another large bowl combine eggs, egg yolks, spinach (fresh or frozen), parmesan, parmesan rind (if desired), 1/3 cup boiling water, and flour mixture. Cook gnocchi until done. Serve immediately with sauce of your choice.

White sugar, peanuts, corn syrup and rice flour are mixed together and then placed onto wax paper and allowed to dry. The dried mixture is then cut into small pieces and placed on wax paper where it can be twisted into long strands and left to dry. They are then placed into plastic baggies and stored in your cupboard until needed.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. Grease a 10 cup popover pan with butter or non stick cooking spray. In large bowl with an electric mixer beat eggs and milk until light and foamy. Add melted butter, salt and flours to eggs and milk and beat until combined well. Pour into popover pan and bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown and puffed up.

Cook the beef, onion and bell peppers in a skillet. Drain and add the tomatoes. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the kidney beans and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the butter and cheese. Cook 2 minutes longer. Sprinkle with paprika. Serve immediately.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add turkey and brown. Add onion and cook until tender. Add remaining ingredients and simmer until slightly thickened.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add penne and cook according to package directions. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Saute pine nuts until golden brown. Add chard and saute 3 minutes. Add broth and simmer 6 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and cook 1 minute. Drain pasta. Add to skillet. Toss well. Add pine nuts. Stir in balsamic vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Combine scallions and garlic in food processor or blender. Add gingerroot, brown sugar, soy sauce and sesame oil to mixture. Place chicken thighs in food processor or blender. Add mixture to processor or blender and blend thoroughly. Pour mixture in slow cooker. Cook on low for 4 hours. Serve over rice.

Steam the brussels sprouts over boiling water until tender, about 10-15 minutes. Heat a small pan over medium heat. Melt a small pat of butter, add brussels sprouts, water, sugar, a generous pinch of kosher salt, and a few grinds of black pepper. Cook until just beginning to brown. Remove from heat. Taste to adjust seasonings. Serve warm.

In a large saucepan add 1/2 cup of buttermilk2 tablespoons of mustard2 tablespoons of granulated sugar1 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil. Add in 1 lb of peeled and deveined shrimp. Cook over medium high heat for 10 minutes. Add in 1/2 cup of chopped cucumber1/2 cup of chopped green onions. Cook for 15 more minutes. Add more buttermilk if the soup is too thick. Garnish with chopped chives. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine dried apples with water. Cook until softened but not broken down. Add orange juice and zest to apple mixture. Cook until softened but not broken down. Stir in salt, sugar and cinnamon. Pour half of the filling into pastry shell. Place second pastry shell on top of filling. Seal edge of two pastry shells together with beaten egg white. Cut several slits in top of pastry shell. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes or until pastry is golden brown. Remove from oven and cool before serving.

In a large bowl, combine the spinach leaves with the toasted sesame seeds. In a small bowl whisk together the sesame oil, rice wine vinegar, dijon mustard, and soy sauce until combined. Whisk in the sugar. Toss the dressing with the salad leaves. Cover and refrigerate for 2 to 4 hours before serving.

In a heavy saucepan, mix together gelatin and 1/2 cup of cold water. Cook and stir over medium heat until gelatin dissolves. Remove from heat. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup of cold water. Stir in lime juice and rind. Stir in sugar. Cook and stir over low heat until mixture comes to a boil. Cook and stir 1 minute longer. Remove from heat. Add condensed milk and mix well. Stir in cream. Refrigerate until well chilled. Whip cream and fold into gelatin mixture. Pour into pie shell. Freeze. Remove from freezer 20-30 minutes before serving to soften. Store in freezer.

Beat butter and sugar together. Add eggs and vanilla and mix until thoroughly combined. Add dry ingredients to wet ingredients and stir until thoroughly combined. Stir in walnuts. Pour into greased 9 x 13 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center of brownie comes out clean. (cookies will pull away from sides of pan as baking is completed) Let cool completely before cutting into bars. These bars are great for picnics because you don't have to take them out of the pan for serving.

Bring water to boil and steep lavender for about ten minutes or until desired color and flavor. Remove lavender and stir in sugar and lemon juice. Stir well and chill until cold. Pour into glasses over crushed ice and garnish with a lemon slice and lavender flower.

Combine margarine and brown sugar in medium bowl and heat in microwave about 1 minute or until margarine is melted and sugar is dissolved. Remove and stir in nuts. Press mixture firmly into bottom of a greased 9 x 11 pan. In a small bowl, combine remaining margarine and brown sugar and heat in microwave about 1 minute or until margarine is melted and sugar is dissolved. Remove and stir in cissy coconut. Pour over nuts in pan. Bake at 350 for about 22 minutes or until golden brown.

Cut off tops and peel the carrot. Cut carrot in half lengthwise. Slice each half crosswise. Slice the onion into thin half-moons. Put the slices on a plate. Toss the onion with the salt and pepper. Drizzle with cooking spray. Place the onion on a broiler pan and broil until the onion is browned and crisp-tender. Repeat with the carrot. Arrange the onions and carrot on a serving platter and garnish with the green onion.

Mix egg whites with cornstarch and set aside. Add chicken to a large zip-top plastic bag. Add parsley and season with salt and pepper. Add olive oil and toss to coat. Place seasoned chicken in zip-top plastic bag and add egg mixture. Close bag and turn several times to coat. Remove from bag and place on a plate. Dip both sides of the chicken in the cornstarch mixture. Place coated chicken on a large plate. In a shallow bowl, combine the cornstarch mixture and the breadcrumbs. Dip both sides of the chicken in the cornstarch mixture and then the bread crumb mixture. Place the coated chicken in a large shallow baking dish and pour the lemon juice over the chicken. Cover the dish tightly with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Bake the coated chicken for 25 minutes at 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Remove the dish from the oven and let the chicken rest for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine gelatin, 1 cup boiling water & stir until dissolved. Set aside 5 minutes. In a medium bowl, combine frozen lemonade concentrate & cream cheese. Beat at medium speed with an electric mixer until well blended. Add frozen whipped topping & stir until well blended. Add gelatin mixture & blend until well blended. Pour into 4 (3-oz. each) individual serving dishes. Freeze until firm. To serve, stir together yellow food coloring & enough remaining 2 Tbsp. boiling water to make a paste. Dip a toothpick into the paste & use it to make stripes on the surface of each serving. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Toss potatoes with olive oil. Salt and pepper. Arrange in single layer in 13- x 9-inch glass baking dish. Bake for 30-40 minutes until tender. Sprinkle with chopped garlic.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly grease 2 cookie sheets. Cream butter and 1/2 cup granulated sugar. Add molasses and beat until combined. Add the egg and mix until just combined. Stir in the remaining 1/2 cup of granulated sugar and mix until well combined. In a separate bowl combine the flours with the spices. Add to the egg mixture and stir until just combined. Drop teaspoonfuls of dough onto cookie sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes. Cool on cookie sheets for 2 minutes and remove to wire racks.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat and add a pinch of salt and the pasta. Cook for about 10 minutes until the pasta is tender, stirring often. Drain the water and return the pasta to the pot. In a small skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat and sauté the onion powder until tender and fragrant. Remove from heat and mix with the spinach and parmesan. Add the lemon juice and the garlic and toss well. Add the spinach mixture and toss well with the cooked pasta. Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Cover each slice of bread with sour cream. Layer bacon, mozzarella cheese, chopped tomatoes and sliced onion between two slices of bread. Cover with a third slice of bread. To assemble sandwiches, place 3 or 4 sandwiches on each baking sheet. Spread butter over outside of each sandwich. Bake 15 to 17 minutes until mozzarella begins to bubble and bread is toasted. Makes 3 to 4 sandwiches per baking sheet.

Add 1 cup of each juice (orange, lime, pineapple) into a blender. Add honey and blend. Into another container add 1 cup of ginger ale. Add 1 cup of honey mixture into ginger ale. Serve over ice cubes with sliced pineapple chunks. Add some melon balls as garnish. Serves about 12.

Heat oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add onioncook 3 minutes or until tender. Add bamboo shootcook 1 minute or until crisp-tender. Add eggscook 3 minutes or until set but still moist. Stir in soy sauce. Cook 1 minute or until slightly thickened. Remove from heatstir in garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste. Serve over bok choy. Top with cooked shrimp.

Combine egg whites and sesame seeds. Dip each tender in egg whites. Roll in sesame seed/pecan mixture. In a medium skillet, cook the chicken breasts in the oil over medium heat about 5 minutes on each side or until browned. Remove from heat. In a small bowl stir together the hoisin sauce, dijon, apricot preserves until smooth. Serve tenders with the sauce on the side.

To prepare the broth, melt the butter and saute the green onion and garlic in a saucepan. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Turn to medium heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the avocados and continue to simmer for 5 minutes. Turn off heat and stir in the yogurt. Stir in the cooked crabmeat. Sprinkle paprika on top. Serve hot.

Stir together water and JELL-O in large bowl until dissolved. Add boiling water. Stir 2 minutes. Fold in frozen raspberries. Spread in 13x9 inch baking dish. Refrigerate 2 hours or until set. Cut into squares. Place pretzels on waxed paper. Drizzle with melted butter. Sprinkle with sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 8 to 10 minutes or until pretzels are crisp. Cool on rack. Spread cream cheese on pretzels. Spread with COOL WHIP. Place on top of squares. Refrigerate until serving.

In a large bowl combine ground beef and salsa. Cook and stir for about 10 minutes or until meat is thoroughly cooked. Drain fat. Stir in beans. Pour into a large greased casserole. Add hash browns and top with shredded nacho cheese. Bake in a preheated oven at degrees for about 40 minutes.

Combine chicken and celery in a large pan. Add enough broth to moisten the chicken. Cover and simmer until the chicken is tender. Stir in softened breadcrumbs and parsley and season with salt and pepper. Add the beaten eggs and simmer until the eggs are firm. Sprinkle with additional parsley.

In a large skillet, melt 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat. Add garlic, shallots and tarragon. Cook until tender and fragrant. Add parsley and thymecook 1 minute. Add 1 cup ale and bring to a simmer. Add mussels. Cover and cook 2 minutes or until mussels open. Discard any unopened mussels. Increase heatcook 1 minute more. Serve over bread.
Brown chicken breasts in small amount of butter. Add other ingredients and simmer until chicken is tender. Serve over angel hair with a sprinkling of Parmesan cheese.
Pour one-half cup water into blender. Add remaining ingredients. Blend until smooth. Fill paper cup halves with mixture. Freeze 2 to 3 hours or until firm.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and lightly dust a 9 x 5-inch loaf pan. In a large bowl combine the flour, salt and sugar. In a separate bowl combine the mashed bananas, eggs and vanilla. Slowly incorporate the mashed banana mixture into the flour mixture. Fold in the pecans and butter until all the dry ingredients are moistened. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the bread comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pan to a wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 9-inch round pans with butter and dust with cocoa. In a large bowl whisk the flour with the baking soda, salt and sugar. In a separate bowl whisk the oil with the eggs. Whisk in the boiling water and the buttermilk. Add the dry to the wet ingredients and whisk until smooth. Pour batter into pans. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 25 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. The cake will be very moist. To serve, loosen the edges with a knife and invert onto a plate. This will create a chocolate sauce from the dripping. Serve the cakes with whipped cream and strawberries.

Mix cooked rice, broccoli, butter and onion. Spread into a greased 9x13 baking dish. Spread sour cream and cheez whiz on top. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake for about 25-30 minutes. Serves about 6.

Spread chive & onion cream cheese on each side of the bread. Add the lemon juice and dijon-style mustard to the cream cheese and mix together to make a spreadable mixture. Spread the mixture on the bread and add the turkey and provolone cheese on top of each slice. Place the roasted sweet peppers and spinach leaves on top of each slice. Roll the sandwich up and place on a cookie sheet lined with wax paper. Place the cookie sheet with the rolled sandwiches into the freezer until the cream cheese spread has firmed up on the outside and inside is still soft and spreadable. Place each wrapped sandwich on a cookie sheet and place into the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight to allow the spread to set up fully and the spinach to wilt. Remove each sandwich from the refrigerator and slice into individual portions and serve with the dijon-style mustard for spreading on the sandwich as desired.

In large mixing bowl, combine the granny smith apples, sugar, salt, cinnamon and nutmegtoss together to mix well. In medium bowl, combine the flour and light brown sugarstir together. Add to apple mixture and toss gently to combine. Place in prepared pie shell. For streusel topping, combine the brown sugar and butter in small bowl until well blendedsprinkle over top of fruit. Bake for about 45 to 50 minutes or until pastry is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Let cool at least 2 hours before serving.

Prepare frozen vegetables according to package directions, omitting water chestnuts and adding water chestnuts just before serving to vegetables. In large skillet cook celery and mushrooms in margarine over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in soy sauce and slivered almonds. Serve with vegetables.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add the chopped onions and cook until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the chopped garlic and cook until fragrant, about a minute. Add the chopped fresh mushrooms and cook until tender, about 8 minutes. Transfer the mixture to a large skillet. Add the pearl barley and cook until all of the liquid has been absorbed, about 12 minutes. Add the chicken broth and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer until the liquid has been absorbed, about 18 minutes. Season the barley with salt and pepper to taste. Transfer the barley to a greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Top the barley with the butter and bake in a pre-heated 425 degree oven until the top is golden brown and crispy, about 12 minutes.

Roll out crescent rolls. Place dough in a greased 9x13 pan. Peel apples, core and slice. Sprinkle with sugar. Place crescent rolls over the apples. Sprinkle with cinnamon and drizzle with Mountain Dew. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Pie crust (use canned or homemade). Make crust according to directions. Put into a greased pan and bake for about 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool. While crust is cooling combine the rest of the filling ingredients and pour into the crust. Bake for about another 30 minutes. Serves about 8.

In large skillet over moderate heat brown flounder fillets in 1 tbsp oil. Remove fillets from oil. In same skillet over moderately high heat saute onions in remaining oil until soft. Add tomato paste and oregano to pan. Add flounder fillets. Stir in wine. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer 5 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley. Spoon over pasta. Top with mozzarella cheese. Broil until cheese melts. Garnish with additional parsley if desired.

In a large saucepan over medium heat add the leeks and cook until tender. Add the cauliflower and cook until tender. Add the stock and cook until the vegetables are very tender. Puree the mixture in a blender and season with nutmeg. In a separate saucepan, heat the olive oil and add the puree. Cook the mixture over medium heat until the liquid is reduced and thickened. Season with salt and pepper and serve hot.

Place chicken and broth in crockpot. Add the soup and broth to the crock pot and stir to combine. Add the butter. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours until chicken is tender and sauce has thickened a bit. Serve over egg noodles.

To prepare bagels: Toast bagels according to package directions. To prepare egg mixture: In a small bowl, combine eggs, milk, salt, and pepper. Whisk to blend well. In a medium bowl, combine melted butter with 1/4 cup cheddar cheese. Brush bagels with melted butter mixture and top each with a slice of cheese. Place bagels on a baking sheet. Pour egg mixture over bagels. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until eggs are set.

Prepare soymilk according to package directions and set aside. Peel and core 1 apple and slice into thin slicesset aside. Add 2 cups of old fashioned rolled oats to a large saucepan and cook over medium heat for 3-5 minutes until oatmeal is toasted and begins to smell fragrant. Add the maple syrup to the pan and stir to coat the oatmeal. Add soymilk and bring to a boilreduce to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes until oatmeal is tender and flavors are combined. Stir in the walnuts and the sliced applecook for 2 minutes until apple is tender and heated through. Serve warm or at room temperature with soymilk or almond milk. Enjoy!

In a bowl combine the relish, the lemon juice, the salt and the pepper. In a large bowl place the chicken. Pour the mixture over the top. Cover and place in the refrigerator for at least 3 hours. Before serving bring to room temperature. Remove the chicken from the refrigerator. Bake in a preheated 350 degree F. oven for 30 to 40 minutes or until done. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan over medium heat heat 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add onion and garlicsaute 6 minutes or until softened. Add remaining oil and next 7 ingredients. Simmer 30 minutes. Add tomatoes and simmer 30 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Puree in a blender and strain. Season with salt and pepper. This sauce can be refrigerated for 2 days and then reheated.
Heat oil and cook onion and carrot. Add frozen vegetables and brown rice. Season with salt and pepper. Add fresh herbs. Stir well. Cover and cook until brown rice is done.

Bring a large pot of water to boil and cook pasta shells according to package directions. Drain well and return to pot. Add beef, sauce, sour cream and whipping creammix well to coat meat thoroughly with sauce. Top each shell with a slice of mozzarella and a little bit of parmesan cheeseset aside. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 10-15 minutes or until the cheese is bubbly and golden brown. Serve immediately with a side of garlic bread.
Cook the pasta according to instructions on the box. Mix in the tuna fish, potato chips, milk, and butter. Stir in the cheese. Place in a greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve.

Soak tofu in water to cover for 15 minutes. Squeeze dry. Cut tofu into cubes. In food processor add tofu and pulse until it resembles ground meat. Add tofu mixture to large bowl along with remaining ingredients. Mix until well incorporated. Taste and adjust salt and pepper to taste. Refrigerate for at least an hour to allow flavors to meld. Serve with crackers.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl, whisk together the olive oil, red pepper flakes, and the garlic. Add the salt and dry sherry and whisk until well mixed. Add the raw shrimp and toss to coat. Place on a greased 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle the parsley over the shrimp. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until shrimps are just pink. Serve with a side of Old Bay Seasoning.

1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. 2. Cube the dry white bread and place into an ungreased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. 3. Place the raisin in a small bowl and add the nutmeg. Pour the cream into a large saucepan and cook over low heat until warm and bubbling. Stir in the heavy cream and heat just to the boiling point. Remove from the heat. Add the white and the granulated sugars and stir until dissolved. Stir in the egg and mix well. Pour the custard over the bread in the loaf pan. Let stand at room temperature until the custard is absorbed and the mixture is well blended. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream.
Boil sweet potatoes until tender. Drain. Mash with milk and blend in pumpkin pie spice. Fold in sugar. Drop by teaspoonful into hot grease or oil. Serve with maple syrup.

Chop the garlic cloves finely and put them into a saucepan with a little olive oil. Add the leeks and the carrots to the garlic mixture and stir occasionally for about 15 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Add salt to taste and serve with a drizzle of olive oil.

Cook bacon until crisp. Drain and crumble. Place broccoli in a large pot of boiling water. Cook until tender but not mushy. Drain. Stir the dressing ingredients together. Add the rest of the salad. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with the crumbled bacon.

Melt chocolate wafers according to package directions. Stir in almonds, powdered sugar and corn syrup. Stir together egg yolks and instant coffeeadd to chocolate mixture. Stir in liqueur. Place mixture into a large resealable plastic bag. Cut off one corner of bagpipe mixture onto waxed paper-lined baking sheets into balls about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Roll each ball into mixture of powdered sugar and cinnamon sugarplace onto waxed paper-lined baking sheet to dry. Store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 3 days or in refrigerator for up to 1 week.

Make cinnamon butter with the butter and cinnamon. Roll each biscuit in butter and then roll in sugar or cinnamon sugar mixture. Place on cookie sheet in rows of three and bake in preheated oven at 425 for 10 minutes or until golden brown.

Peel and core kohlrabi and cut into large cubes. Toss with butter and salt and cook over medium heat until kohlrabi is tender and browned, about 10 minutes. While kohlrabi is cooking, mix together parsley, flour and the broth. Once kohlrabi is cooked, add mixture and cook for another minute or two. Serve immediately.

Prepare a 9 x 13 baking pan with cooking spray. Cream together the butter and icing sugar until it is smooth. Mix the cornstarch with the flour and add to the creamed mixture, mixing until it forms a ball of dough. Divide dough into thirds. Using a rolling pin and a large piece of plastic wrap, roll out each ball of dough until it is about 1/8-inch thick. Place the dough onto the prepared baking pan and bake for approximately 20 minutes, until the dough is slightly golden brown around the edges of the pan. Remove from the oven and allow to cool slightly before cutting into bars. Sprinkle with the vanilla extract before serving. Variations: - Add 2 Tbsp. lemon extract instead of the vanilla extract for a lemon-flavoured shortbread. - Add a few drops of red food colouring to the dough for a beautiful red shortbread. - Add a few drops of green food colouring to the dough for a beautiful green shortbread.

In large skillet over medium-high heat, melt butter. Add carrots and apple cider. Bring to boilreduce heat to medium-low. Cook uncovered until tender. Remove from heatdrain off excess liquid. Stir in brown sugar and season with salt and pepper to taste. Toss in chopped tarragon just before serving.

Rinse broccoli in a large pot of cold water. Add broccoli to large saucepan with cold water. Bring to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes. Drain. Heat 2 tbsp of olive oil in a large skillet. Add broccoli. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in beans. Cook for 3 minutes. Add remaining 1 tbsp of olive oil. Add cashews. Toast until lightly brown. Stir in almonds. Cook until lightly brown. Stir in salt. Serve hot.

Add eggs yolks and condensed milk to a large saucepan and cook over low heat. Stir constantly with a whisk until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and stir in chocolate sandwich style cookies and chopped vanilla beans. Cool mixture for at least 20 minutes. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours. Place ice cream maker into the freezer for at least 24 hours. Once ice cream maker is ready to use, pour cold mixture into ice cream maker and churn according to manufacturer’s instructions. Transfer ice cream to a container and cover tightly. Freeze for at least 2 hours before serving.

Melt butter in saucepan. Add remaining ingredients and stir until smooth. Pour mixture into graham cracker crust. Refrigerate for several hours. Serve with whipped cream and chopped nuts (chocolate curls are optional).

Place salmon in a bowl and add orange juice and zest. Marinate for at least an hour or overnight if possible. To cook, preheat olive oil in a large sauté pan over medium heat. Add garlic clove and fresh ginger. Once fragrant (a few minutes), add coconut milk and chili sauce. Add salt and fresh mint stems and cook for 10 more minutes until salmon is cooked through and coconut milk thickens. Serve with fresh cilantro sprigs and a squeeze of fresh lime juice.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Stir in the brown sugar and salt. Cook over medium heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Boil for one minute and remove from heat. Stir in the maple syrup. Serve over ice cream.

In the morning, place a non-stick skillet over medium heat and cook the sausage until browned. In a large bowl combine the bread cubes, cooked sausage, shredded cheese and the milk. Add the eggs and stir until well blended. Pour mixture into an ungreased baking dish and sprinkle with salt and black pepper. Bake for 1 hour at 375F. Serves 6.

Slice the top off the jalapeño peppers and remove the seeds. Cut them in half lengthwise to remove the core. Layer 2 or 3 pieces of bacon on each half of the jalapeño peppers. Stuff the jalapeño peppers with the cream cheese mixture. Wrap each filled jalapeño pepper with 2 slices of bacon. Secure the bacon with toothpicks. Grill over medium heat for 10 minutes per side or until bacon is browned and crisp.

In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the dry ingredients. In a separate bowl or glass measure cup, whisk together the egg, orange juice, water, and 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil. Pour the wet mixture into the dry mixture and whisk until combined. Let the batter sit for 15 minutes so the gluten can relax and the batter can thicken slightly. Heat a griddle over medium-high heat until it is hot enough to sizzle when sprinkled with water. Lightly spray the griddle with cooking spray. Pour 1/4 cup of the batter onto the griddle for each pancake. Cook until the underside is golden brown (about 2 minutes). Flip with a spatula and cook the other side until golden brown (about 1 minute). Continue cooking until all the batter has been used (about 4 to 5 minutes). Serve the pancakes immediately with a drizzle of orange marmalade or with a generous serving of fresh berries and whipped cream.

Remove the stems from the mushrooms. In a skillet over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the mushrooms and saute until golden brown. Remove from the heat and add the butter. Add the garlic granules to the skillet and stir until melted. Add the red wine to the pan, stirring constantly. When the liquid is reduced to a glaze, stir the mushrooms into the pan. Serve hot.

Beat eggs. Pour milk over eggs and season to taste with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Stir in cheese. Place one slice of bread in each of 6-8 ovenproof ramekins or small ovenproof dishes or baking dishes. Pour egg mixture over bread. Sprinkle each dish generously with Parmesan cheese. Place dishes on rack of baking sheet and bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted & bread is browned. Serve immediately.
Mix eggs, breadcrumbs, onion, salt & pepper to taste. Pat hot dogs dry & roll in crumb mixture. Place on cookie sheet & bake at 350 until crumb mixture is golden brown & hot dogs are warm. Serve hot!

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine all filling ingredients except powdered sugar. Place in unbaked pie shell. Sprinkle top with powdered sugar. Bake until the filling is set. Let cool. Serve with whipped cream.

Put dried apples and sage in a mug and add scotch whisky. Stir to combine. Add cinnamon stick and boiling water. Stir to combine again and let steep for about 5 minutes. Strain and sweeten to taste with honey.

Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saute the corn and pimiento for about 5 minutes. Add the zucchini and garlic and saute 2 minutes more. Add salt and pepper and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the mozzarella cheese and stir until it melts.

Steam potatoes for 15 minutes or until tender. Saut onions and garlic in butter until soft and transparent. Add potatoes and saut until they are tender and translucent. Stir in green beans and creole seasoning. Cook 1 to 2 minutes longer. Transfer to serving dish and serve.
Grind all spices together in a spice grinder or mortar and pestle. Taste to see if you need more or less of the spices. Store in airtight jar.

Wash and soak the beans overnight. Remove the beans and put them with water and the onion and tomato and the oxtail soup mix and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat and simmer gently for two hours. Add the curry powder and simmer for a further 45 mins to one hour until the beans are tender and the sauce has thickened. Season to taste and serve hot with rice or roti.

Preheat the oven to 350F degrees (176C). Grease or line a 12-hole muffin pan with paper liners. In a large bowl whisk the eggs and honey and add the quinoa and the bananas and beat until smooth. In another large bowl whisk the quinoa flour with the baking powder and the salt. Stir the dry ingredients into the wet ones until just combined and then divide the batter evenly into the 12 holes of the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until the tops are golden brown. Serve warm.

Beat eggs until thick. Mix in oil, vanilla, salt, sugar, raspberry preserves and flour. Add flour gradually until all is used. Stir in baking powder until light and fluffy. Drop by teaspoon on ungreased cookie sheet and bake 15-20 minutes at 375 degrees.

Melt wafers in oleo over low heat until softened. Remove from heat. Stir in powdered sugar and nuts. Shape into 12 balls. Place frozen orange juice in refrigerator until firm. Roll each ball in coconut to coat. Place on waxed paper in refrigerator until ready to serve.

In a large pot add 1/4 inch of oil. Fry pork for a few minutes till it is golden brown. Drain pork from fat. Remove pork from pot. Put pork into a bowl. Add fat to pot. Put potatoes and carrots into pot. Add water to pot. Add pork to pot. Bring to a boil. Add corn niblets. Simmer for 20 minutes. Add milk. Simmer for 5 minutes. Put salt cod in pot. Simmer for 20 minutes. Take off heat. Let sit for 10 minutes. Put salt cod in bowl with pork. Stir until mixed. Serve.

In a large saucepan, bring heavy cream to a boil. Reduce heat and cook until thickened, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat. In a blender or food processor, combine egg yolks and sugar. Blend until pale yellow and fluffy. With motor running, slowly pour hot heavy cream into egg mixture. Transfer to a 6x10 inch baking dish. Refrigerate overnight. In a medium bowl, beat egg whites until foamy. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff peaks form. Gently fold into custard. Sprinkle with chocolate and vanilla extract. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours or until set. Whip heavy cream. Fold into cooled custard. Spoon into individual ramekins. Garnish with raspberries. Refrigerate for 20 minutes before serving. Store leftover in fridge.

In small bowl, combine corn flakes, coconut and macadamia nutsset aside. In large bowl, beat eggs with milk until frothy. Dip each slice of bread into egg mixtureplace on baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Dip sandwiches into coconut mixtureplace on baking sheetrepeat with remaining bread and coconut mixture. Meanwhile, heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add sandwichescook until golden brown on both sides. Serve immediately with maple syrup and whipped cream.

Bring pot cheese to a simmer with 1/2 cup of butter and stir until cheese melts. Drain pot cheese and return to the saucepan. Mix pot cheese with the hot water. Boil the pot cheese/water mixture for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Drain the pot cheese/water mixture, reserving 2 Tablespoons of the water in the saucepan. Return pot cheese/water mixture to the saucepan along with the 2 Tablespoons of water that was reserved earlier. Stir well and set aside. Cook the noodles according to the package directions. Drain the noodles and put them into the saucepan with the pot cheese mixture. Stir well and remove 1 cup of the saucepan mixture into the bowl of an electric mixer. Stir with a wooden spoon until the mixture is smooth and creamy. Return the mixture to the saucepan and stir well. Serve the noodle mixture with sour cream on top if desired.

In large heavy pot sautÃ© chopped bacon until crisp. Drain excess fat from pot and return bacon to pot. Dice remaining bacon. Cook bacon in pot for 1 more minuteremove bacon with slotted spoon. Drain fat from pot, reserving 2 tablespoons. Stir in flour with 2 tablespoons fat from potcook 1 minute stirring constantly. Gradually stir in canned tomatoes and 1 cup hot water. Cook for 1 hour stirring occasionally. Stir in remaining water as needed to maintain desired consistency. Stir in salt, pepper, sugar and bay leafcook 10 minutes more or until thickened. Stir in reserved bacon. Remove bay leaf before servinggarnish with celery leaves if desired.

Dip each trout fillet in a mixture of breadcrumbs and flour. Sprinkle with the remaining breadcrumbs. Place a trout fillet in a buttered baking dish. Place almonds in a small bowl and cover with 1/4 cup of the buttermilk. Mix remaining almonds with the remaining 1/4 cup of the buttermilk. Pour the almond mixture over the trout. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until the topping is golden brown.
Combine milk and rum in 1-quart microwave-safe bowl. Microwave on high power for 2 minutes or until hot. Add cinnamonstir until dissolved. Serve with spoon for dipping.

Line a 12 hole muffin tin with wonton skins and spray with cooking spray. In a medium bowl beat together eggs and butter. In another bowl combine flour and onion powder and season with thyme and pepper. Add egg mixture to flour mixture and mix well. Add cooked broccoli and roasted red peppers and mix well. Spoon into wonton skins and bake at 425f for 8 minutes or until lightly brown on top.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Peel the onion if necessary. Cut the onion into half-inch cubes. Cook the onion with the butter over low heat for 5 minutes. Add flour to the onion mixture to make roux. Stir constantly until the flour is cooked. Add the milk slowly to the roux mixture. Cook until it thickens slightly. Add the shredded cheese to the mixture and mix thoroughly. Pour the cheese mixture into the frozen hash brown potatoes. Bake for about 10-15 minutes, until the potatoes are tender.
Peel and slice potatoes and onions into small pieces. Heat oil in saute pan. Saute potato and onion until they are tender. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Cook elbow macaroni according to directions on package. Drain macaroni and set aside. In a small bowl combine tomato sauce and salt and pepper. Pour tomato sauce mixture over macaroni in a 9x13 pan. Top with shredded Parmesan cheese and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through. Serve with a fresh salad or a garden salad.

Stir-Fry Sauce Mix:1/4 cup honey1/4 cup brown sugar1/2 tsp red pepper flakes1 tsp salt1 tsp white vinegar2 tsp soy sauce1 tsp waterCombine all ingredients in a bowl and mix well. In a large skillet or wok, heat a tablespoon of cooking oil over medium-high heat. Add the broccoli florets and carrots and cook for about 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Add the mushrooms and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Stir in the onion and cook for 1 minute. Add the sauce mix and cook 1-2 more minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Season fish with sea salt and black pepper. Place on baking sheet. Drizzle olive oil over each side. Place under broiler until nicely browned. Remove from oven. Drizzle juice from each half of the lemon and orange over each side of the fish. Add capers. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain pasta reserving 1 cup pasta cooking liquid. Place pasta and 1/2 cup pasta cooking liquid into a large bowl. Melt velveeta cheese over low heat stirring constantly. Stir into pasta mixture along with cooked tuna. Pour into a greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

In a large skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the minced garlic and cook for about 1 minute. Add the spinach and cook until it wilts, about 2 minutes. Stir in the vegetable broth and cannellini beans and cook until the mixture is warmed through and the beans are heated through. Cook the angel hair pasta in a large pot of boiling salted water for 2 to 3 minutes or until just tender. Drain the pasta and add it to the spinach mixture. Cook and stir until the pasta is heated through. Season with the salt and pepper and sprinkle with the cheese. Serve immediately.

In a small saucepan over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp. Drain the fat from the panreserve the bacon for later use. In a large bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, salt and pepper until well blended. Add the cooked bacon, chopped onions, cooked asparagus spears, cooked mushrooms and garlic powder. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate that has been coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle the top of the quiche with the Italian seasoningsprinkle the top with the shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutesserve warm or at room temperature. Makes 8 servings.

Combine molasses, vinegar and 1 cup water in a large heavy pot. Add turkey legsbring to a boil. Cover, reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours or until turkey is tender. Strain and reserve liquid. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine ketchup, worcestershire sauce and remaining 1 cup water. Brush ketchup mixture over legs. Place on a rack in a shallow roasting pan coated with cooking spray. Roast at 400f for 30 minutes or until browned. Brush with reserved liquid. Bake an additional 30 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted in thickest part of leg registers 180f. Remove from pan. Serve with carrot sticks and celery sticks.
Put all the vegetables together, arrange on plate and serve with dressing on the side.

Mix white cake mix according to package directions in a bowl with a hand mixer until the batter is smooth. Stir in the egg whites until they are incorporated in the batter. Stir in the raspberry jell-o gelatin powder along with the boiling water until the mixture is very smooth (don't boil the water). Add the diet sprite slowly mixing as you go until all is incorporated. Pour the batter in a greased 9 inch round pan. Chill for 1 hour before removing from pan to serve. Top with a dollop of coconut and a spoonful of cool whip to make it look pretty!

Mix dry breadcrumbs with sour cream. Place the chicken in the sour cream mixture. Roll the chicken pieces in the breadcrumbs. Place the chicken in the prepared baking dish. Bake 45 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve with sauce made with the remaining breadcrumbs. Makes 4 servings.

In a large mixing bowl add the egg whites, egg yolks and mustard. Using a whisk stir until well blended. Add the parsley, garlic powder. Stir well. Pour the oil into a large skillet over med heat. When oil is hot add the egg mixture to the skillet. Cook over med high heat stirring constantly until eggs begin to thicken. Reduce the heat to med-low add the parmesan cheese. Cook over med-low for about 2 minutes or until the cheese is fully incorporated. Remove from the heat. Season with salt.

Wash the carrots, trim off the top and bottom of the carrots then peel the skin off the root. Cut the carrots in half lengthwise and then quarter them. Peel the lemon. Grate the lemon skin. Squeeze the juice from the lemon. Peel and grate the ginger root. Put the grated ginger into the egg, add the honey and grated lemon skin. Mix the eggs well. Beat the dry breadcrumbs in the food processor until they are crumbly. Add the crumbs to the egg mixture. Grate the hazelnut. Add the ground hazelnut to the egg mixture. Grate the cheese. Add the grated cheese to the egg mixture. Put the grated carrots in the food processor. Add the egg mixture to the food processor and process until the mixture is smooth. Bake the cake in the oven. Makes 1 cake.
Mix all ingredients together in food processor.

Place 1/2 cup orange juice in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, stirring often. Add onion and cook until onion is tender. Add rice and cook 5 more minutes. Add the remaining orange juice and remaining liquid from the onion. Add all seasonings and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer 15 minutes. Add chicken and simmer 15 minutes longer. Remove from heat and let stand 5 minutes. Serve over cooked rice. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Heat olive oil in large high sided skillet over medium heat. Season pork chops with salt and pepper. Cook 3 minutes on each side or until nicely browned. Reduce heat to low add white wine and honey. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove pork chops from pan. Place them on a serving platter. To the pan add the dijon mustard. Stir until well blended. Pour over pork chops. Serve.

Mix the parmesan cheese and bread crumbs in a small bowl. Stir in the honey and mustard. Add the pecans and parsley. Set aside. Place the butter in the freezer for about 10 minutes. Take the butter out and spread it over the tilapia and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Place the fish on a cookie sheet. Sprinkle the honey mustard mixture over the fish. Bake in a preheated oven for about 10 minutes until the fish flakes with a fork. Serve immediately.

Stir together orange juice, orange zest, ginger and garlic in a small bowlset aside. Preheat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Dust the fish with flourshake off excess flour. Add oil to skilletheat to 375°F. Add fishcook until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer fish to a serving platecover with foil. Stir pan juicespour over fish. Sprinkle with green onionserve immediately.

In a blender container combine the heavy cream and instant espresso powder. Blend well. Add the condensed milk and yogurt and blend well. Fold in the cinnamon. Transfer to a shallow 8-inch square pan. Freeze for 3 hours or until firm. Blend the figs and blend into the mixture. Transfer to the freezer and freeze for at least 4 hours before serving.

Cut the avocado in half lengthwise and scoop out the flesh into a medium bowl. With a spoon, scoop out the seed and discard. Add the onion. Mash the avocado with a fork or potato masher. Add the water and stir to combine. Taste and add more water or seasonings if desired.

In a large glass measuring cup combine the raspberry gelatin powder and the hot water. Mix well. Add the cold water. Mix well. Add the cool whip and mix well. Spoon the mixture into a plastic container with a lid for a smooth consistency. Chill for approximately one hour before serving. Serve with strawberries for garnish.

Sauté onions in skilletset aside. Drain frankfurters. Cut each one lengthwise to open. Place frankfurters in heated soup. Bring to a boil. Add onions. Add tomato juice. Simmer for 5 minutes. Melt butter in skilletadd flour. Cook for 2 minutes. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to boilingcook and stir for 1 minute. Add cream-of-celery soup. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in parsleyseason with salt and pepper. Transfer to bowlgarnish with basil. Drain wide egg noodlesadd to skillet. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve over egg noodles.

Combine mayonnaise and cream cheese with dry mustard. Spread evenly over tortillas. Add 2 tablespoons of chunky salsa and spread evenly. Add thinly sliced bacon. Roll up and secure with toothpicks. Place tomato slices and romaine lettuce on each tortilla and roll into a cone shape. Cut each tortilla into 4 equal pieces. Serve with additional tomatoes and romaine lettuce.

Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Cook rigatoni according to package directions. Drain. Return pasta to saucepan. Add sausage. Heat to a simmer. Stir in 1/4 cup of the cheese. Cook until melted. Stir in the remaining cheese and the pasta. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup of cheese. Transfer pasta to a large serving bowl. Garnish with basil.

Heat olive oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add shallot and cook until tender 2 to 3 minutes. Stir in dijon mustard and cook until bubbling 30 seconds. Add lemon juice and cook until mixture thickens 30 seconds. Add asparagus and season to taste with salt and pepper. Cook until asparagus is tender crisp, about 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Combine lemon juice and oil with white wine and grill seasoning. Rub over chicken and place in the crockpot. Cook on high for 3 hours or low for 6 hours. At the end, sprinkle the chicken pieces with the minced garlic and the fresh chopped rosemary and add the lemon slices and the extra oil. Cook on high for another hour or low for 2 hours.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat and melt butter with garlic clove. Add brussel sprouts and green beans and cook until tender and browned on both sides. Remove from skillet and place in a bowl. Add balsamic vinegar and toss well. Add back into skillet and serve.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Mix dry bread crumbs with Parmesan cheese, paprika, thyme, and garlic salt. In a small bowl, mix the melted margarine and the low-fat buttermilk together. Place the chicken in a shallow dish and brush both sides with the melted margarine mixture. Sprinkle the dry mixture evenly over the chicken. Place the coated chicken on a cookie sheet and spray the tops with cooking spray. Bake in the preheated oven for about 20 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through.

Heat a saute pan over medium heat. Add the shallots and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add the mushrooms and cook until they just begin to soften, about 2 minutes. Add the butter to the pan and stir until the butter melts. Add the wine to the pan and cook until reduced by about half. Add the artichokes to the pan. Cook until the artichokes are heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer the pan contents to a serving dish. Toss the shrimp with the lemon juice. Place the shrimp in the pan. Cook until the shrimp are pink. Transfer the shrimp to the serving dish. Top with the chopped chives. Serve with the parsley sprinkled on top.

Mix water, egg, sugar, butter, milk, salt and bread flour together until smooth. Knead for 10 minutes until the dough is smooth and elastic. Cover bowl. Let rise in warm place until doubled in size. Punch down dough. Divide into two parts. Roll out each part until it's about 30 inches long by 3 inches wide. Cut each piece into three equal pieces. Roll out each piece into a thin strip about 12 inches long by about 1/4 inch wide. Place strips on greased cookie sheet. Let rise until puffy about 20 to 30 minutes. Bake at 375 degrees for about 10 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool on wire rack.

Place chicken into a food processor or blenderadd the hard-boiled eggs, celery, green onions, relish, mayonnaise, salt & pepper, process until smooth (about 1 minute). Transfer the mixture to a large bowlfold in the curly leaf parsley. Serve with crackers or slices of whole wheat bread or pita chips.

Bring 1 cup of the water to a boil in a medium-sized saucepan. Add the coffee granules and stir until dissolved. Remove from heat. Add remaining 2 cups of the water, tomato sauce, red wine vinegar and worcestershire sauce. Return to a boil. Reduce heat to a simmer and cook 10 minutes. Stir in the butter and remove from the heat. Set aside. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix the sugar and oregano leaves. Heat the remaining 1/4 cup of oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the oregano-sugar mixture for 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat and stir in the butter. Stir the oil mixture into the mop sauce. Set aside. To serve, add a tablespoon of the mop sauce to each serving of barbecued meat. Serve hot. (The mop sauce can be kept covered in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.)

Preheat the oven at 425F. Grease the muffin pan with the cooking spray. Sift the dry ingredients together, and set aside. Whisk the egg with the milk and the almond extract in a separate bowl. In a third bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the milk mixture and the plum and stir until everything is well mixed. Add the dry mixture and stir until the dry and wet ingredients are combined. Fill the muffin cups and bake for about 18 minutes or until the top is golden brown and a toothpick comes out clean when inserted into the center of the cupcake. Let the cupcakes cool for a few minutes before removing them from the pan. Serve warm or cold with a dollop of whipped cream or a dusting of confectioners sugar for extra sweetness.

Clean kale leaves thoroughly. Cut off tough stem ends. Slice into thin strips. Place kale leaves in a large pot with broth, parmesan cheese and garlic powder. Simmer for about 10-15 minutes or until kale is tender. Drain kale and reserve broth. Place potatoes in a large saucepan with enough cold water to cover. Cover and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain and return to saucepan. Add kale broth and 1 tsp of each of the following to taste: salt, black pepper, garlic powder. Mash with a potato masher or electric mixer until smooth. Add more broth or milk if mixture is too thick. Mix with kale and serve topped with buttered parmesan cheese.

Cut stewing beef and sausage into 1-inch pieces and brown in batches in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Drain and add remaining beef and sausage to panadd carrots, potatoes and celery. Cook over medium heat until tender. Add 3 cups water and 1 cup tomato sauce. Bring to boiling. Add remaining 1 cup tomato sauce. Reduce heat to medium-lowadd green pepper and basil. Cook 10 minutes more or until pepper is tender. Add kidney beans and season with salt and pepper. Cook 2 minutes more.

Wash and trim asparagus. Cut cherry tomatoes in half and remove stems from green beans. Cut green beans into one-inch pieces and add to bowl. Peel pine nuts. Place asparagus spears and pine nuts in a separate bowl. To make the vinaigrette, add 1 1/2 teaspoons dijon mustard to a small bowl. Mix in cider vinegar and extra virgin olive oil and season with salt and pepper to taste. Pile salad leaves on four plates and place a portion of green beans and asparagus spears in center of each plate. Divide the pine nuts among four plates. Divide the tomatoes among four plates. Place a portion of cooked chicken on each plate and drizzle with vinaigrette. Sprinkle with basil.

In a large bowl, beat eggs and milk together until blended and smooth. Add ham and chivesset aside. Place ortega chiles and sour cream into a blender or food processorprocess until smooth and well blended. (If using a food processor, blend until smooth and well blended.) Fold the sour cream mixture into the egg mixture and stir until blended. Place the mixture in a lightly greased 2-quart baking dishsprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 350 for 40 minutes or until the eggs are set and the top is golden brown. Serve immediately or refrigerate leftovers. Refrigerated baked eggs may be reheated the next day in a preheated microwave for 1 to 2 minutes on high or until warmed through and hot.

Melt butter in a saucepan and saute onion and tomatoes in it until the onion is translucent. Add grits and water and bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to simmer and cook until the grits have absorbed the liquid and are tender (about 15 minutes). Add salt and pepper to taste and stir in bacon.
In a large bowl whisk together all ingredients. Transfer to an airtight container. Store in refrigerator until ready to use.

Make the pastry following the instructions on the packet or following one of the many recipes in this site. Roll out the pastry and use to line a shallow round cake tin of about 20cm diameter. Place the pastry case in the fridge while you make the filling. To make the filling, add the dried fruit to a pan with the water, stir to mix them in then bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to simmer and cook for about ten minutes stirring occasionally so the fruit does not stick to the pan. Stir in the walnuts and cherries then remove from the heat and allow to cool before adding to the pastry case. Preheat the oven to 200c/fan 180c/gas mark 6. Beat the egg with the lemon juice then pour over the pastry case. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes or until the pastry is lightly golden. Remove from the oven and leave to cool in the tin for about ten minutes then lift out on a wire rack to finish cooling completely. To make the topping, beat together the icing sugar with the lemon juice until

Peel the potatoes. Slice them into half-moons. Sprinkle salt all over the slices. In a bowl mix together the thyme, sumac, flour, salt and pepper. Mix the flour mixture into the slices. Dip them into the melted butter. Coat them evenly with the spices. Place them onto a cookie sheet. Spray the tops with cooking spray. Bake for about 30 to 35 minutes. Flip the slices over halfway through baking. Serve with a salad.

Mix hamburger and water in large skillet and brown well over medium heat. Add the onions and cook for a couple of minutes until tender and translucent. Add the rest of the ingredients except the water and cheese and cook for about 10 minutes stirring frequently. Pour the contents into a casserole dish and top with the cheese. Bake in a moderate oven (325 degrees) for about 20 minutes until the cheese melts and the dish is hot.

Bring large pot of water and salt to a boil over high heat. Cook pasta according to package directionsdrain and keep warm. In a large skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and bell pepper and cook until softened and starting to brown, 4-6 minutes. Stir in garlic and cook for 30 seconds more. Add flour and cook for 1 minute more, stirring constantly. Gradually stir in broth and cook until gravy thickens slightly and bubbles are just beginning to form, about 5 minutes. Stir in tomato paste and cook for another minute. Stir in pasta and cook until warmed through and heated through. Season with salt and pepper.

In saucepan, boil rhubarb until soft and mushy. Drain liquid from pan. In large bowl, combine with sugar and gelatin. Add enough boiling water to dissolve gelatin. Add raspberry flavored lite evaporated milk and mix well. Pour into serving bowl and chill until set. Rhubarb is very acidic. For best flavor, use bottled white grape juice or white wine for boiling liquid.

Cook the macaroni in salted boiling water until tender. Drain and set aside. Melt the butter in a skillet and add the eggs and the paprika. Beat until combined. Add the evaporated milk and the condensed cheddar cheese soup. Cook and stir until heated through. Add the macaroni and the cheddar cheese. Stir until the cheese is melted. Serve warm.

Combine cucumber and mint in a large bowl. Sprinkle salt and cumin over cucumber mixture. Add cayenne pepper to taste. In another bowl, whisk together sugar and yogurt. Pour over cucumber mixture. Cover and refrigerate for one hour or until flavors meld. Stir in paprika and adjust seasonings. Serve at room temperature.

Place chicken breast halves into a large non-metal bowl. In a small bowl combine oil and mustardpour mixture over chicken. Cover and refrigerate for 8 to 12 hours. Drain chicken and remove from bowl. Heat oil and butter in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Add leek soup mix and cook until tender. Stir in broccoli and cheddar cheese. Add chicken and cook until heated through. Serve over hot cooked rice.

To prepare the olive tapenade combine the olive oil with the shallot and season well with salt and pepper. In a separate small bowl combine the capers and olives and toss well with some olive oil. Spread the tapenade evenly on the cod and arrange the cherry tomatoes and oregano on top of the tapenade and bake for 10-15 minutes until the tomatoes are tender and the cod is flaky and cooked through.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Spray a large casserole dish with cooking spray. Rub the inside of the chicken breasts with the garlic cloves. In a small bowl, mix the yogurt, mustard, ginger, salt and pepper. Place the breasts skin side down in the casserole dish. Spoon the yogurt mixture over the breasts. Bake for 30 minutes or until the meat thermometer reads 170 degrees. Let rest for 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Bring a large saucepan of water to boil. Boil spanish onion in water until translucent, but not brown. Drain in colander and dry on paper towels. In olive oil, fry onion until browned. Set aside. In bowl, mix together butter, sour cream, salt, pepper and thyme leaves. Cut sweet potatoes in half lengthwise and scoop out the insides with a melon baller, leaving a one-inch thick shell around each half. Fill each half with sour cream mixture. Top with caramelized onion. Bake at 400 degrees f until golden and heated through, about 40-45 minutes.
Combine milk, cream cheese, mayonnaise and horseradish sauce. Mix well. Add remaining ingredients. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with crackers or toasted baguette slices.

Cut crushed pineapple into small cubes and place in large bowl. Add frozen blackberries and chopped peaches. Mix together and let stand. Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish. Mix yellow cake mix with pecans and pour into baking pan. Pour pineapple mixture on top. Dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees F. for about 45 minutes. Cool and serve. Makes 10 servings. Serve with ice cream.

Cut english muffin into quarters and toast. Set aside. Saute canadian bacon until crisp. Remove from pan and set aside. Cut swiss cheese into thin slices. Place one slice of cheese on each toasted english muffin quarter. Place two canadian bacon slices on each cheese. Crack one egg onto each and season with black pepper and cayenne pepper to taste. Melt butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Whisk egg yolks and milk together until blended. Pour butter into skillet and cook until butter begins to brown on the bottom of the pan. Stir constantly until egg yolk mixture thickens slightly. Remove from heat and add minced fresh dill weed and freshly ground black pepper to taste. Top each egg with a dollop of hollandaise sauce and sprinkle lightly with freshly ground black pepper to taste.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, add oil. Add butter. Cook until butter has melted. Add sage leaves. Cook, stirring frequently, for 30 seconds. Add garlic. Cook, stirring frequently, for 1 minute. Add potatoes. Cook until potatoes are tender and golden brown. Add chicken broth. Cook until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Saute chicken in the same skillet over medium heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until cooked through. Sprinkle parsley over chicken.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain. Melt butter in medium saucepan. Add flour gradually until mixture resembles dough. Add milk and stir constantly until mixture thickens slightly. Stir in seasonings. Add potatoes. Mix gently. Place in greased 2 quart baking dish. Cover with foil. Bake for 45 minutes or until mixture is lightly browned. Stir once during baking. Uncover. Sprinkle with shredded cheese. Bake until cheese is melted.

In a saucepan, heat butter until melted. Stir in flour until a paste is formed. Gradually stir in milk. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil for one minute and stir in salt, pepper and sugar. Stir in the onions and cook for 5 minutes. Add the string beans and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Pour over the Swiss cheese and let stand for 5 minutes. Combine the beaten egg whites and the sour cream. Stir into the vegetables and stir in the corn flakes. Pour mixture into a greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes. Top with additional Swiss cheese. Bake for 10 minutes longer.

To make sandwiches, spread one side of each slice of white bread with about 1 teaspoon of hot pepper jelly. Place one slice of ham and one slice of turkey on each slice of bread. Top with about 1 tablespoon of cheese. Put together two of the sandwiches. Spread milk on cut side of remaining two sandwiches. Spread one slice of bread with butter. Place remaining slice of bread on top. Press to seal. Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add butter and swirl to coat. Add sandwiches to pan and fry until golden brown and cheese is melted. Turn sandwiches over. Cook until golden brown.

Cut chicken into bite-sized pieces. Combine in large bowl with celery and bell peppers. Add 1/2 cup of dill weed. In small bowl combine remaining dill weed with the dry ranch dressing mix. Add to the bowl with chicken. Add mayonnaise. Mix well. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with fresh garden lettuce.

Remove stems from the mushrooms. Stuff each mushroom with the spicy bulk sausage. Set aside. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the scallions and the garlic. Cook for a few minutes. Add the soy sauce, water, and the breadcrumbs. Stir to combine. Add the sausages to the skillet. Cook the sausages for about 5-7 minutes. Remove the sausages from the skillet. Transfer the sausages to the prepared mushrooms. Bake for 15 minutes.

Add sugar to boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add cool water to reduce the syrup to 2 cups and mix well. Add creamy peanut butter and mix well. Place ice cream in large bowl and pour syrup over ice cream and stir well to blend. Decorate with salted peanuts and serve.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish and set it aside. In a large mixing bowl beat together the mashed sweet potatoes, sugar, vanilla and eggs until smooth and well blended. Add evaporated milk and beat until smooth and well combined. Pour the mixture into the prepared baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for about an hour until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and cool for about ten minutes. Stir in the coconut and nuts and bake uncovered for another hour or until golden brown and firm. Serve warm or room temperature.

Bring the water and a pinch of salt to the boil in a small pan and then add the sugar. Cook gently for about 4 minutes until the sugar has dissolved. Turn off the heat and add the fruit, nuts and vanilla extract. Allow the fruit and nuts to soak for about 10 minutes, then drain off the syrup. Bring the water back to the boil in a pan and add the couscous. Cook gently for about 10 minutes until the water has been absorbed by the couscous and it is soft but firm to the bite. Meanwhile, make up the milk mixture by stirring the sugar into the milk in a small pan until dissolved. Mix the fruit syrup, the cream and the honey with the milk in the same pan and then add the cooked couscous. Stir until the mixture is creamy and well combined and spoon into serving dishes and sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Serve immediately.

Bring milk to a gentle boil. Meanwhile add eggs to a medium sized bowl and whisk to combine. Add salt and pepper. Whisk again. Add the hot milk to the eggs and mix until smooth. Add the cooked pastina to the egg mixture and toss. Serve immediately.

To prepare the steak and sweet potatoes, slice the steak into large chunks and place in a large bowl with the ginger and extra virgin olive oil with half the black pepper. Cover and leave in the fridge for at least two hours and up to overnight. Place the steak chunks in a large frying pan and cook over medium heat for around 10-12 minutes until done to your liking. Meanwhile, slice the sweet potato and add to the oil from the steak with the remaining black pepper. Cook for around 10 minutes until soft and golden brown. Pour the steak juices into the pan and cook for another minute. Stir through the sweet chili sauce and serve with the steak and the sweet potato with the steak juices poured over. For an extra kick of flavour and crunchy texture, add a few slices of spring onion on top of the steak and the sweet potato when serving.

Prepare rolls as directed on packagebrush with butter. Top each roll half with 1 slice black forest ham and 1/2 tbsp chive & onion cream cheeseplace 1 tbsp gruyere over cream cheesewrap rolls in foil to keep warm. In small bowl stir together remaining sauce ingredientsbrush rolls with sauce to coat. Broil rolls 2-4 minutes or until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with parmesancut rolls in half crosswise to serve.

On a lightly floured surface, roll each dough out to 8 inch rounds. Place a circle of pasta sauce in the center of each. Sprinkle with green pepper and onion. Add mushrooms and olives. Layer with mozzarella and pepperoni. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Place in a greased 13 inch x 9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until biscuits are browned and bubbly.

Slice green peppers in half and remove seeds. Steam until tender. Remove and place in a 10 x 13 pan. Brown meat, garlic and onion in a small saucepan until meat is no longer pink. Drain fat from meat mixture. Spread meat mixture over the bell peppers and sprinkle with a little water over the top to prevent sticking. Bake at 325 degrees F (165 degrees C) uncovered for 40 to 45 minutes or until meat is no longer pink and peppers are tender. Serve with rice.

Make yellow cake according to package directions. Let cool. In a mixing bowl, beat the instant pudding mix with milk until it is smooth. Add the coffee liqueur and beat until just combined. In a small bowl, combine the cocoa and coffee. Add the cocoa mixture to the pudding and beat until combined.
