Fold in the cooled yellow cake batter and pour into a greased and lightly floured bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 50 minutes. Dust with powdered sugar and serve with a dollop of whipped cream. For a grown-up version, add a shot of Kahlua or Grand Marnier after mixing the pudding.

Soak ham hocks in water for 2 to 24 hours. Remove hocks from water, rinse and drain well. In a large pot, saute onions in oil over medium heat until the onions are tender. Add hocksbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add drained pink beansbring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to lowcover pan partially with lid or aluminum foil. Cook for 30 to 45 minutes or until beans are tender but not mushy. Add more water if necessarycheck often and add water if beans start to cook dry. Season with salt and pepper to taste. If they are salted before they will not soften. When cool, divide into 1 cup servings and freeze in rigid container or vacuum pack in small bags.

Remove husks from the tomatillos and rinse well. Slice the tomatillos in half and scoop the pulp from the shells. Place the salsa in a food processor and pulse to a smooth consistency. Transfer to a bowl and add the remaining ingredients and mix.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. In a large mixing bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar. Add eggs and beat til well blended. Stir in vanilla. Add flour mixture and stir til well blended. Stir in mashed bananas and chocolate chips. Spoon batter into prepared loaf pan and sprinkle with nutmeg. Bake in preheated oven for 60-65 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into center of loaf comes out clean. Let loaf cool in pan for 10 minutes and then turn out onto a wire rack to cool.

Unroll crescent rolls. Cut each crescent roll into 8 triangles. Place 1 tablespoon of the whipped mixture in the center of each triangle. Sprinkle with crab meat and roll up each triangle. Place seam side down in a 13 x 9 x 2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with parsley and season with lemon juice and pepper to taste. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown and heated through. Serve with extra whipped mixture for dipping.

Mix panko and parmesan. Spread flour on a plate. Dip flounder in flour. Dip in egg. Roll in panko/parm blend. Place on a foil lined cookie sheet. Drizzle butter over fillets. Sprinkle salt and pepper. Bake at 450 for 25 minutes.

In a large bowl, beat together the dark brown sugar and eggs. Add the all-purpose flour and salt and beat until smooth. Fold in the milk and vanilla extract. Pour mixture in a greased and lined nine-inch square cake pan and bake at 350 degrees F for 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream if desired.

Bring a pot of salted water to the boil. Cook spaghetti until al dente. While the water comes to the boil, heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the olive oil. When the oil is hot, add the garlic cloves. Cook for 30 seconds. Add the parsley. Cook for another minute. Add the spaghetti to the skillet. Cook for about another minute. Add a few red pepper flakes. Stir for a few seconds. Taste for seasoning. Serve immediately.

In a large ziplock bag, combine the chicken, orange marmalade, wine vinegar and pepper. Seal and mix well. Refrigerate for at least two hours, but no longer than overnight. Remove and discard any excess marinade from the bag. Place the chicken breasts skin-side up and bake for about 20 minutes or until fully cooked through and juices run clear. Add the olive oil and the remaining ingredients to the bag and mix well. Remove the chicken and brush the top and sides with the marinade. Place back into the bag and marinate for another hour or two or overnight. Remove the chicken and brush the top and sides with the marinade. Place back into the bag and marinate for another hour or two or overnight. Place the chicken breasts skin-side up and bake for about 20 minutes or until fully cooked through and juices run clear. Remove and discard any excess marinade from the bag. Place the chicken breasts skin-side up and bake for about 20 minutes or until fully cooked through and juices run clear.

Wash the potatoes well. Boil them till tender. Peel them. Dice into cubes. In a frying pan, heat the butter over low heat. Add the chopped onions. Stir for 5 minutes. Add the boiled potatoes. Stir for another 5 minutes. Add the chopped tomato. Stir for another 5 minutes. Add the boiled peas. Stir for a few minutes. Add the boiled corn. Stir for a few minutes. Add the chopped watercress. Stir for a few minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Place chicken broth in large saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a gentle simmer and add garlic powder and simply potatoes traditional mashed potatoes. Cook for 15 minutes stirring occasionally. Add monterey jack cheese stirring constantly for 1 minute. Add spinach last 30 seconds of cooking. Stir gently to combine. Serve with optional green onions garnish.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix all of the dry ingredients and all of the wet ingredients separately. Pour the dry mixture into a 9 by 13 greased baking dish, then pour the wet mixture over the dry mixture. Mix well and bake for 40 minutes or until it tests done. Let it sit for 5 minutes before serving it.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add dried split peas. Boil for 30 minutes. Add garlic, carrot, dried marjoram. Boil for 30 minutes. Add ham. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add olive oil, onions. Simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Combine 2 pounds of ground beef with 1 teaspoon of kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon of ground pepper. Form into 6 to 8 patties. Brown in a large skillet over medium heat. Remove patties from skillet and drain off any excess grease. Keep warm while you prepare the other items. Cook french fries in a large skillet with oil and 1 teaspoon of kosher salt and 1/4 teaspoon of ground pepper. Keep warm in a warm oven. Place a slice of mozzarella cheese over each french fry and put them on a baking sheet. Cook in a 325 degree oven until bubbly. Meanwhile, heat 2 tablespoons of butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add 1 cup of caramelized onion and 2 tablespoons of chicken gravy. Heat through and remove from heat. Put two french fries and a patty of poutine burger in each bun.
Slice peaches into quarters, leaving pit intact. Combine all ingredients in a 4-5 quart slow cooker. Cook for 3-4 hours on low or 2 hours on high. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar and Criscoadd eggs and beat at medium speed 2 minutes. Beat in the milk and vanilla. Pour into a greased 10-inch tube pan and bake 1 hour 10 minutes or until done. Turn out onto a wire rack to cool 10 minutes. Remove pan from oveninvert pan onto a wire rack to cool completely. Frost with cream cheese frosting. Note: This cake freezes very well.

To prepare dressing, mix all the dressing ingredients in a bowl until well blended. To prepare the salad, wash the strawberries and remove the green stems from the kiwi. Halve the strawberries and place in a bowl with the kiwi slices. Add the spinach leaves. Toss with the dressing. Sprinkle the almonds over the strawberries and kiwi. Place the grilled chicken breast slices over the top. Drizzle with a little more dressing if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. In medium bowl, mix together brown sugar, salt, chipotle powder, garlic powder, onion powder, brown sugar. Place tenderloin into bowl then toss to coat all over the tenderloin. Place tenderloin in shallow pan then pour remaining seasoning mix over tenderloin then place in preheated oven for 35-40 minutes or until tender when poked with fork or meat thermometer reads 145 degrees f.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Slice the brats crosswise into 1/2-inch thick slices. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook brats for 5 minutes until browned. In the last minute of cooking, add the bell peppers to the skillet. Cook for 3 minutes or until tender crisp. Stir the onions into the peppers. Transfer to an ungreased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. In the same skillet over medium-high heat, saute the paprika, caraway seed and celery seed for 1 minute. Stir in beer until beer is almost gone. Pour the mixture over the brats and vegetables. Cover with aluminum foilbake for 20 minutes or until brats are heated through. Uncover and bake 10 to 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender crisp. Serve hot.

Brown chicken in skillet with olive oil. Add onions and carrots. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add cauliflower florets and dried herbs. Add enough broth to cover. Bring to boil and cover. Cook for about 10 minutes. Stir in pasta. Cook until tender. Add salt and pepper. Serve with parmesan cheese.

Pour the oil into a large saucepan and heat over low heat. Add the cumin seeds, garlic and onions. Cook for 5 minutes over low heat. Add the lentils and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer over medium heat. Cover and cook until the lentils are tender. Season with salt to taste. Garnish with cayenne.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, cook the macaroni and garlic until the pasta is al dente. Drain and rinse with cold water. Toss with ham. In a bowl, mix the mayonnaise, lime juice and honey. Add the cooked pasta and ham mixture and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with freshly chopped cilantro and serve.

Mix the bread crumbs with the mustard. Place the spinach in a large skillet. Add 1/4 cup of the oil. Saute the spinach for 2 minutes. Add the ham and heat through. Transfer the cooked ham to a cutting board and cut into 1-inch pieces. Dice the chicken. Add the remaining 1/4 cup oil to the skillet. Add the diced ham and cook for 3 minutes. Add the cooked spinach. Dice the goat cheese. Add the diced goat cheese and cook until the sauce is bubbling. Add the bread crumb mixture. Mix well. Fill each half of the chicken with about 1/2 cup of the sauce. Roll up each half of the chicken. Lay the rolls seam side down in a 9-inch square baking dish. Cover with foil. Bake for 40 minutes or until the sauce is bubbly. Remove the foil. Sprinkle the parsley evenly over the rolls. Bake until golden brown for about 5 minutes. Serve.

Prepare a brine by combining flour and cold water in a bowl and mix well. Add chicken breast and coat well on both sides. Let stand for an hour before cooking. Heat oil in a large fry pan over medium-high heat. Brown the chicken on both sides. Salt and pepper the chicken on both sides and transfer the chicken into the brine mixture. Let sit for about 15 minutes. Heat oil in a large fry pan over medium-high heat. Saute the green olives until golden brown and transfer them into the pan. Add the thyme and saute until fragrant. Add the sherry and cook until it is reduced by half. Add the chicken and bring to a boil. Cook until the chicken is tender and the liquid is reduced by half.

Preheat oven to 400f. Put prosciutto strips on a baking sheet and bake until crisp, 7 to 8 minutes. Meanwhile, bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Add gnocchi to boiling water and cook until tender, about 3 minutes. Drain gnocchi well and return to pot. Add garlic and a few grinds of black pepper. Set aside to cool for 1 to 2 minutes. Add prosciutto to gnocchi mixture, and toss well to combine. Transfer mixture to a lightly greased 1 1/2-quart baking dish or shallow 1 1/2-quart baking pan. Sprinkle with fontina cheese and fontina cheese, then with Parmesan. Bake until gnocchi are golden brown and bubbly around the edges and fontina is melted, 10 to 15 minutes. Sprinkle with basil leaves to garnish.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brush chops with margarinesprinkle with cinnamon. Arrange chops in shallow 2-quart baking dish. Arrange apple rings around each chop. In small bowl, mix brown sugar and remaining margarinebrush over each apple ring. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until chops are done.

Heat the canola oil over medium heat in a large skillet and add the garlic and saute for 1 minute. Add the snow peas and saute until tender crisp (2-3 minutes). Add the brown rice and cilantro and stir to coat. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve hot.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, melt 8 tablespoons of butter. Add flour and stir with a wooden spoon. Cook for 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Gradually whisk in the hot milk and cook for 1 minute more. Remove from heat. Whisk in the hot cocoa. Serve warm over biscuits and muffins.

Combine sugar and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil then turn heat down to a low simmer. Add in soymilk and simmer until it comes to a boil. Add in almonds. Reduce heat to low and simmer until the sugar is completely dissolved. Add in mint and stir gently. Pour into a shallow serving bowl. Let stand for 30 minutes. Stir until sugar crystals are completely dissolved. Sprinkle with almonds and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In large mixing bowl sift together cornmeal, baking soda and salt. In another large mixing bowl whisk together eggs and yogurt. Slowly add creamed corn to yogurt mixture and continue whisking. Add dry ingredients and continue whisking till mixture is smooth. Pour into 9x13 pan and bake for 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean. Cool and serve.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit and grease a loaf pan or line with parchment paper. Beat the egg whites until frothy and add the granulated sugar slowly until stiff and glossy. Add the vanilla extract and beat until combined. In a large bowl cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolks and beat until incorporated. Fold in the applesauce and the bananas, mixing until just combined. Sift the flour and baking soda and fold them into the batter until incorporated. Pour the batter into the loaf pan and bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let cool in pan for 20 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely before serving. Yields 1 loaf. Serve warm with a dollop of whipped cream.

Melt 8 ounces (2 sticks) of butter in a saucepan. Add 1 cup of chopped semi sweet chocolate (6 ounces). Stir until smooth. Stir in 1 cup sugar. Stir in 4 eggs. Stir in 1 3/4 cups of chopped nuts. In a separate bowl, whisk together 1 cup cake flour with 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Add to butter mixture. Stir until well blended. Spread dough in a greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350F for 25 to 30 minutes. Cool on rack. Makes 2 1/2 pounds.

In a large bowl, combine salt, Italian seasoning, pepper and water. Add potatoes and toss well. Stir in wine. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours. Add chops to mixture. Add sauerkraut and kielbasa. Cover and cook at low for 4 hours. Add peas. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Serve with brown rice. Makes 6 servings.

Beat together cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Add in vanilla and mini chocolate chips. Fold in chopped pecans. Form into balls and roll in crushed graham crackers. Serve with graham crackers.

Cut sweet potatoes in half lengthwise. Scrape out pulp. Scoop out pulp from each half of the potato into a medium bowl. Add apple pie filling, raisin, pecans, spice and sugar. Stir to combine well. Spoon filling into each sweet potato half. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at 375f for about 45 minutes or until potato is tender when pierced with fork. Serve hot or cold.
In a large bowl combine all ingredients. Use a wooden spoon to blend together until it reaches your desired consistency. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve with toasted bread.
Combine all of the ingredients, except oil. Mix well & form into small patties. Heat oil until hot. Fry patties for 5 minutes. Remove with slotted spoon & drain oil. Serve warm.

Heat oil in large saucepan. Add ground turkey and garlic. Cook until browned. Add tomato sauce and water. Bring to a boil. Add macaroni. Reduce heat to low. Cook 15 minutes. Add onion and seasonings. Cook 15 minutes more. Add corn. Cook 15 minutes longer.

In a saucepan, bring 1 cup water & brown sugar to a boil. Remove from heat & let stand for 10 minutes. Strain liquid into a 1 quart pitcher. Stir in cranberry juice & apple cider. Heat over low heat & bring just to a boil, stirring frequently to prevent burning. Remove from heat & stir in cinnamon stick & ginger. Add cinnamon stick, cloves & cinnamon sticks. Stir in orange slices & serve warm in mugs.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Wash and dry the sweet potatoes and cut into quarters. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet with sides and toss with the vegetable oil to coat. Season with the orange zest, juice and mustard. Sprinkle with the pecans and drizzle with the maple syrup and marmalade. Bake for 30 minutes or until the potatoes are tender.

Bring 4 cups of chicken stock to boil in large saucepan over high heat. Add rice, carrot and celerycook, stirring, until rice is tender. Stir in chicken piecescook until heated through. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Place 3/4 cup vinegar and 1 cup water in large skillet. Bring to boil over medium-high heat. Stir in honey and soy sauce. Add porkcook 5-6 minutes or until meat is done. Turn meatcook 3-4 minutes longer or until meat is done and juices run clear. Serve with rice.
Mix all ingredients except the lime gelatin. Let stand until firm. Refrigerate. When cool, cut into squares and serve.

Preheat oven to 425. Cream the butter and sugar together. Mix in the whipping cream. Then add the flour. Stir in the garlic and chillis. Add the cayenne. Pour mixture into greased scone tins. Bake at 425 for 25-30 minutes.

Peel and cut into chunks of beets. Boil them with some water for 10 minutes. Drain them in a colander with some ice cold water. Cut onions in half lengthwise. Slice them thinly and place in a shallow dish. Drizzle them with some of the butter or olive oil. Mix together balsamic vinegar, salt, pepper and some of the butter. Pour it over the onions and stir them well with a spoon. Add boiled beets and stir them again with a spoon. Serve cold.

Add the brown lentils to a large pot with the broth. Bring to a boil and reduce to a simmer. Cook for 20 minutes. Drain the lentils and place in a food processor or blender. Add the onion, bell peppers, cheese and the red pepper flakes. Puree until smooth. Pour the mixture into a small crock pot. Add a cup of water to the mixture. Cook on low for 30 minutes. Serve with chips.

Butter and flour a 9-inch tart pan with removable bottom or a deep cast iron skillet with a lid. Heat a pan over medium heat and add the onions and garlic cloves along with the bay leaf and black peppercorns. Cook until the onions are soft and translucentthen add the sea salt and cook for another minute. Stir in the whole cloves and remove from the heat. Set the pan aside and allow the mixture to cool down a little (not completely). Take out the bay leaf and add the thyme and the freshly grated black peppercorns and stir well. Cut the puff pastry into thirds and roll out each third into a large rectangle that is 4x12 inches. Cover the bottom and sides of the pan with the rectangles and prick the dough with a fork several times. Spoon in the onion mixture and place the lid on top. Bake for about 45 minutes until the dough is golden brown and the onions are soft and bubbly on top. Serve at room temperature or warm.

In a 9x13 pan combine water and stuffing mix according to package directions. Put one piece of chicken in each of the 9 cups prepared with the stuffing mixture. Top each piece of chicken with a slice of mozzarella cheese. Mix condensed soup and sour cream together in a mixing bowl and pour over the top of the chicken pieces in pan. Cover the pan with aluminum foil and bake for about one hour in a preheated oven at 350 degrees. While the bake is cooking prepare peas and carrots. Cook according to directions on package. Once the bake has been cooked for about one hour drain peas and carrots in a colander. Return the peas and carrots to the saucepan you cooked them in and add butter to the pan. Stir in the saucepan until all the peas and carrots are covered in butter. Once they are all covered in butter remove the pan from the burner. Pour peas and carrots over the bake to serve.

In a large bowl mix together the molasses and vinegar. Add the tahini and whisk until smooth. Whisk in the brown sugar. Add the soy sauce and whisk until the mixture is smooth. Add the sesame oil and whisk until smooth. In a separate bowl mix together the salt and the green onion. Add the mixture to the vinegar mixture and whisk until smooth. Serve the sauce over the cooked soba noodles.

Combine all the ingredients (except for the tabasco sauce) together, mix well and cover. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight to blend the flavors. Right before serving, add the tabasco sauce to taste. Serve cold with crackers for dipping.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter, applesauce, sugars, and banana. Add in the eggs and pure vanilla extract. In a separate bowl combine the all-purpose flour, baking soda, and oats. Mix this into the banana mixture until a soft dough forms. Roll dough into balls about the size of a ping pong ball. Place onto a cookie sheet lined with parchment paper about 2 inches apart. Cook for 10 minutes or until edges are slightly golden. Finally press a fork into the center of the cookie to make a criss-cross pattern. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven 350 degrees. In a skillet heat olive oil with garlic until garlic is lightly browned. Stir in parsley, onions and tomato sauce and bring to a boil. Add halibut to the mixture in the skillet. Bring mixture to a boil again. Pour mixture into a lightly greased 8 x 12 casserole dish. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Bake uncovered about 40 minutes or until fish flakes with a fork.

Cook pasta until done. Drain. In a large skillet brown the ground beef until no longer pink. Add broccoli. Sprinkle with flour. Add mustard to the skillet and mix together. Gradually add the milk. Cook and stir until thickened. Add the drained pasta and stir until well combined. Add the cheese. Taste and add salt and pepper if needed. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Prepare jasmine rice. Place in oven for 10 minutes. Place garlic in skillet. Add olive oil. Add onions. Stir to mix. Add shrimp. Add fish sauce. Add sugar. Cook for 5 minutes. Add crushed pineapple. Add green onions. Cook for 5 minutes. Serve over hot jasmine rice.

In a large zip-lock bag combine pepper sauce, butter, cider vinegar, ranch dressing mix, paprikaseal bag. Add frozen chicken wingsseal bag. Place in crockpotturn to medium-high heatcook 3-4 hours or until chicken is tender. Turn to lowcook an additional 1 hour. Serve with celery sticks and carrot sticks. Great with sweet pickles!

Pour pretzel sticks into a large mixing bowl and add enough water to cover pretzels completely. Bring water to a boil and stir pretzels until they are well covered with water. Drain and set aside to cool. In a large bowl combine margarine and cream cheese and beat until smooth. Add white sugar and beat until well blended. Beat in cool whip. Pour into a shallow baking dish and chill until set. Cut pretzels into one-inch pieces and spread over top of cream cheese mixture. When set up add raspberries over top and refrigerate until serving time.
Add jello powder to boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add juices. Pour into a 9x13 inch pan. Chill until firm. Add fresh raspberries. Chill. This will make about 6 cups.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a large skillet, brown the ground beef and onions. Drain the fat from the pan. Add the spaghetti sauce and frozen spinach to the pan. Add the ravioli to the pan and cover the pan with a lid. Cook for 10 minutes until the sauce and ravioli are heated through and the spinach is thawed. Pour the mixture into an 8x8x2 inch baking dish and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees f for 15 minutes until the cheese is bubbly and browned on top.

Layer the bottom of a large baking pan with slices of the pita bread. Spread the cream cheese over the slices of the pita. Add the slices of solid white tuna and sprinkle with the mild cheddar cheese. Layer the top of the baking pan with additional slices of pita. Place the baking pan into the oven for 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Remove the baking pan from the oven and place onto a serving platter. Cut the pita into wedges and serve.
Cook the spinach in boiling water until tender and drain. Combine the sesame seeds, dashi and soy sauce and mix well. Put the spinach in a serving bowl and pour the dressing over. Serve warm.

Mix all the ingredients except hash browns together. Fill a greased glass pie plate about half full with hash browns, then add meat mixture and spread evenly. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake at 400 for about 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted and pie is baked through. Serve hot.

Beat the yolks and sugar until thick and lemon colored. Add the grated lemon rind and mix well. Beat in the nuts and the vanilla extract. Spread the mixture on the wax paper and allow it to cool for an hour or so. Make sure it is hard enough to roll out into little cookies and place on wax paper to cool and dry completely before storing in airtight container.

In a large bowl, soak bread in half-and-half. Add ground turkey, egg and seasonings. Mix well. Form the mixture into patties and place on a plate. In another bowl combine dry breadcrumbs and seasonings. Dip patties in the butter and coat on all sides with breadcrumb mixture. Fry in a hot pan with cooking oil. Turn and fry on the other side until golden brown. Serve with butter or sour cream.

Mix the mayonnaise with the rest of the ingredients. Spread on the top of the bread and layer with the slices of apple and cooked chicken and cranberries. Add the second slice of bread and cut into sandwiches.

Cream together the butter and powdered sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the walnuts and the vanilla. Stir in the flour until mixture is stiff and will hold together when squeezed in the palm of your hand. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto a cookie sheet that has been greased or lined with parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees for about 15 minutes or until light brown. Cool on wire rack.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter and 1 tablespoon oil in skillet. Saute onions and garlic in skillet until tender. Remove garlic and set aside. Sprinkle with 1 tablespoon brown sugar and 1 tablespoon water. Stir and cook until brown. Add 1 tablespoon more brown sugar and 1 tablespoon water. Cook until lightly browned. Dissolve 1/2 tablespoon brown sugar and 1/2 tablespoon water. Add to onions. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Heat skillet again. Drizzle with 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Place steak on plate and top with onions. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

In a bowl combine first 7 ingredients. Form into balls. In a heavy skillet heat 1/2 inch of oil over medium heat. Add meatballs and brown on all sides. Remove and keep warm. In a 3-quart casserole dish mix tomato paste and hunts tomato sauce. Stir in oil and add meatballs. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until done. Makes 16 servings.

Mix together the butter with the honey, cranberries, and sugar until smooth. Add the eggs, milk and vanilla until well combined. Heat a skillet or frying pan on medium heat until hot. Dip your bread into the egg mixture and then place into the heated pan. Flip the bread once the bottom is golden brown. Top with the brie and bake for an additional 2-3 minutes until the brie is melted and bubbly. Serve immediately!
Melt butter in saucepan. Add chopped mushrooms and saute until soft. Add drained spinach to mushrooms. Combine all together. Pour into pie shell. Place in pre-heated 425-degree oven for 35 minutes.

Mix all the ingredients together in a small saucepan. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens. It will thicken more as it stands. Cool and transfer to a storage jar. Use as a substitute in any recipe that calls for French-style mustard.

In large bowl combine brownie mix and applesauce. Add remaining ingredients and stir until well blended. Spoon into paper lined muffin tins or mini paper lined muffin tins. Bake for 22 minutes. Remove from oven and cool completely.

Cream the sugar and salt together in a large mixing bowl. Add the eggs one at a time, whisking after each addition. Add the cornflour and then the baking powder and whisk until thoroughly combined. Add the milk and mix together until smooth and creamy. Spoon the mixture into a lined 20 cm cake tin and level the top with a knife. Place the tin in the centre of the oven and cook for about 1 hour, or until a skewer comes out clean when inserted in the middle of the cake. Allow the cake to cool in the tin before turning out onto a serving plate.

Sift the dry ingredients together. Cream the butter with the sugar until it is light and fluffy. Add the beaten eggs one at a time, stirring well after each addition. Add the dry ingredients gradually to the wet. Stir until smooth. Stir in the orange juice. Pour into a well greased 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on a wire rack.

In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic. Cook until tender. Add potatoes and cook 5 minutes longer. Add broth, water and vegetables. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Puree in a blender or food processor. Return to pan. Reheat before serving. Garnish with chives.

Place all vegetables in large stockpot. Add enough water to cover. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Cover and cook for 40 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Puree the tomato with 1/2 cup of the broth. Pour into soup. Add the remaining broth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

In large skillet, heat oil. Saute ginger and garlic until fragrant. Add soy sauce and rice wine. Stir to dissolve. Add beef and cook until browned. Add snow peas and cook until heated through. Add cornstarch mixture and cook until sauce thickens. Serve over noodles.

In a large skillet or Dutch oven, cook onions over medium heat until tender. Stir in the curry powder, aroma seasoning, broth, and chicken. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat to lowcook 15 minutes. In a small bowl, stir together the corn flake crumbs and melted butterset aside. Stir the crumb mixture into the soupcook 1 minute longer. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Brown meat and onion in a large skillet. Drain and add spaghetti sauce and tomato sauce. Add macaroni and pepperoni and stir until thoroughly combined. Top with mozzarella. Bake uncovered at 375 degrees fahrenheit for 25 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Dice the eggplant and saute in olive oil for 10 minutes with a generous pinch of garlic powder, until softened. In a food processor or blender, blend the marinara sauce with a few glugs of olive oil until smooth. Add the eggplant to the sauce along with the basil, mozzarella, romano and chicken (if using). Simmer for about 30 minutes until the sauce thickens slightly. Cook the rigatoni to al dente, drain well, then return to the pot with the sauce mixture. Mix well and serve in bowls or plates topped with shredded mozzarella.

Cream margarine and powdered sugar in medium mixing bowl. Add walnuts and mix well with fork. Add flour and mix well with fork. Roll dough into small balls about 1 inch across. Place balls on greased baking sheet. Bake in a 325 degree oven for 35 minuites. Remove from oven. While still warm roll puffs in the powdered sugar. Roll in the sugar again when puffs are cool.

Take a medium size saucepan and add 1 inch water to it. Add smoked sausages to the water. Cover the pan and simmer for 15 minutes. Remove the sausages from the water. Place them in a shallow pan. Add barbecue sauce. Stir to coat the sausages with the sauce. Allow the mixture to rest for 10 minutes. Roll the buns in the mixture.

Preheat your grill. In a small saucepan, bring to a boil the orange juice concentrate, chipotle chiles and molasses. In a small jar, mix together the cornstarch and water. Put lid on and shake vigorously. Pour the cornstarch slurry into the boiling glaze mixture and reduce to a simmer. Cook about 2 minutes until it becomes clear and thickens. Season the corn with salt and pepper and brush with a little oil. Grill corn 3 to 5 minutes per side, brushing glaze on while cooking. Remove from grill and allow to rest for 10 minutes. Cut ears from husk and remove silk. Cut kernels from cobs and discard silk. Place cobs back on husk and fold back. Serve with extra lime wedges.

Mix the dry ingredients. Add the vinegar and the lard. Stir until it is smooth and sticky. Add the egg and stir until it is smooth. Spread it on the bottom of a pie tin and place the top crust on it. Bake at 400 degrees until it is brown on top. If your dough gets too dry to work with you can moisten it by adding a little milk to it to make it sticky again.

Drain crushed pineapple well and add the rest of the ingredients to make the stuffing. Place the stuffing in an ungreased 2 quart casserole dish and place in the refrigerator for several hours or overnight. Place the white bread cubes in the baking dish and pour the stuffing over the cubes. Bake for about 45 minutes at 375 degrees F. Serve with lemon sauce or ice cream.

Saute scallops, shrimp, mushrooms and basil in tomato juice with white wine for 2 minutes. Add mussels, lemon juice and zest to scallops mixture. Cook for 3 minutes until scallops are done. Place mozzarella on top of scallops mixture in an oven-proof bowl. Bake for 5 minutes until cheese melts. Serve with lemon wedge.

Sprinkle the top of each tomato with a little of the cheese and drizzle with a little of the pesto sauce and garnish with green onion. Place the tomatoes on the grill until the cheese has melted and the top is slightly browned, about 8-10 minutes.

Spread about a third of the salsa on each tortilla and top with a third of the chili powder and a third of the shredded chicken. Roll up and place seam side down in an ungreased 15x10x1-inch baking pan. Top with remaining tortillas, salsa and cheeses. Bake at 350° for 15-20 minutes or until heated through and the edges are golden brown. Cut into wedges and serve with additional salsa if desired.

Mix sugar and water in a large saucepan. Stir in apples and cranberries. Cook over medium heat until tender. Do not overcook or fruit will be mushy. Remove from heat and stir in oats, flour and pecans. Let cool. For the crumble top, mix together the remaining sugar, flour and pecans. Cut in the butter with a pastry blender or fork until the mixture resembles coarse cornmeal. Sprinkle this mixture over the fruit mixture. Bake in a preheated 400f oven for about 30 minutes until the crumble top is lightly browned. Serve with vanilla ice cream.

Heat a griddle pan over a medium heat and grease with a little olive oil. Cook the tomatoes and halloumi for 2-3 minutes each side or until golden brown and cooked through. Meanwhile, toast the bread on the griddle and rub with some pesto and a little olive oil. Place the haloumi on the toast with some chopped tomato and drizzle with some lemon juice and a little more oil. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet or griddle pan, brown sausage and add onions until tender. Dice potatoes into bite sized piecesadd them into pan with onions and sausage. In a separate bowl, beat eggs with salt and pepperadd them into pan with hash browns. Cook until eggs are set and hash browns are golden brownadd cheese when eggs are almost set. Serve with biscuits or rolls.

Season steaks with dry onion soup mix & salt & pepper. Place steaks in a foil pouch along with a bay leaf & water. Place in a 350 oven for 1 hour. Slice carrots & celery & place around steaks. Pour a little bit of water over vegetables. Place a pouch of steak on top & another bay leaf & water on top. Place in 350 oven for 30-45 min. Steaks should be tender & juicy. Serve over rice.
Mix cantaloupe and strawberries. Sprinkle with rosewater and icing sugar. Serve.

Add the frozen broccoli florets to the stock. Simmer until the broccoli is tender. Add celery, onions and potatoes. Cook until the potatoes are tender. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, mix together the half-and-half, thyme, salt and pepper. Pour the milk mixture over the soup. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Cook for 5 minutes or until the potatoes are tender. Puree the mixture in a blender or food processor until smooth. Return to the saucepan and reheat. Stir in the cheddar cheese. Serve immediately.

Mix dry biscuit mix with water in bowl until soft. Spray greased 9x13 baking dish with cooking spray or olive oil cooking spray. In skillet brown meat until no longer pink. Add onions, soup and onion mix. Stir until blended. Place in pan with mixture and mushrooms. Spray pan with cooking spray. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve over rice or baked potato with salad or vegetable.

Beat cream cheese and sugar together. Mix in cocoa. Add milk and beat for about 2 minutes. Add whipped topping and blend. Pour into graham cracker crust. Refrigerate for 4 hours or until firm. Store in refrigerator. When ready to serve, let stand at room temperature for 30 minutes.

Wash and dry the new potatoes. Cut each in quarters lengthwise and then again crosswise. Put the potatoes in a large sauce pan with enough cold water to cover. Bring to the boil and boil for 10 minutes. Drain the potatoes and cool. Peel the tomatoes and remove the seeds. Cut the tomatoes in wedges and the onions in half. Chop the cilantro and the green onions. In a blender combine the olive oil, picante sauce and the juice of one lime. Add the green onion and cilantro and blend until smooth. Pour the mixture over the potatoes and tomatoes and let sit for 10 to 15 minutes. Add the olives and stir gently. Sprinkle the potatoes and tomatoes with salt and pepper and serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.

Blend the chickpeas and the rest of the ingredients together in a food processor until the mixture is creamy and smooth. If you wish, add more lemon juice or a little more water for a thinner consistency. Serve with pita chips or crackers.

Melt ghee in a pan over medium heat. Add milk and sugar, stirring constantly until sugar dissolves completely. Add the rava to the milk mixture while stirring constantly. Cook for 10 minutes on medium heat while stirring constantly. Add cardamoms and saffron strands while stirring constantly. Cook for 15 minutes on medium heat while stirring constantly. Add the raisins and cook for 10 minutes on medium heat while stirring constantly. Add the coconut flakes and cook for 5 minutes on medium heat while stirring constantly. Transfer mixture to a plate or bowl and shape into ladoos as desired.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the shallot and cook for about 3 minutes until soft. Add the chicken breast halve and cook for about 4 minutes until golden brown. Add the wine and cook for 3 minutes. Add the broth and 1/2 teaspoon of the tarragon. Simmer until the potatoes are tender and the chicken is cooked through about 15 minutes. Season the chicken with salt and freshly ground black pepper and transfer to a plate. Discard the tarragon stems and add the remaining tarragon to the skillet. Cook for about 1 minute and then discard the tarragon leaves. Add the potatoes and cook for about 3 minutes until tender. Return the chicken to the skillet and add the parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cook sausage. Drain. Add to a large bowl. Add sausage to a large bowl. Add sausage to the sausage. Add remaining ingredients. Mix. Pour into a 11x9 inch baking dish. Bake for about half an hour.

In a large skillet over medium heat, warm the hazelnut oil. Add the pears to the skillet. Cook 6 to 8 minutes or until the pears are soft. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the blue cheese with the pepper. Stir in the walnuts. In a large salad bowl, combine the arugula with the blue cheese mixture. Drizzle with the dressing. Divide the pears among the servings. Sprinkle with the parmesan. Serve immediately.

Peel apricots and cut into quarters. Place in a pan with the sugar, water and almond extract. Cook for 15-20 minutes until the fruit is softened and the mixture is thick and jam-like. Stir in the ground almonds before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2-quart baking dish with cooking spray or oilset aside. Beat lemon pudding mix according to package instructions. Meanwhile, mix vegetable oil with lemon juiceset aside. In large bowl, combine all-purpose flour with 1 cup of the poppy seedsstir to mix well. In small bowl, beat eggs until foamygradually beat into the flour mixture with the lemon juice mixture until smooth. Beat in 1/2 of the pudding mix (about 1-1/4 cups) until combined well. Fold remaining pudding mix into the batterfold in the remaining 1/4 cup of poppy seeds. Pour batter into prepared baking dishsmooth the top of the batter. Bake for 55 to 65 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool completely before serving.

Melt butter over medium heat in heavy saucepan. Stir in flour until blended. Cook roux about 3 min. over moderately low heat stirring constantly. Gradually add chicken stock stirring constantly until mixture thickens. Cook over low heat stirring constantly until thickened, stirring constantly about 2 min. Remove from heat. Gradually stir in the sugar, egg yolks, vinegar and dill. Cook over moderately low heat stirring constantly about 2 min until mixture thickens again. Remove from heat. Stir in salt. Stir in whipping cream until sauce is smooth. Stir until smooth.
Form the mixture into balls and bake in a 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes or until they are done. You can serve them with chili sauce or a brown sugar glaze..

Cook bacon and drain on paper towels. Place 3 slices of bacon on each croissant half. Top with a slice of tomato and a sprig of flat-leaf parsley and a dash of mayonnaise. Season to taste with salt and pepper and serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients. Pour into a shallow glass dish. Chill. Serve with crackers.

Slice cucumber in half lengthwise, scoop out seeds with spoon and slice into 1/8-inch-thick rounds. Cut red onion into 1/2-inch-thick half-moons and red radishes into thin wedges. Combine remaining ingredients in large glass measuring cup. With back of spoon, press onion slices into vinegar mixture to release juicesdiscard slices. Arrange sliced onion, radishes and cucumber on large plattersprinkle with crushed red pepper. Cover and chill for 2 hours before serving. Toss just before serving to coat with vinegar mixture. Makes 6 servings.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, saute the onions in the olive oil until translucent. Add the green beans, carrots, stock, almond milk and dried herbs. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook until the beans are tender. Puree with an immersion blender or transfer to a blender. Add salt to taste. To serve, sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Combine all of the above ingredients except red potatoes and cabbage in a large slow cooker. Cook on low for approximately 10 hours. During the last hour or so add potatoes and cabbage. Serve with apple cider vinegar and warm applesauce.

Boil the potatoes until they are soft. Peel them and mash them. Add the egg and mix well. Add the flour and the rest of the ingredients. Put the mixture in the fridge to cool down. Take small pieces and flatten them. Heat the oil in a pan and fry the fritters until they turn golden. Remove them and drain them in paper towels. Serve warm.

Unroll crescent rolls. Separate into 8 triangles. Spread 1/2 cup cream cheese mixture onto each triangle. Roll up each loosely, starting at shortest side of triangle, rolling to opposite point. Place rolls on ungreased baking sheet. Curve each into crescent shape. Spoon 1/2 cup tomatoes over each crescent. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup green bell peppers. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup chopped bacon. Bake 12 to 14 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm.

Preheat the oven to 180c/350F/Gas 4. Line a 20cm/8in square baking tin with greaseproof paper. Melt the butter with the caster sugar for the pudding base in a pan over a low heat. Cool to room temperature and set aside. Whisk the eggs together and beat in the flour. Beat in the ginger and orange extracts. Pour the mixture into the baking tin and sprinkle over the dried and fresh cranberries. Bake for 30-35 minutes until golden and set. Cool and chill before serving. For the glacé icing, beat the icing sugar with the egg whites until they thicken and start to hold shape. Fold in the fresh cranberries and drizzle over the pudding. Serve chilled.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9x13 inch pan with cooking spray. Dice tomatoes. Place in a small saucepan with green and red peppers. Cook over low heat until tender. Drain vegetables. Place in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine the onion, chili powder, cumin and salt. Add to vegetables. Mix well. Stir in the tomatoes. Place the chicken breast in the pan. Pour the vegetable mixture over the chicken. Cover and cook for 30 minutes. Serve in warm tortillas.

Wash the beans thoroughly and then put them in a large bowl of cold water. Swish them around in the water and let them sit for 20 minutes. This will remove any debris from the beans and give them an even soak. Drain the water from the bowl and add the beans to the same bowl. Pour enough cold water into the bowl so that it covers the beans by 4 inches. Add the oil and the garlic cloves to the bowl. The bowl should be covered by at least 2 inches of water. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and put it in the refrigerator overnight. Remove the garlic cloves from the bowl in the morning and rinse the beans thoroughly with cold water. Add the thyme and the bay leaves to the bowl. Then add enough cold water to cover the beans by 4 inches. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook until the liquid reduces by half and the beans are tender (about 1 hour). Remove the bay leaves and thyme from the beans. Drain the beans and return them to the empty bowl. Put the

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Butter a standard muffin tin or a regular-size round baking tin and set aside. In a saucepan, heat dried apricots and orange zest with orange juice over medium-high heat. Once the apricots have broken down into a syrupy paste, remove from heat and set aside to cool. Place dried cranberries and dark chocolate into a heatproof bowl. Set bowl over a pan of barely simmering water and melt the dark chocolate. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Once the mixture is cool enough to handle, roll it into small balls. Place one ball of dough into each mould, then add one piece of apricot-cranberry mixture and another ball of dough. Top with a piece of dark chocolate. Place tins into preheated oven and bake for about 12 minutes or until the dark chocolate has set. Cool on a wire rack and refrigerate until needed.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chicken. Cook for 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Add the peanut butter, coriander and pepper flakes and cook for 1 minute. Add the tomato sauce. Cook for 1 minute. Serve over rice.

Preheat the oven to 170 c . Place the leeks, parsley, butter and floury potatoes into a medium saucepan and gently heat for 5-10 minutes until the butter has melted but the leeks are still crisp. Add the stock and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes, or until the leeks are tender. Using a hand-held blender or food processor, puree the soup until smooth. Return it to the pan and season to taste. Meanwhile, place the double cream into a medium saucepan over a low heat and heat until it is just simmering. Take care not to bring it to the boil as the cream will split. Pour the hot cream into the soup pan with the soup, whisking to incorporate the cream into the soup. Add the seasoning and stir in the parsley. Transfer the soup to a clean soup jug and refrigerate for 2 hours to allow the flavors to develop. Serve cold with some freshly chopped chives sprinkled over the top for decoration.

Heat oil in frying pan over medium heat and add ground beef. Cook until no longer pink and drain. Add bell pepper and jalapeno to beef and cook for 3 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and tomato paste and cook for another 3 minutes. Stir in broth and bring to boil. Reduce heat and cook for 30 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in rice and onion soup and simmer for 3 minutes.

In a large bowl, dissolve gelatin in cold water. Add boiling water and stir until completely dissolved. In a blender, combine remaining ingredients until smooth. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate and freeze until firm (at least 4 hours).

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add chili powder and stir for about a minute. Add onion powder, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt and lemon pepper. Continue stirring until all seasonings are combined well with the butter. Remove from heat. Remove husk from corn. Brush butter mixture on corn. Sprinkle with remaining seasoning. Place on a cookie sheet in oven. Bake for about an hour stirring every half hour or so to prevent burning.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit (175 degrees celsius). Grease cookie sheet. Beat the peanut butter well with an electric mixer or hand mixer until creamy (about 2 minutes). Add splenda and beat until smooth (about one minute). Add vanilla and continue beating (another minute). Add the egg and beat well (another minute). Sift the flour into the batter and mix gently (do not over mix). Drop by teaspoon onto the cookie sheet and bake for 8 to 10 minutes at 350 degrees fahrenheit (175 degrees celsius). Let the peanut butter cookies cool for a few minutes before removing them from the cookie sheet. Store the peanut butter cookies in an airtight container or plastic bag for up to one week.

Mix sugar, cornstarch, apple juice, vinegar and orange zest in large saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Boil gently 1 minute. Stir in pineapple. Add pineapple juice as needed to prevent sticking. Cook stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from heat. Combine kielbasa, onion and green bell pepper in large bowl. Pour sugar mixture over vegetables. Add pineapple. Toss to coat. Thread vegetables onto skewers. Grill, covered, over medium heat for about 10 minutes turning occasionally.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a medium bowl combine the pudding mix and milk. Mix until smooth. Fold in vanilla protein powder. Spoon into the unbaked pie shell. In a medium bowl, combine the banana with the cool whip. Spoon evenly into the prepared pie shell. Refrigerate for 2 hours.

Peel and slice the potatoes and add them to a pot of salted water. Bring to a boil and cook until tender. Drain the potatoes and put them on a plate. Put the butter and the cream in a pan over medium heat. Add the parsley and the garlic. When it comes to a boil and starts to foam a little bit, remove from the heat and whisk in the salt and the pepper. Place the butter over the potatoes and serve.

Remove caps from fresh mushrooms. Heat butter in a skillet. Fry mushrooms until tender. Add garlic. Cook 2 minutes. Add dry white wine. Cook until wine is nearly evaporated. Add soy sauce. Add monterey jack cheese. Cook 30 seconds or until cheese is slightly browned. Sprinkle cracker crumbs over tops. Bake in a preheated 400f oven 10 to 12 minutes until cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings.

Place a large skillet over medium heat. Add the bacon to the skillet, cook until crisp then drain on paper towels. Once bacon has drained, crumble bacon into a small bowl. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and the mayonnaise. Spread each tortilla with a small amount of mayonnaise mixture then add the bacon, lettuce and cheddar cheese. Fold tortilla in half then wrap up tightly in plastic wrap. Refrigerate overnight or for at least 8 hours before serving. Place each wrapped wrap in an individual sandwich bag and place in the refrigerator until ready to serve.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Saute garlic and bell peppers for 1 minute. Add onions and cook until translucent. Add squash and cook until just softened. Add all the beans. Add water, season with salt and pepper and hot sauce. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook covered until beans are tender and squash is tender. If you want the rice to cook all the way through, add it to the bean and squash mixture and cook for another 10 minutes.

Puree roasted garlic and 1/2 cup broth in a blender or food processor. Whisk the remaining 1 1/2 cups broth into the garlic puree. Add the cornstarch and whisk well to blend. Cook and stir over medium heat until the sauce thickens slightly. Add the vinegar. Stir in the mustard. Add the remaining garlic. Bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Season with the salt and pepper. Store in airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. Yields 1 1/2 cups. Serves 6.

Season both sides of the chicken liberally with salt and pepper. Heat the butter in a deep saucepan, add the chicken and sear on both sides until golden brown, about 2 minutes on each side. Remove the chicken and add the sherry wine and lemon rind and simmer 15 minutes. Add the lemon juice and simmer 10 minutes more. Place the chicken back in the sauce and simmer 5 more minutes or until the sauce is reduced and the chicken is tender. Add the heavy cream and simmer 5 more minutes. Sprinkle parmesan cheese over the top and serve.

Puree raspberries until smooth. Transfer to a large pitcher. Add the boiling water and sugar. Stir until sugar is dissolved and then add the lemons to the pitcher. Cover and let stand for 2-3 hours before straining through cheesecloth into glass jars. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.
Drain water from the can of white beans. Add molasses. Combine white beans and molasses. Place in a slow cooker. Add remaining ingredients. Stir. Cook on high for 2 hours. Serve over rice.

Place 1 cup of walnuts in a large resealable plastic bag. In a microwave-safe bowl or glass measuring cup, melt the brown sugar and the butter. Add the melted brown sugar and butter to the bag with the walnuts and shake well. Add the semisweet chocolate chips and shake until coated. Spread on wax paper to cool. Store in airtight container.

In a heavy sauce pan over medium heat warm oil. Add onion and celery and cook about 5 minutes. Stirring often. Add garlic and cook for 2 minutes. Add crushed tomato with their juices. Add chicken stock. Stir to combine. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes. Add smoked paprika, cayenne, rosemary, marjoram, sour cream, and pepper. Continue to simmer for 10 minutes. Serve hot.

In a skillet, melt sweet butter and add ham. Cook until ham is cooked through and brown. Remove from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet add heavy cream. Bring to boil. Add tortellini and cook until tender. Stir in ham and peas. Serve immediately with grated Parmesan.

Unroll pastry on a lightly floured surface and cut into four pieces. Roll out each piece and place into four 8-oz glass jars, each with a lid. Layer with apples, brown sugar and salt. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Heat caramel sauce until hot. Pour over tartlets and serve with whipped cream and ice cream.

Spread 1/2 cup of mayonnaise onto 1 side of each slice of white bread. Stack 1 lettuce leaf, 1 tomato slice and 1 strip of bacon on 1 slice of bread. Place 1 cooked slice of chicken breast on top. Stack 1 more lettuce leaf, 1 tomato slice and 1 strip of bacon. Place the other slice of chicken breast on top. Place the other slice of bread on top. Spread with remaining 1/2 cup of mayonnaise.

Grease two 9-inch round pans with cooking spray. In large bowl of electric mixer, cream white sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Gradually beat in eggnog and rum extract. Add dry ingredientsbeat until blended and smooth. Spread batter evenly in prepared pans. Bake at 375 degrees for 40-45 minutes or until wooden pick inserted in center of bread comes out clean. Cool in pans on cooling racks for about 10 minutes, remove from pans and cool completely on racks before serving. Serve with warm rum sauce if desired. Makes two loaves.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place salmon on a shallow baking dish. Mix green curry paste, coconut milk, brown sugar and fish sauce in small bowl. Spoon over salmon. Bake 10 to 15 minutes. To serve, drizzle with fresh lime juice. Serve with jasmine rice.

Butter the miniature rye rounds on both sides. Slice the rye rounds in half lengthwise. Cut 1 slice of the bread into 12 even pieces. Lay the 12 pieces of bread on a work surface. Divide the sliced smoked salmon evenly among the bread pieces. Season the sliced egg evenly with salt and pepper. Divide the sliced egg evenly among the bread pieces. Top each sandwich with the other slice of bread. Butter the tops of the rounds. Place the sandwiches on a cookie sheet. Place the rounds, buttered sides down on the cookie sheet. Broil the sandwiches until the egg is just cooked through. Remove the sandwiches from the broiler. Divide the dill sprigs evenly among the sandwiches. Serve the sandwiches immediately.

In a large bowl, combine graham cracker crumbs and sugarstir in melted butter until blended. Press firmly into an ungreased 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Set aside to cool completely. In a large bowl, beat sweetened condensed milk until smooth. Add jam & coconutmix well. Spread over crust. Sprinkle with cashews & white chocolate chips. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour to set up enough to cut cleanly. Cut into barsserve cold.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cream margarine and milk in large bowl. Beat in sugar and brown sugar. Add graham crackers and blend well. Fold in chocolate chips and crunchy peanut butter. Spread batter evenly in greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake 20 minutes. Remove from ovencool. Cut into bars.

Cut the carrots into small cubes. Peel and dice the red potatoes. Slice and quarter the pearl onions. Add the carrots and pearl onions to a slow cooker. Pour in 3 cups of water. Sprinkle in the soup mix. Cover and cook for 8 hours. After cooking, add the meat and cook for an additional 2 hours. Remove meat and slice against the grain. Add to a serving platter. Pour the remaining liquid into a saucepan. Add salt to taste. Bring to a boil. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in the butter. Serve. Serves 8.

Prepare dressing by whisking together all of the dressing ingredients. Add enough vinaigrette to coat 1 lb. of romaine lettuce. Cut cantaloupe in half, remove seeds. Slice into 1/4" strips. Chop into bite sized pieces. Toss cantaloupe with romaine lettuce. Add vinaigrette to taste. Add chopped pistachios. Toss gently to coat.

Peel and cube the potatoes. Boil in salted water until tender. Drain. Add to a large mixing bowl. Mash. Add next 7 ingredients. Beat until smooth. Pour into a greased 13 x 9 baking dish. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 40 minutes. Top with grated parmesan cheese. Broil 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat a griddle or frying pan over medium heat. In a small bowl, combine the skim milk with the whole wheat flour and the raw sugar. Mix well. In a large bowl, beat the eggs whites with an electric mixer until stiff. Gradually beat in the skim milk mixture. In another bowl, combine the rolled oats with the ground cinnamon. Gradually beat in the baking powder and salt. In a third bowl, beat the oil with the vanilla extract. Add the oil mixture to the batter mixture and stir. Pour a small amount of the oil mixture into the hot frying pan. Using a ladle, pour the batter on top and spread it into a thin round. Cook the pancake until golden on both sides. Serve with maple syrup. Repeat with the remaining batter.

In a large skillet, cook the chicken in the oil over moderate heat for 8 to 10 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Pour the dressing over the chicken and simmer for 3 minutes. Turn off the heat and let the chicken sit for 2 minutes. Preheat the grill. Place the chicken on the grill and grill for 4 to 5 minutes per side or until done. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the bacon and cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Add the eggs to the skillet and scramble. In a large bowl, combine the bread crumbs and the parsley. Remove the chicken from the grill and cut it into thin strips. Put 1 slice of american cheese on each roll and top with a piece of the chicken.

Preheat oven to 400 f degrees. Bake the potatoes until fork tender. While potatoes are cooking, heat a large skillet over medium heat and add cooked bacon. Remove bacon from pan. Add one tablespoon of butter to pan. Add sliced potatoes to pan, cut side down. Cook until the top of the potatoes begins to brown. Remove the pan from the heat and turn the potatoes over. Place the slices of bacon on top of the potatoes and sprinkle with the sour cream and chives. Add a bit of extra chives if desired. Put the pan back in the oven and broil until the sour cream is hot.

Boil 1 1/4 cups of water and 2 cups of sugar together until sugar dissolves. Add pomegranates and grenadine and bring to a boil. Simmer for 15 minutes until tapioca is translucent. Allow to cool and then stir in whipped cream. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
Brown beef with olive oil. Add bell peppers, carrots and onion. Add seasoning. Cook until soft. Add hoisin sauce. Cook until thick. Add water. Cover. Cook until tender.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a 9x13 pan with aluminum foil. Spray with cooking spray. Place 1 cup corn flakes on a plate and mix with remaining 2 cups corn flakes. Dip each breast into melted butter. Dip into honey mixture and coat. Roll in corn flakes. Arrange in prepared pan. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until done. Serve with your favorite dippers.

Wash the potatoes. Cut them up into bite sized pieces. Brush with butter and sprinkle with salt, pepper and the chopped onion. Roast in the oven for about an hour until the onion is soft and the potato is tender and golden brown. Sprinkle with the cheddar cheese. Serve hot.

Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until soft and just starting to color, about 3 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until it turns lightly golden and fragrant, about 1 minute more. Stir in the chili powder, allspice and cinnamon and cook 1 minute more. Add the lime juice and the sugar and cook until the liquid is slightly reduced and the mixture is fragrant, 1-2 minutes more. Season to taste with salt and pepper and remove from the heat. Keep warm until ready to use.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix egg and crisco in large bowl with electric mixer. Add molasses and sugar. Blend well. Add remaining dry ingredients. Blend. Roll into balls. Drop on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 12 minutes.

Add 6 oz. of bacon and 1/2 cup of sliced onions to a large pot of water. Bring to boil. Add the clams. Cook until the clams open and discard any that don't. Strain the liquor and return to the pot. Add 1/4 cup of beer. Cook until reduced. Add more beer to taste.
Sautee shrimp in hot pepper sauce and garlic over medium heat. Add cream cheese and cheeses. Blend well. Add remaining ingredients and blend well. Serve with crackers.

In a small bowl, pour in the water and sugar free black cherry jelly powder and mix with a fork until dissolved. Pour into a shot glass and then top off with cherry vodka. Pour a small amount of red bull into the shot glass and give it a good shake. Serve with a strawberry on top!

For crepe batter, heat crepe pan over medium heat. Add crepe batter and swirl until batter is smooth. When pan is hot add a small amount of batter to cover bottom of pan (approximately one tablespoon). Cook until batter is browned on bottom, about 2 minutes. Flip crepe over and cook for 1 minute. Remove from pan and place on a plate or baking sheet. Repeat with remaining batter. Meanwhile, thaw the frozen spinach in a strainer under cool water for 15 minutes or until thawed. Drain the spinach completely and squeeze out any excess water. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter and add the thawed spinach. Cook until the spinach wilts, about 2 minutes. Add in the garlic and onion. Cook until the onions are softened, about 2 minutes. Add in the Parmesan cheese and season with salt and pepper. Remove pan from heat and transfer the mixture to a medium bowl. Set aside. Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta well and set aside. Place a large spoonful of the spinach mixture

Cream together the first three ingredients until smooth. Stir in the cake mix and beat until well combined. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto greased cookie sheets. Bake 9-11 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes on cookie sheets before transferring to wire racks to cool completely. For the frosting:Mix together the confectioner's sugar and the butter until smooth. If the frosting is too thick add a little milk or water to thin it out.

Melt butter in large saucepan. Add onion, garlic and parsley. Saute until tender. Add pimiento and stir in chicken broth. Simmer until liquid reduces by one-third. Stir in olive oil. Add potatoes. Cook until tender. Season with salt and pepper.

Spread some butter on one slice of white bread and layer bacon and cheddar cheese on it. Next layer on another slice of bread and add another piece of bacon and cheese on top of that. Spread mayonnaise on top and cut into pieces to serve. Eggs may be cooked separately or used from a cartonthis is a great way to use up leftover bread and bacon.

In a small saucepan, bring graham cracker crumbs and water to a boil for 1 minutecool. In a large bowl, combine 1/3 cup graham cracker crumbs with the pudding mix. Beat pudding mixture 2 minutes with an electric mixer. Stir in milkpour into a 2-quart serving dish or individual glasses. Refrigerate until serving time. Meanwhile, in a small bowl, beat whipping topping until firm. Spread over pudding mixture and refrigerate until serving time. Just before serving, in a small bowl, beat the remaining pudding mix until thickenedspread over whipped topping and refrigerate until serving time. In a small bowl, beat the remaining graham cracker crumbs with the remaining 2 teaspoons cocoa until crumbly. On a serving plate or in individual dessert dishes, top with pudding mixturesprinkle with chocolate curlsserve with whipped topping.

Beat egg and milk in a small bowl. Dip slices of bread into egg and milk mixture. Arrange in a single layer in an ovenproof dish. Drizzle with melted butter. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for about 20 minutes or until golden.
Combine all ingredients. Thread on bamboo or wooden skewers. Broil or grill about 10 to 15 minutes turning occasionally. Serve over rice or noodles. Makes 6 to 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 325f. Spray a baking dish with nonstick spray and lay the pork in it. Sprinkle with the seasonings and drizzle with the oil. Bake for 15 minutes per inch of thickness. If you want them tender on the inside and crispy on the outside, bake for 30 minutes per inch of thickness.

Mix the olive oil and the yellow onions in a small bowl. Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steak seasoning. Sprinkle the steaks with the steak seasoning. Cook the steaks in the skillet until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer the steaks to a platter and keep warm. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the olive oil to the skillet and stir in the chopped red onions. Cook until tender, stirring frequently. Season with the salt and black pepper. Cut the steaks into thin slices and place 1 slice each on each of the roll bottom halves. Spread each with a thin layer of the olive oil-onions mixture. Place the remaining roll tops on the steak and sandwiches and serve.

Cook the rice as directed by the instructions on the box. Meanwhile heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the red bell pepper and the garlic. Saute until the pepper is tender-crisp. Add the mushrooms. Saute until the mushrooms are tender. Add the rice and the cajun seasoning. Cover. Cook for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with the pecans. Serve.

Bring a large pot of well salted water to a boil and cook the tagliatelle until tender but not mushy. Drain well. Meanwhile heat the olive oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Add garlic clove and courgettes and cook for 5 minutes without browning. Add lemon juice and cook for 5 minutes more or until courgettes are tender. Add basil and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in pasta. Toss until heated through. Transfer to a serving dish and sprinkle with grated Parmesan cheese before serving.

Heat up the vegetable oil in the frying pan. Fill up the pancake mix, sugar, egg, cinnamon and pour into the frying pan. Let the frying pan be hot for 2 minutes then put the mixture into the frying pan. Fry the mixture for about 4-5 minutes or until the mixture is golden brown on both sides. Let the mixture cool for about 1 minute then remove from the frying pan using a wire rack then let it cool completely on the wire rack.

Preheat the oven to 400° F. Place the potatoes in a large saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium and cook 12 to 15 minutes or until tender. Drain well. Meanwhile, thinly slice the onions. Peel the eggs and cut into halves. Remove the hard centers of the eggs with a sharp knife. Stir together the sour cream, mustard, ½ cup of the juice, the olive oil, the parsley and the lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Place the eggs in the saucepan with the potatoes. Toss gently to coat. Divide the mixture among the 4 plates. Top each serving with 2 spoonfuls of the sour cream mixture. Garnish with the parsley leaves.

Take 2 slices of bread and spread each with butter and mayo. Place one slice of swiss and one slice of cheddar cheese onto each of the mayonnaise and butter slices of bread. Take the second slice of bread and put it down butter side up. Place the cheeses onto the bread with the butter side up and the mayonnaise side down.

Put caramels in a small bowl. Set aside. In another small bowl combine sweetened condensed milk with vanilla extract. Microwave on high for 30 seconds. Set aside. In another small bowl combine butter with marshmallows. Microwave on high for 30 seconds. Set aside. In another small bowl combine sea salt with flaked rice cereal. Set aside. Dip caramels into sweetened condensed milk. Coat lightly. Dip into melted butter mixture. Coat lightly. Roll candy in flaked rice cereal. Chill for 30 minutes. Remove from refrigerator. Dip into melted butter mixture. Roll again into rice cereal. Chill for another 30 minutes. Remove from refrigerator. Dip into melted butter mixture. Roll again into rice cereal. Chill for another 30 minutes. Remove from refrigerator. Dip into melted butter mixture. Roll again into rice cereal. Chill for another 30 minutes. Remove from refrigerator. Dip into

Mix tomato sauce with seasonings in a large skillet. Set aside. Beat eggs in a bowl. In a separate bowl mix corn flake crumbs with parmesan. Dip chicken in egg mixture. Roll in corn flake crumb mixture. Place in tomato sauce mixture. Cook 4 minutes on each side. Remove to a baking sheet. Top each piece with a slice of mozzarella. Bake until mozzarella is melted. Yield 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cook pizza sauce according to package directions. Drain sauce. In large skillet, brown round in oil over medium-high heat until no longer pink. Remove from pandrain. Add sauce to pan. Stir in round. Cook over medium-high heat until bubbly. Meanwhile, cook pasta in large pot of boiling water according to package directions. Drain well. Stir in pasta. Toss with sauce mixture. Sprinkle with cheese. Spray 11x7 inch baking dish with cooking sprayset aside. Spray a large piece of plastic wrap with cooking sprayset aside. Pour pizza mixture into baking dish. Cover with plastic wrapseal tightly with fingers. Microwave uncovered 10 minutes. Let stand 5 minutes. Unwrapsprinkle with pepper. Cut into 6 rectangles.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and cayenne and cook for 2 minutes. Whisk in the cream cheese and milk. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan and season with salt and pepper.

Preheat the oven to 425F and spray a standard muffin pan with nonstick cooking spray or lightly grease the pan with butter or oil. In a large bowl, mix the flour and the salt and set aside. In a medium bowl, whisk together the brown and granulated sugars until combined and creamy looking. Whisk in the melted butter and the vanilla extract until thoroughly blended. In a large bowl whisk the egg whites and the egg yolks until thoroughly combined and creamy looking. Add the dry mixture, the brown sugar mixture and the buttermilk mixture alternately. Stir in the blueberries and fold in the bananas. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin pan, filling each cup three-quarters full. Bake for about 18 minutes or until a tester inserted into the center comes out clean (the edges should be lightly browned). Let cool in the pan for about 10 minutes before removing from the pan and serving warm with a pat of butter on top.

Boil the potatoes until tender. Drain and cool. Peel and dice. Put the vegetable oil, vinegar and dill into a mixing bowl and stir well. Add the potatoes to the bowl. Peel and dice the bell pepper and cucumber. Add the bell pepper and cucumber to the bowl. Mix well. Sprinkle with the feta cheese and a little more salt and pepper. Serve chilled.

Season the top of the pork with the olive oil, herbs and garlic. Rub the seasoning mixture onto the top of the pork. Sprinkle the top of the pork with the salt. Place the pork in a shallow pan and cover with plastic wrap. Let the seasoned pork rest at room temperature for 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 275 degrees f. Roast the pork for 35 to 45 minutes or until a meat thermometer inserted in the thickest part of the meat reads 145 degrees f. Transfer the pork to a carving board. Cover the top of the meat with foil and allow it to rest for 15 minutes. Slice the pork crosswise into 8 servings. Serve with your favorite side dish. Enjoy!

Slice leek and saute with olive oil until wilted. Add squash and stir to coat with leeks and olive oil. Add herbes de provence and salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir in beans and tomatoes and cook another 15 minutes stirring occasionally until squash is softened and beans and tomatoes have been heated through and flavors are well blended. Stir in cheese and cook 5 minutes more until cheese has melted. Serve over cooked rice or noodles.

Heat oven to 180c/gas 4. Cream the butter and caster sugar until soft and light. Beat in the vanilla. Sift the custard powder into the mixture and then beat in the flour. Mix in the chocolate chips. Roll the dough into balls and place on a lightly greased baking tray. Flatten slightly with your thumb. Bake in the pre-heated oven for about 10 minutes or until they are lightly golden. Leave to cool on the tray before transferring to a wire rack.

Make pie crusts according to directions on package and bake until golden brown. In a bowl beat egg yolks until frothygradually beat in brown sugar and flour. Beat in milk and melted butter until smooth and thickened. Pour into baked crusts. Bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes or until firm and brown on top. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, mix the strawberries, sugar, vinegar, oil and seasonings. Set aside. In a separate bowl, toss together the spinach, onion and poppy seeds. Toss the strawberry mixture with the spinach mixture to combine. To serve, divide among four plates. Top each serving with a few crumbled pieces of feta cheese. Garnish with candied pecan halves. Serve immediately.

Cut your hot dog bun in half. Spread cheese on one half. Sprinkle with parmesan. Cut into strips and place on ungreased cookie sheet. Brush with melted butter and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Bake at 400 for 7 to 10 minutes or until golden.
Cover roast with barbecue sauce. Place roast in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on low for 8-12 hours. Pull meat from bone and shred. Serve with barbecue sauce.

Cream together the sugar and butter until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and beat until well mixed and scrambled looking. Add the cake flour and mix well until well mixed in. Add the vanilla and mix well again until smooth and creamy. Add the batter to a greased pan and bake at 350 for about 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Beat sugar in a large bowl until dissolved. Add cornstarch and beat again until smooth. Slowly add water and beat until smooth. Stir in butter until melted. Stir in lemon juice and rind until well blended. Set aside until ready to use. Combine the remaining ingredients in a food processor fitted with a steel blade. Process until crumbly. Add strawberries, juice and rind to the lemon mixture and stir gently until strawberries are coated. Pour into a fondue pot. Heat until warm but not hot (about 110°). Serve with the shortbread cookies or crackers.

Cook the rice according to the package directions. Drain well and refrigerate until completely cooled. Add carrots and onions, mixing well. Mix oil and vinegar and then add salt. Pour dressing over rice, mixing thoroughly. Add fruit and nuts. Add honey and mix well.

Peel the turnips and cut them into quarters. Place turnips in large pot of water and bring to the boil. Cook until tender, about 15 minutes. Drain turnips, discarding any water left in the pan. Peel the onion and roughly chop the onion. Heat the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the turnips to the skillet, season with salt and pepper to taste, and cook until tender, about 30 minutes. Add the milk to the skillet and bring to the boil, cook for 10 minutes. Add the cooked onion to the turnips and cook for 5 minutes more or until the turnips are completely tender. Mix together 1 cup of the milk mixture (not the whole mixture) with the breadcrumbs. Transfer the breadcrumb mixture to the remaining milk mixture and mix well until smooth. Add the remaining milk mixture to the skillet containing the turnips and onion and cook until heated through and the turnip mixture is thickened. Serve hot with french baguette bread.

Cream together cheddar cheese, cream cheese and pumpkin preserves. Chill until firm. Divide chilled mixture into thirds. Roll each into a log shape. Dip into powdered sugar. Shape each log into a ball. Roll each ball in nuts. Refrigerate for one hour. Shape each ball into a pumpkin shape by using a melon baller. Place balls on a cookie sheet. Press pretzel sticks in the top of each. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20-25 minutes. Serve with crackers.

Cut off the leafy green tops of the fennel bulbs. Remove the stalks from the bulbs and then slice thinly using the mandolin attachment of a food processor. Place the sliced fennel, garlic clove, thyme sprigs, and some salt and freshly ground black pepper in a large bowl with the wine, chicken stock, and 1/2 cup of water. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap.
