Let the fennel sit at room temperature for 20 to 30 minutes, then transfer to a saut pan, add the remaining 1/2 cup of water and 1/4 cup of the stock, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Cook the fennel for 10 to 15 minutes or until it is tender. Transfer to bowls to serve with the remaining stock poured over.

Boil the potatoes in their skins until tender. Cool. Peel the potatoes and cut into small cubes. Cook the eggs in boiling water for 12 minutes. Cool under cold running water. Slice the eggs in halves lengthwise and scoop out the yolks. Mash the yolks with the onion and the gherkins. Add the egg whites and the dressing and combine. Mix in the mashed yolks and the potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place a large non stick skillet over medium heat. Break an egg into a small bowl. Add milk to egg. Beat lightly. Add seasoning to taste. Pour egg mixture into skillet. Cook until the edges start to set. Fold in half. Sprinkle a little more seasoning over top. Transfer to a greased baking pan. Place in oven. Bake until puffed up and lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, mix together all the marinade ingredients. Add the pork chops and toss to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 8 hours or overnight. Drain the meat and discard the marinade. In a large skillet or wok, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook until browned, about 5 minutes per side. Transfer the chicken to a baking dish. Mix together the cornstarch and water and pour into the skillet. Bring to a boil and cook until the cornstarch thickens to a syrupy consistency, about 2 minutes. Pour over the cooked meat. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Toss sliced parsnips with olive oil and salt in a large bowl. Spread onto a large piece of tin foil or plastic wrap. Top with herbs to taste. Roll up foil/plastic wrap tightly around vegetables and bake for 45 minutes at 400f. Serve with butter and parmesan cheese.

In large bowl beat cottage cheese with beaters at low speed until it is smoothgradually add powdered milk and lemon juicegradually add beaten eggs and continue beating until smooth. Add honey and almond essencebeat just until blended. Spoon mixture evenly over layered graham cracker crumbs in pan coated with vegetable cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until cake tester comes out clean. Cool completely before removing from pan.

Ricotta cheese - In a large bowl beat together ricotta cheese, chocolate chips, maraschino cherry and pecans. In another bowl beat together the sugar and cream until soft peaks form. Fold half of the chocolate mixture into the cream mixture. Pour the mixture into a 1 1/2 quart baking dish. Place the remaining chocolate mixture in individual serving dishes. Cover individual servings with plastic wrap. Store in refrigerator until serving time. Cannoli Pudding - Pour the chilled chocolate mixture into the baking dish. Refrigerate until chilled. Spoon the chilled mixture into individual serving dishes. Spoon a dollop of the chilled mixture into individual serving dishes. Spoon a dollop of the chilled mixture into individual serving dishes. Spoon the cannoli mixture onto the chilled chocolate mixture. Cover individual servings with plastic wrap. Store in refrigerator until serving time.

Combine all ingredients except water and cranberries into a large heavy-bottom pot. Bring to boil over high heat. Cook over high heat until mixture reaches the consistency of syrup. Add water and simmer over low heat until berries burst - about 15-20 minutes. Discard cinnamon stick and serve warm or cold over ice cream or as a topping on pound cake or angel food cake.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease muffin cups or line with paper cups. Sift together dry ingredients. In a separate bowl beat together the margarine and jam. Add the dry mixture and stir well. Add the egg and beat well. Fold in the buttermilk. Fill the prepared cups about two-thirds full. Bake for 25 minutes.
Combine cereal, nuts, chips and sugar in large bowlmix well. Pour onto a well-greased baking sheetpress into a 12 x 17-inch rectangle. Cool completely on waxed paper. Cut into 1 1/2-inch squares.

Place the chicken in a large crockpot. Pour the dressing over the chicken. Add the swiss cheese and the sauerkraut and stir to mix well. Cover and cook on low for 2-4 hours or until chicken is cooked through. Serve sandwiches with the sauce as a dip.

Heat oil in large stock pot over medium heat. Add onioncook for 5 minutes. Add garlic powder, cayenne pepper and thyme. Stir in broth, black-eyed peas and navy beans. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover and simmer 15 minutes. Add rice. Cook 15 minutes longer. Stir in kielbasacook 5 minutes longer. Serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Heat milk and pumpkin in double boiler or microwave. In a large bowl combine egg yolks and the sugar. Beat well and add milk mixture. Add the pumpkin and blend. Stir in the salt and spices. Beat in egg whites until stiff peaks form. Spoon mixture into pastry lined 9 inch pie plate. Sprinkle with nutmeg. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for 10 minutes. Reduce oven to 350 and continue baking for about another 50 minutes or until set.

Put a little butter in a skillet. Add the red onions. Cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add the zucchini. Cook for 5 more minutes. Add the tomato sauce. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the rotini pasta. Cook for 8 minutes. Sprinkle with the dried basil leaves. Add the lemon juice and salt. Cook for 1 more minute. Sprinkle with the grated Parmesan cheese.

Cook macaroni in boiling salted water until tender. Drain. In a 2-quart casserole, cook the onion in hot butter until tender. Mix the drained macaroni with the onions. Mix in the tomatoes. Add enough cold water to moisten. Sprinkle with bread crumbs. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Serve hot.
Sift dry ingredients. In large bowl beat eggs, milk, oil, salt and water. Pour onto dry ingredient mixture and beat until well blended.

In a medium-size bowl, mix eggs, low-fat cream cheese and milk. Add seasonings to taste. In a large nonstick frying pan, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Pour egg mixture into hot pan and cook until set. Remove to serving platter. Top with chopped chives. Serve immediately.

Pre-heat oven to 400F. Peel and core apples and place in a greased 2-quart shallow baking dish. In a small bowl combine butter and brown sugar. Cut in flour and stir well until mixture is crumbly. Sprinkle over the top of the apples in the baking dish. In a medium bowl combine the milk, vanilla and spicesstir well and pour over the topping mixture in the dish. Bake for 40 minutes or until apples are tender and topping is golden brown. Serve warm with whipped cream or ice cream.

Combine lemon juice, water and granulated sugar in small saucepan over medium-high heatbring to boil. Reduce heat to mediumcook mixture until reduced to about one-fourth cup. Remove from heatstir in cornstarch until dissolved. Stir in soymilk and margarinereturn to heatcook until thickened but not boiling. Remove from heatstir in saltcool to lukewarm. Transfer to container with lidrefrigerate until firm.

In a blender or food processor add pineapple, mango, lime juice and enough of the chopped red onion and red bell pepper to reach desired consistency. Blend. Place sea scallops in a shallow glass dish and season with 1/4 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Toss to coat. Place scallops in a hot non-stick skillet. Cook scallops for about 2 minutes each side or until lightly browned. Remove from skillet and set aside. In a bowl mix together chopped pineapple and mango. Add in pineapple juice and more chopped red onions and red peppers to reach desired consistency. Serve with scallops and top with a sprinkle of chopped cilantro.

In a large saucepan melt butter over low heat and stir in chocolate chips. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. In another mixing bowl, beat eggs slightly then add sugar and whisk until blended together. Stir together butter mixture with egg mixture and fold in flour. Spoon batter into prepared pans or pan. Bake at 375 for 25 to 30 minutes. Do not overbake or brownies will be hard. Brownies will have a moist, fudge-like texture when done.

Season both sides of the steaks with the salt and paprika. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the steaks to the pan and cook for about 3-4 minutes on each side, or until browned to your liking. Remove to a serving platter and sprinkle with the sage and garlic. Serve immediately with a baked potato or rice pilaf.

In a saucepan, bring 4 cups water to boiling. Stir in onion and celery and simmer for 5 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare eggs in small bowl by beating eggs with 1/4 tsp. salt and 2 tsp. water until blended. Stir in 1/4 cup of hot broth from pan into eggs. Return eggs to pan and stir in green bell pepper. Cook until tender. Stir in ramen noodlescook 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in remaining hot brothbring to boiling. Boil 1 minutedrain in colander. Stir in soy saucemix well. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350f and prepare a greased baking sheet. In a small saucepan over medium heat, heat water until boilingadd the corn muffin mix and stir until thickened and bubbly (about 1 minute). Remove from heat and stir in the diced green chiles and cheeses. Set aside and keep warm. In a medium skillet over medium heat, fry the bacon until crispremove and drain on paper towels. Cut the bacon into strips and set aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute the diced green pepper and red onion in the oil until tender (about 5 minutes). Remove from heat and drain and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the bacon and the remaining ingredientsstir until well mixed and set aside (the mixture will be stiff). In a large skillet over medium heat, heat the oil until hotadd the bacon and saute until crisp (about 3 minutes). Remove from heatdrain and set aside. In a large bowl combine the eggs and the enchilada sauceadd the ba

Cut off the top of each head of garlic about 1/4 inch of head from top of each clove. Place each head of garlic cut side down into a small pot of water to cover. Bring water to boiling point over medium-high heat, cook for 3-4 minutes or until cloves are just barely tender when pierced. Drain each head of garlic upside-down over a large plate to catch drippings. When garlic is cool enough to handle, peel away each clove from it's paper skin. In a food processor or blender puree each clove of garlic with 1/4 cup of oil. Repeat for each clove of garlic. Place each head of garlic into a small jar or glass jar and fill to top of head with oil mixture. Cover with lid or plastic wrap and refrigerate for 3 days or up to 2 weeks to allow flavors to blend. This will keep up to 6 months in your refrigerator. Use oil poached garlic on everything from mashed potatoes to soups to chicken to fish to roast pork to roast vegetables to steamed

In a large sauce pan, heat oil on medium heat. Add chicken. Cook chicken until golden brown. Remove chicken from sauce pan and drain on a paper towel. Add coleslaw mix to sauce pan. Cook coleslaw for one minute. Pour mixture into a large bowl. Add mayonnaise and stir well. Cover and refrigerate for one hour. Serve mixture on a tortilla. Roll up tortilla and serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. In a large skillet over medium heat, saute onion until softened. Add remaining ingredients. Cook until heated through. Stir occasionally. Serve pasta topped with sesame-ginger mixture. Enjoy!

In a large saucepan of salted boiling water, cook the pepper until tender. Drain. In another saucepan, heat the olive oil. Saute the pepper, onions and basil until softened. Add the cooked pepper and vegetables to a large mixing bowl. Add the cooked fish. Season to taste. In a shallow dish combine the flour and dry breadcrumbs. Dip the fish pieces in the milk. Dip each piece of fish in the flour/breadcrumb mixture. Place on a cookie sheet or baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated 400 degree oven.
Combine all the ingredients in a pitcher and mix thoroughly. Stir in a few mint leaves and a few lemon slices and serve over crushed ice.

Bring chicken stock to a boil. Drop in ravioli. Cook and stir 3 minutes or until tender. Add spinach. Cook 1 minute more. Remove ravioli to a serving dish. Sprinkle with parmesan and parsley. Serve with Italian bread.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Add sausage to large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook until browned. Add onionscook until tender. Add green bell pepperscook until crisp-tender. Stir in crushed tomatoes. Bring to boilreduce heat to low. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in ketchup and stewed tomatoes. Remove from heat. Add pasta to saucetoss gently. Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over pasta. Serve immediately. - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - --.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add oil and butter. Stir in tomato sauce and oregano. When heated through add mushrooms and cook until tender. Add the ground turkey and brown slightly. Serve over pasta with your favorite side dish.

Brown the meat in a skillet with oil over medium heat. When done, remove from pan. Add all the rest of the ingredients except the balsamic vinegar. Bring to a boil. Add the vinegar at the last minute. Pour over meat. Serve with rice or noodles.

In a large pot of boiling water, blanch vegetables about 6 minutes. Drain well. In a large skillet, warm olive oil over moderately high heat. Add vegetables, season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 2 minutes or just until tender, stirring occasionally. Meanwhile, place salmon in a large skillet coated with cooking spray. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes or until just cooked through, turning occasionally. Drain vegetables and place in a large bowl with salmon and season with salt and pepper to taste. In a small bowl, combine cilantro with lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to tastestir into vegetables with barley. Serve immediately.

Combine raspberries and sugar. Simmer over low heat until berries release their juices. Stir occasionally. When berries release juices, add port and chipotles. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes. Serve warm over ice cream.

In medium saucepan, bring sugar and corn syrup to a boil. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Mix in crisp rice cereal and morsels. Drop by teaspoonful onto waxed paper. Let cool before removing from waxed paper. Store in refrigerator.

In a saucepan over medium heat, heat the butter until melted. Sauté the onion until it is tender and translucent. Stir in the flour and cook for a minute or two. Gradually stir in the milk and bring the mixture to a boil. Stir in the heavy whipping cream and dry sherry until the bisque thickens slightly. Add the lobster meat and cooked chives and stir well. Season with salt and paprika and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine celery and onions in a large bowl. Set aside. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add celery and onions and saute for 5 minutes. Add rice and saute for 2 minutes. Pour in juice and water. Add orange rind and parsley. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and cover. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir in almonds and cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Combine sauerkraut, water and sugar in 4-quart kettle. Cook over high heat until sugar dissolves. Stir in caraway seeds. Add apples. Cook uncovered 10 minutes. Remove apples from sauerkraut. Add frankfurters. Heat through. Serve with parsley sprinkled over.

In a small bowl stir together the balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, and brown sugar. Place the chicken drumsticks in a medium glass or plastic bowl. Pour the marinade over the chickentoss to coat. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to 425 degrees. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat. Coat the grill pan with cooking spray. Remove the drumsticks from the marinadepat dry with paper towels. Place the drumsticks on the grill pan. Cook until the skin is lightly browned and the juices run clear, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving platter. Sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Garnish with the parsley.

Trim fat from top of cooked ham. In small saucepan, heat orange juice and brown sugar to boiling over medium heat. Reduce heatsimmer 5 minutes or till slightly thickened. Stir in ground mustard and orange marmaladeset aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place ham in roasting panbrush with marmalade mixture. Roast 45 minutes or till heated through.

In a small bowl whisk together vinegar, mustard, 2 tbsp. Oil and 2 tbsp. Thyme leaves. Whisk in remaining Oil. Season dressing to taste with salt and pepper. Toss greens in a large bowl with enough dressing to coat. Divide greens among 6 plates. Top with cranberries, onion slices, pecans and goat cheese. Drizzle lightly with remaining dressing. Serve.

Mix dry ingredients. Mix wet ingredients. Add wet to dry and stir until it forms into a ball. Grease loaf pan. Plop batter into pan and smooth. Let rise for 1 hour. Bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f and line a baking sheet with foil. Peel baking potatoes and cut into chunks. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Once oil is hot add onions and cook for 5 minutes or until onions are translucent. Remove from heat and add orange juice and orange zest to the skillet and stir until combined. Set aside to cool slightly. In a large bowl combine mashed baking potatoes, butter, sour cream and season to taste with salt and pepper. Fold in cooled onions and orange zest and transfer to baking sheet. Bake for 25 minutes or until heated through and crispy on the edges. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Mix dry ingredients together. Mix margarine, brown sugar and applesauce. Slowly blend in dry mixture until combined. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Let cool for 1 minute before removing to wire rack.

Mix brown sugar and tequila together to form a sauceset aside. Add pork shoulder to a slow cookercook on low setting for 6 to 7 hours or until very tender and easily shredded. Mix molasses into the sauce. Add pork shoulder and sauce to a pancook until heated through. Serve over rice. Garnish with green onions and serve warm.

Beat shortening with sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Add dry ingredients alternately with milk and vanilla, beating well after each addition. Stir in cinnamon. Pour into a greased 13-inch tube pan or two 9-inch pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. For the frosting, cream shortening with sugar. Add in milk and vanilla. Beat until fluffy. Add enough flour to give frosting a spreadable consistency. Cool cake completely. Frost while it is still warm. (If you want a thicker frosting add more shortening.)
Cook macaroni until al dente. Drain. Mix all other ingredients except for the onions and garlic powder. Let macaroni cool. Add onions and garlic powder. Mix well. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Spray a 9 x 13 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray and set aside. Place pork chop in center of dish. Place 1 slice of cheese over the top of each pork chop. Sprinkle cheese evenly over top of each pork chop. In small bowl, combine soup mix and mayonnaise and spread over the cheese layer. In small bowl, combine the remaining cheese and bread crumbs and sprinkle evenly over the mayonnaise layer. Sprinkle salt and pepper evenly over the bread crumbs layer. Bake 25 minutes or until meat thermometer reads 160 degrees F and cheese is melted and crisp.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. In a large bowl combine butter, sugars, vanilla and egg yolk, stir to blend well. In a small bowl mix together flour with salt. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture blending well. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes until golden around the edges. Remove from oven cool on wire racks for 5 minutes before transferring to cooling racks to cool completely.

Drain the cider vinegar into a saucepan. Add the pickling cukes and the vidalia onions to the pan. Cook over medium-high heat until the vegetables are tender. Drain the vegetables into a large bowl. Add the vinegar mixture to the vegetables along with the red chili flakes. Cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Add the sugar and salt to the pan and cook for 5 more minutes or until the sugar is dissolved. Add the garlic to the pan with the vegetables and cook for 5 more minutes or until the garlic is light brown. Stir in the mustard seeds and cook for 1 minute or until the mustard seeds pop. Place the vegetables into a large glass bowl or a platter. Place the tomatoes around the vegetables in concentric rings. Sprinkle with the fresh ground black pepper and serve immediately.

Combine the hoisin sauce, sambal oelek, scallion whites, wine & gingerroot in a ziplock bag. Add the chicken to the bag. Seal. Shake the bag to coat the chicken. Marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for 12-24 hours. Preheat the grill to high. Grill the chicken 5-8 minutes per side or until done. The time depends on how well done you like the chicken. If you prefer it well-done, then marinate it longer. Serve with a side salad. Makes 4 servings.
In a large bowl, whisk together chili sauce, horseradish sauce, lemon juice and worcestershire sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Add hot sauce to taste.

In a wok or large skillet over medium heat, add the oil. When the oil is hot add the chopped onion and cook until soft. Stir in the blended peanut butter and brown sugar. Stir in the soy sauce and seasoning. Cook and stir until the seasoning is dissolved. Add the liquid red pepper seasoning. Cook and stir until heated through. Serve hot. This dish can be served hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease muffin tins (or line with paper liners). Spoon the dry pumpkin into a large bowl and add the water and pumpkin puree. Add the spice and sift in the flour mixture. Add the vanilla extract and beat with an electric mixer until smooth. Fill muffin cups three-quarters full and bake for 18-22 minutes, until a toothpick inserted in the center of a cake comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing from pan and transferring to wire racks to cool completely. Frost with weight watchers icing recipe and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar.

In a mixing bowl, combine all dry ingredients. In a separate bowl beat together honey and eggs. Make a well in dry mix and add honey/egg mixture. Beat with a wooden spoon until dough is well blended. Pour into a greased 8x4x2 loaf pan. Cover loosely and let rise until doubled. Bake at 400 degrees f for 40 minutes. Let cool on wire rack.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Place chicken in an 8 by 8-inch glass baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the balsamic vinegar, extra virgin olive oil, rosemary, garlic cloves and salt. Whisk to combine. Pour over the chicken in the baking dish. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until cooked through.

Combine low-fat buttermilk and garlic in blender. Puree until smooth. Pour into a large bowl. Combine potato flakes and red snapper filletspat fillets dry with paper towels. Season fillets with salt and pepper. Add fillets to bowl with saucetoss gently. Spoon into a large shallow baking pan. Sprinkle with lemon juice and zestdrizzle with oil. Top with remaining lemon juice and zest. Place pan in pre-heated broiler. Broil for 8 minutes, or until golden and flaky. Serve with lemon wedges.

Cut lamb fillets into 1/2-inch cubes. Drain oil from fillets. Place the oil in a saucepan with the onion and heat for 5 minutes over medium heat. Add the lamb cubes and cook for about 10 minutes over medium heat or until the meat is brown on all sides. Drain the oil from the meat, leaving the oil behind. Add 2 cups of water to the pan with the meat and cook until the liquid is reduced to about half of the original amount. Add the beef broth to the pan with the meat and bring the liquid to a boil over medium heat. Add the split peas, almonds, apricot, prune, salt, and pepper to the liquid. Cook until the meat is tenderabout 45 minutes. Makes 4-6 servings.

Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a boil, add green beans and cook until tender but still crisp. Drainset aside. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and rosemarycook 1 minute or until fragrant. Add beans to pantoss gently. Season with salt if desired.

Saute onions and jalapeños in olive oil until soft. Add tomatoes and cook until thick. Add okra and cook until tender. Stir in ginger and garlic and season to taste. Add cardamom and simmer for 15 minutes or until okra is very tender.

Bring water to the boil in a medium saucepan. Add the wheat and stir to combine. Simmer for about 45 minutes or until the wheat is tender. Drain and place the wheat in a blender. Add the eggs and blend until smooth. Pour the wheat into a large pot and add the salt and water. Bring the mixture to a boil and cook for about 20 minutes. Add the onion and cook until transparent. Add the flour and stir well. Add the butter and stir. Add the yogurt and stir. Serve hot with mint and parsley.

Sauté the onion in the butter until soft. Add the beans with the liquid that they are packed in (including the juices). Add the cream to the pan and allow to boil. When the cream begins to bubble, add the cheese and the avocado in cubes. Remove from the fire and serve immediately with tortillas (warm or cold).

Pastry for double crust pie-------------. Combine flour and salt in bowl with pastry blender or fork until balls are the size of a large pea. Add cold water by the spoonful until the bowl starts to clean itself as you work the dough. Then it is ready for rolling. Preheat oven to 425f. Combine sliced apples with fresh cranberries, tapioca, water, zest and orange juice in bowlstir in brown sugar. Line pie plate with unbaked double crust pastrytrim edgesbrush edge with milktop with other crustbrush edge with milkseal edgescut slits in top for venting. Bake for 10 minutesreduce heat to 375fbake for 45 minutes longercool for 1 hour before cutting.

In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add salt and pepper to taste to flour. Dip the chicken in the flour, then in the oil. Cook until browned. Add wine and simmer 15 minutes. Remove chicken to a plate. Add sage and whole grain mustard to the pan. Cook and stir 5 minutes. Add the broth and cook until liquid is reduced to 1/3. Place the chicken in the pan with the sauce. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to low and cook 15 minutes. Combine the butter and whole grain mustard in a small bowl and brush over the top.

Pierce each orange with the tip of a small knife. Using a spoon or ladle, scoop out the orange flesh into a large bowl. Using a fork or pastry blender, mash the orange flesh until it is fairly smooth and creamy. Stir together the brown sugar, orange juice and zest until thoroughly combined. Fold the coconut into the orange mixture. Add the nutmeg and cinnamon and mix well. Using two spoons, place some of the mixture into a small ball shape and place on a waxed paper-covered baking sheet. Repeat with the remaining mixture and bake until golden brown, about 12 minutes. While the balls are baking, melt the marshmallows over low heat on the stove and stir until completely melted and smooth. Once the balls are done baking, roll them in the melted marshmallows and then roll them around a wooden cocktail skewer so that the marshmallows stick around the skewer. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cook and drain noodles according to package directions. In a large bowl combine sour cream and mayonnaise. Add the cheddar and black pepper. Stir in the broccoli and mushrooms. Add the noodles. Stir in the egg. Pour into a greased 2-quart dish. Sprinkle the top evenly with the shredded cheddar. Bake for 25 minutes.

Mix together maytag blue cheese and raspberry vinegar. Drizzle over the pears. Sprinkle with walnut halves and salt. Drizzle with oil. Mix together lettuce and tabasco sauce. Place lettuce mixture in a large bowl. Toss with dressing. Serve.

Prepare your favorite penne pasta according to the package instructions. In a large saute pan over medium heat, saute onion in olive oil until translucent. Add tomatoes and garlic and saute for about 5 minutes. Add spinach and saute for another 4 to 5 minutes. Add kalamata olives and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Add penne to the pan and toss until well combined. Serve immediately.

Clean and slice large button mushrooms. In a large saucepan, saute the chopped mushrooms in 2 tablespoons of butter. Cook and stir over medium heat for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in 1/3 cup of lemon juice. Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until sauce thickens. Stir in remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and 3/4 cup of whipping cream. Cook and stir until thick. Season with salt, white pepper and nutmeg. Serve over toast with chopped fresh parsley.

Dry the chicken pieces with paper towel. Mix the eggs and milk well. Place the pretzel crumbs in a bag. Dip each piece of chicken in egg-milk mixture. Then place in bag and coat well. Drop into 350f vegetable oil and fry till golden brown. Place the chicken pieces on foil in a large baking pan and bake in 300f oven for 35 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine 1 cup water and 1 cup sugar in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring to dissolve. Remove from heat. Stir in 1 cup chopped apricots. Coverrefrigerate 24 hours. Remove apricot mixture from refrigerator. Puree 1 cup of apricot mixture in a blender. Pour mixture through fine sieve into a bowl. Discard solids. Add remaining cup apricots, 1/3 cup blended apricots, 1 cup lemon juice, and 2 teaspoons almond extract. Transfer to a 1-quart pancover. Chill until firm. Freeze in an ice-cream maker according to manufacturer’s instructions. Transfer to an airtight container. Freeze for up to 2 months.

Combine the dry ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Combine the wet ingredients in a small bowl. Add wet mixture to dry and stir until a thick batter forms. Drop by heaping tablespoons onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 for 12 minutes or until done. Cool on a wire rack.

Melt shortening in saute pan over medium heat. Add sweet onions to saute pan along with garlic cloves, cook until tender about 5 minutes. Stir in chili powder, cumin, liquid smoke, worcestershire sauce and beer. Add brisket to mixture in pan. Cover pan and cook over low heat for 2 to 2 1/2 hours or until brisket is tender. Remove pan from heat and stir in bottled chili sauce until it thickens. Stir in remaining ingredients until well combined. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Cut the butter into small cubes. Melt in a large saucepan. Add the water, salt, eggs, and flour to the melted butter. Mix until smooth. Bring to the boil, stirring constantly. Cook at the boil for 10 minutes. Add the mixture by tablespoons to boiling soup or stock. Stir with a wooden spoon. Cook covered until all of the mixture is cooked. If not cooked enough add some more mixture. Serve hot.

Cook the potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain. Peel the potatoes. Chop the potatoes into bite size pieces. Combine the vegetable oil, vinegar, onions, and celery in a large bowl. Add the cooked potatoes to the bowl. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add the mayonaise and yogurt. Stir gently to coat. Refrigerate overnight. Serve chilled.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 4 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Stir in the sour cream and cook until combined. Turn off heat and season with salt and pepper. Slice the bacon crosswise into 1/2-inch-thick strips. In a medium-sized bowl, mix the flour with the baking powder, baking soda, cayenne pepper, salt, paprika and garlic powder. Stir in the butter until crumbly. Add the sour cream mixture, then the scallions and parsley. Stir until well combined. Press the crumb mixture into the bottom of a 9-by-13-inch baking dish. Bake for 10 minutes. Remove the casserole from the oven and spread the cooked sausage over the crumb mixture. Crumble the Swiss cheese over the top of the sausage. In a large bowl, whisk together the beaten eggs with the milk. Pour the egg mixture even

Heat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. Place pie crusts on lightly greased cookie sheet or pan. Spread sauce on crusts and top with mozzarella cheese and cooked chicken. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted and crust is golden brown.

Mix together the sugar, salt, baking soda, zest of lemons, lemons, eggs and juice into a bowl. Then add the butter into the bowl. Beat together using an electric mixer until the mixture is light yellow. Pour the mixture onto a plate with a cookie cutter shape that you want to make. Place a wax paper on top of the mixture and put the cookie cutter on top of the wax paper to cut the shape out of the mixture. Put the cookie cut out mixture onto a cookie sheet with some parchment paper on top. Bake at 350 degrees for about 10 minutes or until the mixture is dry on the outside.

Spread mayonnaise over the inside of each hamburger bun. Arrange the cooked vegetables inside each bun. Top each with the tuna. Sprinkle each bun with cheese. Place the top of the bun over the filling.

Bring water and coffee to a boil. Remove from heat and add cardamom and saffron to the mixture. Let it steep for five minutes. Then strain into cups and add a little bit of rose water to it for taste.

Make a double batch of your favorite boxed mac and cheese mix and set aside half of it for a side dish. In a large saucepan melt butter over medium heat. Add broccoli cheese soup and half of your mac mix (the half that s for your side dish). Bring mixture to a boil. Add meat (we used a pork tenderloin) and cook until done (about 30 minutes). Pour into a baking dish and sprinkle remaining mac mix over meat mixture. Bake at 400 degrees for about 10 minutes until top is golden brown.

Preheat your grill on medium to high. In a bowl add all ingredients except the shrimp. Whisk together with a fork or blender. Add the tomato paste and blend. Place the shrimp in a bowl and coat with the mixture. Place on the grill and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Serve on a plate with a drizzle of the marinade.

In large saucepan or Dutch Oven heat 2 cups of the milk over medium heat until it comes to a simmer. Stir in ricesimmer until all the liquid has been absorbed by the rice. Remove pan from heatlet stand for about 15 minutes or until the rice is tender when poked with the tip of a knife. In large bowl beat eggs with cream until soft peaks formset aside. Heat the remaining milk over medium heatstir in salt and cinnamon. Cook, stirring, until the mixture comes to a simmer. Remove from heat. Gradually beat the hot milk into the eggsreturn to pan over medium heatstirring constantly until the pudding is thickenedabout 12 minutes. Remove the pan from the heatstir in vanillaserve warm or cold.

Cut up onion and celery in small dice. Cut carrots into small cubes. Peel and dice potatoes. Add onion, celery, carrots, tomatoes and all spices to a pot. Bring to boil. Lower temperature to simmer. Add chicken broth to pot. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add chicken breasts to pot. Cook for about 10-15 minutes or until tender. Stir occasionally.

Cut tomatoes into quarters lengthwise. Remove seeds and membranes and discard. Cut each quarter into 2 or 3 pieces if very small or leave whole if large. Place in a bowl and add lemon juice, sugar, olive oil and savorytoss to coat well. Season with salt and ground red pepper and toss again. Sprinkle garlic clove evenly over tomatoes and let stand about 10 minutes before serving. Makes 6 servings.
Combine all ingredients, except chutney. Pack into a bowl or mold. Chill until firm. Remove and roll in chutney to coat exterior. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 11x7-inch baking dish with cooking spray. In large skillet brown the ground beef and onion. Stir in the corn. Drain. Mix in sour cream, flour, sugar, seasoning. Pour into sprayed pan. Bake for 35 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.
Prepare fresh vegetable mixture. Mix all other ingredients together and pour over vegetables. Toss well. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Garnish with sunflower seeds.

Stir warm water into yeast. When yeast begins bubbling add oil and honey. Stir in salt and cinnamon. Gradually add the flour. Add the raisins and stir until well blended. Add enough additional flour to make dough easy to handle. Knead until smooth. Place in greased bowl and let rise in warm place until doubled. Punch down and let rise again. Punch down and let rise again. Bake in 400 degree preheated oven for about 40 minutes or until bread sounds hollow when tapped.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Prepare pasta according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat the olive oil in a 12-inch skillet. Slice the zucchini and squash into 1/4-inch rounds. Add the zucchini and squash to the skillet and cook for about 8 minutes. Add the minced onions and saute for another 5 minutes. Add the sausage and cook until browned. Add the pasta and sauce and bring to a boil. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dish and sprinkle with garbanzo beans and parsley. Bake for 15 minutes. Serve topped with grated parmesan cheese.

In a food processor add gluten, 3 tbsp. each of cumin and garlic powder, 1 tbsp. each of the onion powder, mushroom stock and soy sauce. Process until mixture is smooth. Add 1 tbsp. each of nutritional yeast and vegetarian worcestershire sauce. Process until smooth. Roll out mixture to a thin 1/2" log. Place in loaf pan. Bake 1 1/2 hours at 350 degrees. Let stand 15 minutes. Slice and serve.

In a large sauce pan cook bread cubes in hot oil about 5 minutes or until bread is brown. Add broth, garlic clove, salt and pepper. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer covered for 15 minutes. In a small bowl beat egg. Add to soup. Stir to blend. Stir in bread cubes. Simmer for about 5 minutes more or until bread is tender. Season to taste with pepper.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Wash and cut the potatoes into medium-sized pieces. Put the cut potatoes into a large pot and cover them with cold water. Boil them for about 15 minutes until they are soft and tender. Remove them from the pot. Put the cooked potatoes in a large bowl and mash them with a large fork. Add the sour cream and stir well. Add the cheeses and stir them into the mixture. Add the chives and stir well. Add the salt and pepper and stir again. Place the mixture into a greased casserole dish and put it into the preheated oven. Bake the potato mixture until the cheeses have melted and the top is slightly brown. Serve warm.

Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces. Cut the celery into small pieces. Slice the onion. Chop the grapes. Add the chicken to a mixing bowl. Add the celery and onion. Add the lemon juice to taste. Add the mayonnaise. Add the grape juice to taste. Add the mandarin oranges to the mixture. Add the toasted almond to the mixture. Place the romaine lettuce in a bowl. Top with the mixture.

Preheat the oven to 375f. Cream butter with the brown sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Beat in vanilla essence. Sift self raising flour with the milo. Gradually add the dry ingredients. Fold in the chocolate chips. Drop spoonfuls onto greased trays. Flatten slightly with a fork. Bake for about 12 minutes or until golden.
Blend all ingredients in blender until smooth. Pour into glasses. Serve.

In a small saucepan over low heat melt margarine and add caramels. Stir until caramels are melted. Stir in powdered sugar and marshmallow cream. Stir in pecans and mix well. Form mixture into 1/3 cup balls and place on wax paper. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Roll in powdered sugar and serve.
Thaw and drain the spinach. In a large bowl, combine all the other ingredients and stir to combine. Pour the mixture into a greased 9 by 13 inch pan. Bake at 400 degrees for about 20 minutes.
In a blender or food processor, blend all the ingredients except the parmesan until smooth. Transfer to a small bowl. Sprinkle with parmesan and serve with whole-grain crackers.

Cut the cod into pieces the size of an egg and cook it in a small amount of boiling water for 1 minute or until it turns into a paste. Remove the bones from the cod with a fork or a knife. Put the cod in a bowl and mix with the eggs. Add the bacon and cooked green peppers. Fry in a pan until the egg mixture is cooked through. Serve the scrambled eggs on hot slices of white bread. Add a slice of bacon for decoration. Serve with tomato sauce on the side.

Clean the eggplants. Cut into 1-inch cubes. Put the cubes in a baking dish. Add salt to taste and drizzle with soy sauce. Bake for about 30 minutes, or until tender. Remove from oven. Add the lime juice to the baking dish. Stir in the chili paste. Add more salt to taste. Pour over the palm sugar and stir to coat. Remove from oven. Cool for 15 minutes. Serve with cilantro. You may also add fresh cilantro to your dip before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Remove woody ends from the bottom of the spears of the asparagus. Lay the spears in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Drizzle with the extra virgin olive oil, coarse salt, balsamic vinegar. Place the shiitake mushrooms in a single layer on the same sheet. Sprinkle with coarse salt. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until the asparagus is tender. Remove from the oven. Toss the spears and mushrooms with the olive oil.

In a saucepan combine water and oatsbring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heatcover and cook 5 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. In a separate saucepan combine all other ingredientsbring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heatcook 30 minutes, stirring frequently (about every 10 minutes). Pour the hot oats into the hot cream mixturestir to blend well. Transfer to a 2-gallon-size zipper-lock freezer bagsealpress out as much air as possiblefreeze 12 hours or overnight. To serve, let stand at room temperature 10 minutes before servingloosen with a fork.

Bring rice and chicken broth to a boil in medium saucepan over high heat. Cook for 15 minutes, or until tender and liquid is absorbed. Add leeks and cook over medium heat until tender, about 5 minutes. Add chicken and saffron and cook for 3 minutes. Add peas and cook for 2 minutes longer. Add lemon juice and zeststir to combine. Transfer to a shallow 8x11 inch baking dish and sprinkle evenly with cheese and breadcrumbs. Bake until golden brown and bubbly, about 12 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375. Cook rice and drain. Chop chicken. Melt butter in skillet. Cook chicken for 3 minutes. Stir in soup. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir in rice. Stir in cheddar cheese and green pepper. Pour mixture into baking dish. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake for 25 minutes.

Preheat oven to 180c (350F). Grease and line two 20cm (8-inch) sandwich tins. Beat butter and sugar until light. Beat in eggs. Add flour and baking powder. Stir in lemon juice and zest. Pour into prepared tins. Bake for about 35 minutes or until golden brown. Turn out of tins.

Cook noodles in boiling water according to package directionsdrain. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef, green pepper, and onioncook 8-10 minutes or until meat is no longer pink. Stir in tomato paste and garliccook 1-2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes. Simmer 5 minutes. Stir in seasonings. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook 3-5 minutes longer or until heated through.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Place pasta and all remaining ingredients in a large serving bowl. Mix well to coat. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Pulse flax meal and almond flour together in food processor. Add Splenda and cinnamonpulse again to combine. Add water and process again to combine. Let rest for 10 minutes to thicken. Form into balls about 2 inches diameter and place onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Press with back of spoon to create flat disk about 1/4 inch thick. Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until lightly golden brown. Cool and store in air-tight container.

Mix the soy sauce, honey, ginger and garlic in a bowl. Place the chicken into the bowl and turn to coat it all over. Marinate for 30 minutes. Drain the excess liquid from the chicken and then barbecue over direct heat for about 10 minutes.

Saute onion in butter until tender. Add rice and brown with onion about 5 minutes. Add salt, water and cover until water is absorbed. Add garlic salt, pepper and bouillon cubes. Stir in cooked broccoli. Add chicken and cream of chicken soup with milk. Pour into greased casserole dish. Top with provolone cheese and bake at 375 degrees for 40-45 minutes.

Boil your potatoes for a few minutes and set them aside to cool. Peel and dice the potatoes into bite size cubes. Add all other ingredients to your salad. Mix everything together and refrigerate. This recipe is easy to customize. You can change up your flavors based on your taste.

Heat a large pot of water over high heat until it comes to a boil. Meanwhile, add the shallots, garlic clove, wine vinegar, mustard, salt, and pepper to a small bowl. Stir to combine. Place the white beans in a large serving bowl. Pour in the dressing and stir to coat well. Once the water has come to a boil, cook the beans for 2 minutes or until they're tender but not mushy. Drain the beans in a colander and rinse with cold water to cool them down. Drain well and add to the dressing. Stir to coat well with the dressing. Finish by adding the parsley. Serve immediately or refrigerate up to 4 days ahead of time.

Sautee onion in olive oil over medium heat until golden brown. Add garlic and ginger and sautee for about 3 minutes. Add in stock and water. Cover pot with lid and bring mixture to a boil over medium heat. Add in soba noodles and continue cooking over medium heat until noodles are tender (about 5 minutes). Add spinach and cook until wilted (about 1-2 minutes). Season with soy sauce and lime juice to taste (about 1/2 teaspoon). Serve hot with chopped green onions if desired. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips for dipping.

Cut squash in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Rub lightly inside squash with garlic cloves. Place squash halves in large skillet. Add enough water to come halfway up sides of squash. Cover and cook until squash is tender. Cool squash halves. Remove skin. Cut squash into thin slices. Stir together dressing and oregano. Coat squash slices in dressing mixture and arrange on platter. Serve with polish sausage and bread.

In a heavy saucepan, melt the butter. Add the onions & cook over low heat until the onions are soft. Add the rice & stir to coat the rice with the butter & onions. Add the water & bring to a simmer. Cover tightly & cook over a low heat for about 30 minutes. Remove from heat & let stand for 5 minutes. Stir in the parsley & hot sauce. Fold in the frozen peas. Stir in the salt & pepper. Serve.

Slice the squash in half lengthwise. Remove the seeds and chop into 1/2" pieces. Place the squash halves cut side down in a roasting pan with 1/4" water. Roast the squash until tender for about 45 minutes at 400F degrees. Remove from oven. Puree the roasted squash with 1 cup of the stock. Heat the olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Saute the onion until tender for about 3 minutes. Add the roasted squash puree along with the roasted garlic cloves and cook for 2 more minutes. Add the rice to the pan with the puree mixture. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in the remaining 3 cups of stock until it is absorbed by the rice. Reduce the heat to a simmer. Cook for about 20 minutes or until the rice is tender. Stir in the remaining 2 cups of stock along with the cream cheese, balsamic vinegar, salt, pepper, and rosemary. Cook until the sauce thickens for about 30 minutes more

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a large mixing bowl, combine the eggs and condensed milk. Mix well. Pour into a greased deep dish pie plate (approximately 8x8x2 inch). Bake in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Remove from the oven and cool for 10-15 minutes before serving. Meanwhile, place the pecans in a shallow dish or plastic bag. Drizzle with the melted butter. Shake well to coat the pecans evenly with the butter. Set aside until ready to use. In a heavy saucepan, melt the chocolate over low heat, stirring frequently until melted. Remove from the heat and stir in the caramel ice cream topping until blended. Pour the chocolate mixture over the cooled pie filling. Sprinkle with the butter-coated pecans. Cool for 30 minutes before serving.

Drain and rinse the lentils. Put them into a large saucepan with about 3 cups of water. Add the salt. Bring the water to a boil over medium-high heat. Cook the lentils until tender. While the lentils are cooking, make the sauce. Heat the remaining 1 cup of water with the ground beef. Drain the meat when it is cooked through. Stir the ketchup, mustard, vinegar and pepper into the meat. Add the meat to the saucepan. Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Stir the onion soup mix into the sauce. Cook for 5 minutes more. Serve over hot cooked rice. You can also top the rice with grated cheese if you like.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel potatoes, slice into 1-inch slices and boil until tender. Drain and set aside. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add butter and saute onions until tender. Add sour cream to skillet and saute for 2 minutes longer. Spoon soup mixture into a 13x9-inch baking dish. Arrange potatoes in the bottom of the dish. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and top with onions. Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Uncovercook for 10 more minutes until cheese is golden brown.

Spray the grill pan with non-stick cooking spray. Place the tuna steaks in the pan. Sprinkle them with the spice and season with salt and pepper. Cook for about 5 minutes on each side or until the fish flakes when lightly pressed.

Drain and rinse dried navy beans. Place in a 9x13 casserole and mix together catsup, barbecue sauce, dry mustard and brown sugar. Pour over navy beans. Cover and bake at 350f for about one hour or until done.

Remove the skin and pith from the oranges. Cut the orange in half and then cut into 1/8-inch thick slices. Peel the avocados and cut into 1/2-inch slices. Arrange the oranges and avocados on a bed of greens. In a small bowl, whisk together 1 tablespoon white balsamic vinegar and 1 tablespoon olive oil until combined. Drizzle over the salad and serve.

Cut the swiss cheese and deli ham into small pieces. In a large ziploc bag add the chicken breast, swiss cheese and deli ham. Add the cream of chicken soup. Add the italian seasoned bread crumbs. Add the milk and the garlic powder and the onion powder. Shake to mix. Put 1/3 of the mixture in each crock pot. Cook on low 4-5 hours. Serve over rice.

Peel and section the orange and reserve the juice and zest. Heat oil and vinegar in a small saucepan until hot. Add sugar and stir until dissolved. Place broccoli florets in a large bowl and drizzle with dressing. Add almonds and green onions. Toss well. Top with sections of orange and sprinkle with remaining zest.

Preheat oven to 160C/140C Fan/Gas 3. Grease a 2lb loaf tin (22cm x 8cm/9x4ins) and line with parchment paper. Melt butter in a saucepan and add brown sugar, golden syrup and milk. Cook for 3 mins until golden and remove from heat. Add 200g white chocolate pieces to the pan and stir until melted. Leave to cool slightly. Beat the eggs into 350g of gluten-free flour using a handheld electric whisk until light and creamy. Fold in 200g of white chocolate, 125ml of thickened cream (see tip) and 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract until smooth. Fold in 1/3 of cooled brown mixture until just combined, then repeat with remaining mixture until you have a smooth batter. Spoon mixture into prepared tin and smooth over the surface with a spatula or pallet knife. Bake for 1 hour 15 mins or until a skewer inserted into
Mash chickpeas. Add to them salt, pepper and all herbs. Add a bit of oil to make a paste. Shape into croquettes. Fry until golden brown. Serve.

Peel, core and slice apples into thin slices. Saute over medium-low heat until softened. Stir frequently. When done, remove from heat. Stir brown sugar into apples. Stir in cardamom. If using raisins, add at this time. Place apple mixture into a baking dish. Bake until light brown. Serve warm.

Toast bread lightly on both sides. Spread butter on one side of each slice of bread, ham on another and the cheese on the last one. Place two slices of ham and one slice of cheese together to form a sandwich and place one slice of pickled onion on top of each sandwich. Place two slices of bread together to form a sandwich and place the sandwiches cut side down on a baking tray. Sprinkle each with a little sugar, cover with foil and bake for about 5 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with a small bowl of chutney on the side for dipping.

Wash the asparagus and dry thoroughly. Cut off the ends. If the stalks are thick, cut them into pieces about four inches long. Slice the eggs into thin half rounds. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat and saute the ham for about two minutes. Add the asparagus and cook over medium heat until tender (about five minutes). Turn the heat down low and add the eggs. Cook the eggs until they are firm, then turn them over and cook for about a minute longer. Transfer the eggs to a serving plate and arrange the asparagus around them. Serve immediately.

Stir yeast, warm water and sugar together in a small bowl until yeast dissolves. Stir in oil, salt and eggs. Gradually mix in 2 cups of the flour until a soft dough is formed. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5-8 minutes. Place in a greased bowl, turning dough to grease top. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour. Punch down dough. Shape dough as required. Place in a greased loaf pan or pans. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise until doubled in size (about 45-60 minutes). Bake in a preheated 450f, gas mark 8, oven for 35-45 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool in pans for 5-10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
Cut tomatoes into slices and place on platter. Mix mayonnaise and yogurt with lemon juice and zest and pour over tomatoes. Sprinkle with capers. Refrigerate until serving time.

Preheat oven to 350f. In a stand mixer with paddle attachment, beat together butter, brown sugar and granulated sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time, beating after each addition until well combined. Add flour, cocoa powder, ground almonds and amaretto, mixing until just combined. Pour into an 8x8 baking pan. Sprinkle with chopped almonds. Bake for 25 minutes or until set. Let cool completely before cutting into squares to serve.

In skillet cook beef over medium heat until beef is brown. Add onions. Cook until tender. Drain. Stir in bisquick mix. Add eggs. Mix well. Pour into unbaked pie shell. Bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden brown.

Cook bacon till crisp, remove bacon with slotted spoon into pan with drippingsadd sliced onionsadd flourcook 3 minutesgradually add milkcook until thickenedstir in eggsadd potatoescook 25 minutesadd cheesesbake 350F 20 minutestop with breadcrumbsbake 15 minutes more.

In a shallow dish whisk together the buttermilk and the mustard. Add the garlic and red pepper flakes and whisk to blend. Place the chicken breasts in the buttermilk mixture and refrigerate for 1-2 hours. Remove the chicken from the buttermilk mixture and drain well. Roll the chicken breasts in cracker crumbs to coat all sides thoroughly. Bake for 25-30 minutes at 350f until the chicken is cooked through. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (218 degrees C). Cut a small hole in the top of each biscuitset aside. Combine sugar and ground cinnamonset aside. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heatcool slightly. Place a biscuit on each of 12 ungreased baking sheetsspread each with melted butter and top each with a nut. Wrap each biscuit around nut completelyplace seam side down on baking sheet. Combine sugar mixture and milkbrush biscuits with glaze. Bake at 425 degrees F (218 degrees C) for 12 minutes or until biscuits are golden and puffy and tops are golden. Cool on baking sheets for 5 minutesremove to wire racks to cool completely.
Beat egg white until stiff peaks form. Gradually beat in sour cream. Fold in the cocoa and coffee. Add the brown sugar. Fold in the egg white. Fold in the vanilla. Chill for at least 2 hours. Serve.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine figs and marsala. Cover pan and cook until figs are tender and liquid has reduced to a syrup, about 15 minutes. Remove from heat and strain syrup into a bowl or jar through a fine sieve, discarding solids. Add orange blossom water and honey to syrup and stir until combined. Whisk in creme fraiche and stir until combined. Serve immediately garnished with mint leaves and oranges and drizzled with a little more syrup if desired.

In a large sauce pan combine water and soup mix. Stir in margarine. Cook over medium heat until margarine is melted. Add uncooked rice and bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and cook for about 40 minutes stirring occasionally.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit or 180 degrees celsius. Place the bisquick mix in a shallow dish. In a medium saucepan heat the butter over low heat until melted. Stir in the brown sugar until dissolved then add the oats. Stir in the cherry filling and cinnamon. Pour the filling into the crumb mixture and stir until blended. Spoon the mixture into a 9 inch baking dish that has been greased lightly. Sprinkle the nuts over the top of the filling. Bake for about 40 minutes or until the crumble is golden brown and bubbly around the edges. Serve warm with a scoop of ice cream if desired.
Combine first 8 ingredients in a large saucepan and bring to boil. Boil until sauce thickens. Stir in cheese blend.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit (177 c). Line a 15 inch x 10 inch x 1 inch baking pan with parchment paper and set aside. In a large bowl, combine the almonds, flour, baking powder and 1/2 cup of the sugar and stir until the nuts are lightly coated. In a small bowl combine the egg white, remaining 1/4 cup of the sugar and the vanilla. Whisk until frothy then fold into the nut mixture. Make a well in the center of the nut mixture then pour in the melted butter and stir until all of the dry ingredients are moistened. Form the dough into a ball then place the dough in the prepared pan. With your hands, press the dough into an even layer about 1/2 inch thick throughout the pan. Bake for 20 minutes then remove the pan from the oven and let cool completely then cut into squares. Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 1 week or in the freezer for up to 3 months
Rinse tempeh and pat dry. Place tempeh on a rimmed baking sheet and broil about 12 minutes or until golden brown. Meanwhile, prepare other ingredients. Place all in a large bowl and mix well.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Grease two cookie sheets with shortening or cooking spray. Beat together eggs, vanilla extract, unsweetened cocoa powder, vegetable oil and granulated sugar on medium-high speed for about two minutes or until thickened slightly. Stir in flour, baking powder and salt. Drop dough by heaping tablespoons onto cookie sheets about one-inch apart. Bake for 6-8 minutes or until golden brown. Cool on cookie sheet for one minute, then remove to wire rack to cool completely. Melt confectioners sugar in microwave oven on medium for about 20 seconds or until liquefied. Dip each cookie into the melted confectioners sugarremove excess with a paper towel. Place cookie on parchment paperlet dry about one hour before serving.

Place sausages on bottom of slow cooker. Arrange the mixed vegetables around sausages. Sprinkle with flour and curry powdersprinkle with water. Cover and cook on low for 4 to 5 hours. Serve with cooked rice or noodles or serve as a sandwich filling.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil over high heat. Add 1 tablespoon of the butter and 2 teaspoons of the kosher saltcook until the butter is melted and the water comes to a boil again, about 2 minutes. Add the macaroni to the boiling water. Reduce the heat to medium, and cook the macaroni, stirring often with a spoon, until tender yet firm to the bite, 7 to 10 minutes. Drain the pasta in a colander set over a bowl of ice water (this helps the pasta retain its color). Transfer the cooked noodles to a large bowl. Add the remaining 2 tablespoons of the butter, the eggs, the evaporated milk, the hot sauce, the kosher salt, the fresh black pepper, the dry mustard, and the shredded cheesestir with a fork until all of the ingredients are evenly combined and the cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Steam snow peas until crisp-tender. Heat chicken broth. Stir cornstarch into 2 tbsps water. Add cornstarch mixture to broth. Add snow peas to broth. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring occasionally until thickened. Stir in fresh chives. Season with salt and pepper.

In a large bowl combine the brown sugars and the cocoa. Add the butter and beat with an electric mixer on medium speed until creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until they are incorporated. Add the vanilla. In a small bowl combine the flours and the salt and baking powder. With the electric mixer on low speed, gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet mixture. Stir until just combined. Spread the batter into the prepared pan and sprinkle with the mini chocolate chips. Bake the brownies for about 25-28 minutes or until the edges are set and the center looks dry. Let cool the pan on wire racks for about 15 minutes. Invert the pan and let the brownies cool completely. Store the brownies in an airtight container at room temperature.
Mix dry ingredients. Mix wet ingredients. Combine until well incorporated. Use a cookie scoop to form dough into balls. Arrange on cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 9 minutes.

Mix cherry jell-o with 1/2 cup boiling water. Stir in 1/2 cup cola. In a large bowl, beat the cream cheese with a mixer on high speed until smooth. Gradually beat in the jell-o mixture. Fold in the nuts. Pour into a 4-qt. mold or tureen. Refrigerate 4 hours or until firm. Serve with crackers.

Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a medium saucepan. Stir in 1/3 of the chopped garlic. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Stir in 2 cups water. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add 1/3 of the chicken soup. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Stir in 2 cups water. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add 1/3 of the mushroom soup. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Stir in 2 cups water. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Add 1/3 of the cream of broccoli soup. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Stir in 2 cups water. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Stir in 1/2 of the remaining cheese. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Add 1/3 of the remaining chopped garlic. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes. Stir in 2 cups water. Cook over medium heat for 3 minutes. Stir in 1/2 of the remaining cheese. Cook over low heat for

Preheat grill to medium-high heat. Drizzle 1 teaspoon olive oil on both sides of the fillets. Sprinkle with 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes and 1/2 teaspoon minced garlic on one side of each fillet. Set aside to let garlic and pepper infuse. In large bowl, combine 2 tablespoons olive oil, remaining minced garlic and remaining red pepper flakes. Stir in parsley and season with salt and pepper to taste. Heat remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil in large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Cook fillets about 2 minutes on each side until lightly browned and cooked through. Drain excess oil from fillets and place on platter. Top with orange roughy and olives, garnish with parsley and serve with sauteed garlic and parsley mixture on side for dipping sauce. Makes 2 servings.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a large saute pan heat butter and olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant. Add the figs and saute for another 1 minute. Add the dijon mustard and horseradish. Stir for 30 seconds. Add shrimp and coat. Cook for 5-7 minutes until opaque and cooked through. Place the shrimp in a 9 x 13 baking dish and drizzle glaze over the top. Bake for 8-10 minutes until glaze is bubbling. Serve.

Brown bacon in a large pot with a lidremove bacon with a slotted spoon. Pour off most of the grease (reserve for another use). Add onionssauté until softened - about 5 minutes. Stir in the remaining ingredients (except bacon) until well blendedcover tightly & cook over medium heat for 30 minutes - stirring occasionally. Stir in baconcook for 10 minutes more - stirring occasionally until warmed through. Season with salt & pepper.

Boil new potatoes until tendercool. Peel and cut into bite sized pieces. In another large bowl, beat together mayonnaise, mustard, sour cream, horseradish, salt and celery seed. Add hard cooked eggsmix gently until combined. Add potatoesmix gently until combined. Add green onionmix gently until combined. Serve on lettuce leafs or in lettuce cupsgarnish with additional green onions if desired.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Prick the scrubbed russet potatoes all over with a fork and place in a baking dish. Bake for about 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from the oven and cool on a rack for about 15 minutes. Meanwhile, combine yogurt with sun-dried tomato, olives and herb seasoning. Spoon yogurt mixture into each baked potato. Top with feta cheese. Sprinkle with ground pepper. Return to the oven and bake for about 15 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Spread butter on the outsides of each slice of bread. Arrange the roasted red peppers in one slice of bread. Spread the mozzarella evenly over the roasted red peppers. Sprinkle the parmigiano over the cheese. Layer the basil leaves evenly over the top. Place the other slice of bread over the basil. Press down firmly to seal the edges of the sandwich. Wrap each sandwich in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Preheat broiler. Place each sandwich in an ungreased broiler-proof baking dish. Broil until brown and cheese is bubbly.

Thaw frozen green beans. Cook in boiling water for 3 minutes. Drain. Melt butter in large skillet. Add chopped onions and cook until tender. Add chopped bacon and cook until crisp. Add drained frozen green beans. Stir in chicken broth. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Remove from heat. Stir in Tabasco. Makes four servings.

Boil potatoes until tender. Peel them. Cut each one in half lengthwise. Cut each half into thirds. Cut each third into half again. Put them on a cookie sheet with sides and drizzle with melted butter and seasoned stuffing mix. Sprinkle with parsley flakes and diced pimento. Place in preheated 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes or until browned. Serve hot with cheddar cheese on top.

Add olive oil to a large pan over medium heat. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside to drain. Add garlic and cook until aromatic. Add onions to the pan and cook for about 5 minutes or until softened. Add the cooked pierogies to the pan. Pour the water over the pierogies and add salt and dill to the pan. Bring to a boil over high heat then reduce to medium heat and cook for 5 minutes or until the pierogies are tender and the water has reduced by half. Remove from heat and serve immediately with the reserved crisp bacon.

Preheat the oven to 220C/430F/Gas 7. Rinse the fish and pat dry with kitchen paper. Heat half the oil and half the butter in a non-stick frying-pan over a medium-high heat. Add the fish and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side, until golden brown and cooked through. Transfer to a warm platter and keep warm in the oven while you make the sauce. To make the sauce, put the lemon juice and remaining half of the oil and half of the butter in the same pan used to cook the fish and heat over a high heat. Stir in the soy sauce and cook for 2 minutes until bubbling hot. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the egg yolk, then pour the sauce over the fish. Sprinkle with parsley and serve immediately with lemon wedges and new potatoes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius. Melt the butter and pour it into a mixing bowl. Add the brown and white sugars and mix them with the melted butter until the mixture is well blended. Add the egg and the vanilla extract and mix them into the sugars and butter until the mixture is well blended. In another mixing bowl, combine the all purpose flour, the baby ruth bars, the baking powder and the salt and mix them with the other ingredients until the mixture is well blended. Once all of the ingredients are well blended, transfer the batter to an ungreased cookie sheet and shape the mixture into balls that are about 1 1/2 inches in diameter. Flatten the balls into disc shapes and then press the center of each disc into a baby ruth bar. Bake the cookies at 375 degrees fahrenheit or 175 degrees celsius for 12 minutes or until the cookie is golden brown on top and the edges are slightly brown. Remove the cookies from the oven and cool them on wire racks.name

Cut oranges in half. Squeeze and mix with cold water and sugar. Mix egg and milk. Add to oranges. Stir in nuts and salt. Stir in baking powder and flour. Mix well. Pour into greased pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove to wire racks. Cool.

Cut the eggplants into 1/4 inch thick slices. Place in a large bowl and drizzle them with 2 tablespoons of the oil. Add 1 tablespoon of the curry powder and stir to coat. Transfer the eggplant to a grill rack coated with cooking spray. Grill over medium heat for 10 minutes, turning occasionally. Transfer the eggplant to a large bowl. Add the remaining curry powder and oil to the bowl. Add the green beans and stir to coat. Transfer the beans to the grill rack. Grill over medium heat for 3 minutes, turning occasionally. Transfer the green beans to the bowl. Add the remaining oil and curry powder. Add the remaining beans. Transfer the beans to the grill rack. Grill over medium heat for 4 minutes, turning occasionally. Transfer the beans to the bowl. Add the remaining oil and curry powder. Add the remaining beans. Transfer the beans to the grill rack. Grill over medium heat for 3 minutes. Transfer the beans to the bowl. Add the remaining oil and cur
Boil new potatoes until tender. Drain well. Add sour cream, nonfat milk and mash. Add bacon bits, chives and season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.
Brown hamburger. Add onion, basil, seasonings, broth, tomato paste. Boil for 5 minutes. Add water. Simmer for 1 hour. Add mushrooms. Serve over cooked pasta.
Combine all ingredients and mix well. Pour batter into a greased loaf pan. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for about an hour.

Mix together all the ingredients except the oreos and the butter. Place the oreo cookies in the bottom of a 9x9 baking dish or a loaf pan. Pour the mixture over the oreos and press down gently. Place in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours. Remove and spread the cool whip over the top of the dessert and serve. It will make 10 to 12 servings.

Preheat oven to 160°c. Grease 2 x 20cm ovenproof dishes. Cut bread into cubes. Beat eggs and sugar with electric mixer till thick. Stir in vanilla essence. Melt butter with cinnamon, nutmeg. Pour over bread. Beat egg mixture into bread. Spoon mixture into greased dishes. Dot with chocolate chips. Cook for 45 minutes. Serve with custard or ice cream.

Cook multi grain penne according to package directions. Drain and keep warm. In a large skillet over medium heat cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. Stir in sun dried tomato paste and stir until dissolved. Stir in alfredo sauce. Cook and stir over medium heat for 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in the bacon, fresh basil, and black pepper. Serve immediately over the penne.

Preheat the oven to 160 degrees C. Grease a 24cm square baking tray. In a large bowl, combine the desiccated coconut, rice bubbles and golden syrup. Add the margarine and beat until the mixture is thick and smooth. Add the dark chocolate chips and stir until melted. Fold through the cherries. Press the mixture into the prepared tray. Leave to stand for 30 minutes. Cut into squares. Melt the remaining dark chocolate chips. Dip one side of each square into the chocolate and place on a wire rack to set. Store in an airtight container.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and peel. Mash potatoes. Stir in eggs and flour. Drop mixture by teaspoonfuls onto a floured board. Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into strips 2 inches long. Place in saucepan. Add butter and cook slowly, turning frequently. Add tomato sauce. Cook until strips are tender. Stir in parmigiano-reggiano cheese. Transfer to a greased baking dish. Sprinkle with parmigiano-reggiano and bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 minutes.

In a medium saucepan, mix sugar, cornstarch, salt and half-and-half. Stir in butter until blended. Cook over medium heat until thickened and bubbly. Stir in brown sugar, vanilla, cinnamon. Pour into baked pie shell. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours to set up before serving.

Freeze a batch of your favorite vanilla ice cream in a deep freeze at least 1 week prior to serving. Cut fresh peach slices in half and place in a bowl. Sprinkle the sliced peaches with brown sugar and salt. Place a small handful of the sliced peach halves in a large glass or plastic cup and cover with a layer of ice cream. Repeat with remaining peach slices and ice cream. Place the frozen cups in a plastic bag and freeze at least 2 hours or overnight before serving.

In small bowl mix cream cheese and green onions until smooth. Stir in braunschweiger sausage, milk and worcestershire saucespoon into 30 x 1 1/2-inch baking dish. Sprinkle top with garlic powder. Chill at least 2 hours before serving.

Sauté the bacon in olive oil until crisp. Drain the fat from the pan and set aside. Sauté the onions and garlic in the remaining oil until they are soft. Add the potato and the bacon. Saute for an additional two minutes. Add the cream and the paprika and stir. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Season with salt and black pepper. Cook for 15 minutes. Stir in the eggs. Pour the mixture into a 2 quart casserole dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

Mix flour, baking powder and salt together in mixing bowl and add to other dry ingredients. Beat butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add egg and beat thoroughly. Add flour mixture to butter mixture alternately with milk until combined. Fold in chopped walnuts. Spread batter evenly in greased 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before removing from pan to cooling rack.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, carrot and oreganocook for 1 minute or until tender. Add quinoacook for 1 minute. Add broth. Bring to a boilreduce heat. Coversimmer for 12 minutes. Add frozen peascook for 2 minutes longer. Combine lemon juice and black pepper. Stir into quinoa mixture. Place in a greased baking dishsprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Bake at 375 degrees F (190 degrees C) for 10 minutes or until cheese melts.

Mix all ingredients together with a fork or spoon. Form mixture into pattiesgrill or fry until browned. Pour mushroom soup over patties until nearly covered. Add mushroomscook until liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with cheddar cheeseserve with steamed rice.

Fill a large saucepan with water and bring to boil. Add pigeon peas and cook for approximately ten minutes until tender. Drain. Place meat and seasoning into a large pan and cook gently until meat is tender. Add pigeon peas and cornflour and stir well. Heat the oil and fry the pigeon peas and meat to a golden colour. Add chopped marjoram and thyme. Stir until herbs are cooked. Remove from heat and stir in salt and pepper. Serve hot with steamed rice.

Place the butter in a saucepan and add the chopped onions. Saute the onions until they become soft and translucent. Add the curry powder and stir to mix thoroughly. Add the cake flour and stir to combine. Add the salt and pepper. Mix thoroughly. Add the sugar and vinegar. Add the water and stir. Add the hard-boiled eggs. Cook over low heat for 10 minutes or until the eggs are cooked through. Transfer to serving dishes.

In a large bowl beat egg whites until frothy. Add egg, milk and shrimp. Mix well. Add oil and scallions. Melt 1 tablespoon of cheese. Spoon mixture into a lightly greased nonstick skillet. Cook for about 3 minutes, stirring often. When it has set up, top with remaining low fat Swiss cheese. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. Peel and cut into small cubes. Place squash on foil-lined cookie sheet. Drizzle with baking soda and salt and toss. Roast for about an hour and half or until tender. Transfer to large pot and add vegetable broth and carrots. Bring to boil. Add half-and-half and blend. Simmer for about 30 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in cinnamon and season with salt and black pepper.

Mix sea bass fillet in a mixing bowl and add orange juice, tomato paste, vegetable oil, vinegar, brown sugar and hot red pepper flakes. Stir well to combine. Add garlic cloves and orange zest to the bowl. Stir well to combine. Add ground ginger to the bowl. Stir well to combine. Pour mixture into a glass baking dish (9x13), cover and refrigerate for at least two hours before serving. Serve at room temperature.

Peel potatoes and cut into 1/2 inch dice. Place in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredientstoss. Grill in a heavy-duty grill pan over medium-high heat. Grill 5-7 minutes until tender, turning occasionally.

Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil over high heat. Cook pasta for about 8 minutes until tender but firm to the bitedrain in a colander set over a bowl. Return pasta to the saucepan and add the buttertoss until melted. Add the basil leavestoss well. Transfer pasta mixture to a large serving platterlet cool for 5 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, lemon juice, hot sauce, bay leaf, salt, and peppertoss well. Add the salmontoss to coat well with the sauce. Serve with a fresh bay leaf sprinkled over each portion of pasta and salmon.

In a small mixing bowl, combine egg white and water. In another small bowl, combine brown and white sugar and cinnamon. Dip each pecan into the egg white mixture and then into the brown and white sugar mixture. Place pecans on waxed paper or parchment paper and allow to dry for several hours or overnight. Store in an air tight container for several months.

Combine brown sugar and heavy cream and bring to boil over medium heat stirring constantly. Boil for 5 minutes until candy thermometer reaches 242 deg. Remove from heat and stir in salt and almonds. Pour into greased square pan and cool completely before cutting into squares.
