In a large dutch oven or heavy soup pot over medium-high heat, heat 2 tbsp of the olive oil until hot. Add the onion and saute until tender. Add the mushrooms with some of the herbs. Saut for about 5 minutes. Add the garlic, saute for another minute. Add the tomato paste. Cook for 1 minute. Add the vegetable broth. Stir in the beans. Add the wine. Bring to a boil. Cover. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 15 minutes. Add the remaining herbs. Taste for seasoning. Serve with crusty bread.

In a large frying pan, brown the bacon pieces until crisp. Drain the bacon pieces on a paper towel. In the same pan used to cook the bacon, saute the chopped spinach until tender. Add the monterey jack cheese mixture. Season with freshly ground black pepper. Top the prepared pizza crust with the bacon, spinach mixture and shredded parmesan. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour a 12 cup Bundt pan or tube pan with vegetable oil. Mix the cake batter and pudding together in a large bowl with an electric mixer or a hand-held mixer with a dough hook attachment. Whisk together the egg and water in a small bowl and set aside for now. In a small saucepan combine the oil and sugar and heat over medium-high heat, stirring constantly, until the sugar is dissolved. Pour the melted sugar-oil mixture into the cake batter and stir well with a wooden spoon until all of the sugar is incorporated. Pour the batter into the greased Bundt or tube pan and place the pan on a baking sheet (this helps catch any drips that might occur while the pan is in the oven). Bake the cake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until a tester comes out clean (a wooden skewer or toothpick inserted in the center should come out clean). Remove the pan from the oven and let it cool for 15 minutes in the pan

Thaw spinach and squeeze out as much of the water as possible. Dice onion and combine all ingredients together. Cook until mixture begins to thicken, stirring constantly. Transfer cooked mixture into a serving bowl and enjoy.

Bake in a greased and floured tart tin or small cake tin. Mash the potato and rub in the flour with a little of the butter. Add the egg and beat well. Mix in the rest of the butter and the grated cheese. Pour into the tart tin and place in a slow over for about an hour. When cooked test for doneness by inserting a knife into the centre. The cake should be firm and cooked through. Serve warm or cold.
Combine all ingredients and cook over low heat for 30 minutes. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease a 9 x 5 inch loaf pan. In a medium bowl, beat the brown sugar, maple syrup, butter and vanilla until smooth. Whisk together the flour and salt. Add the dry mixture to the wet mixture until well combined. Fold in the pecans. Pour the batter into the loaf pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes, or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 15 minutes in the pan, then remove the cake to a wire rack to cool completely.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add potatoes to water and cook for 10-12 minutes until tender. Drain well. Cut broccoli into bite sized pieces. Cook green beans in a separate pan of boiling water until tender. Drain well. In a large bowl, mix oil, lemon juice, broccoli and green beans. Season with salt & pepper to taste. Add potatoes. In a small bowl mix in dill & pine nuts. Toss well. Fold in cheese. Serve warm.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the sliced onion to the skillet. Cook until soft and translucent, about five minutes. Add the sliced poblano chile. Cook until softened about five more minutes. Stir in the turkey sausage. Cook until the turkey has browned. Add the chopped tomatillo. Cook until the tomatillo softens. Add the white wine. Cook until the wine has evaporated. Season with salt. Add the rice and stir to coat evenly. Cook for an additional minute. Remove from the heat. Serve hot over rice.

Saute onions, peppers, and garlic until onions are soft. Remove from heat and stir together eggs, milk, butter, sugar and pepper. Grease a 9x13 dish. Spread 1/3 of the squash slices evenly in the dish. Spread half of the egg mixture over the top of the squash slices. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the egg mixture. Top with remaining squash slices, spread remaining egg mixture over the top of the slices. Sprinkle remaining breadcrumbs over the top of the slices. Bake at 375 for 45 minutes or until the mixture is set and the top is golden brown. Serve warm or cold.

Clean the fish and season with salt and pepper. Dry the fish with paper towels. Heat the oil in a pan. Sauté the onion and the garlic in the oil. Add the tomatoes. Add the fish to the pan. Cook the fish for 3 minutes. Add the sauteed vegetables. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover the pan. Cook the fish for 5 minutes. Add the lemon juice. Cook the fish for 10 more minutes. Remove the pan from the heat. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve.

Combine butter and sugar in large mixing bowl until fluffy. Add egg yolks one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in almond extract. Combine flour and corn syrupmix well. Gradually add flour mixture to butter mixture alternately with 1/3 cup milk in 2 batches. Spoon into 6 paper-lined muffin pans. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-25 min or until puffed and golden brown. Cool on wire rack for 20 min. Cool completely. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Spoon 1-1/2 teaspoons of preserves into each tartlet cuptop with a pecan half or pecan half with a pecan half.

Preheat the oven to 375F degrees. Coarsely grate the zest and juice of the lemons into a large bowl and set aside. Rub the duck breasts all over with the olive oil and sprinkle liberally with lemon pepper and salt and pepper as desired. Place the duck on a rack in a large baking dish (I used a large cookie sheet). Place the duck breasts on the rack and drizzle the juice and zest mixture over the top of the duck breasts and season well on the top as well. Roast for about 45-60 minutes or until the duck is cooked and tender. Transfer the duck to a cutting board and let rest for about 10 minutes before serving.

In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, saute the white onions in the oil over medium-high heat until the onions are soft and translucent. Add the flour and cook for 3 minutes. Add the Anaheim peppers and cook for 2 minutes. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the stock and cook for 5 minutes. Season to taste. Serve over your favorite Mexican dishes. Makes about 1 1/2 cups of sauce.

Cut a slice of bread in half lengthwise. Slice half of each piece into bite sized pieces, set aside the other half for later. Set aside one half of the bread pieces for later use. Spread margarine on the remaining half of the bread pieces. Dip the cut side of the apple slices in the margarine, then dip the bread slices in the margarine. Deep fry until golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve with ice cream or yogurt sauce.
Mix all together and cook over medium heat until it thickens.

In a medium bowl, whisk together eggs and milk. Stir in flour until combined. Stir in brie and chives. Heat butter in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Spoon about 1/4 cup batter into the skillet. Cook about 3 minutes or until pancake is golden brown. Flip pancake and cook an additional minute on the other side. Sprinkle each pancake with cayenne pepper.

Mix the dill weed in the soup, stirring well. Add sour cream and stir in thoroughly. Place the potato slices in the bottom of a casserole dish. Layer the pork chops over the potato slices. Pour soup over top of the potato slices. Sprinkle parsley over top. Place in oven and cook at 350f for one hour and fifteen minutes.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, add the oil and garlic. Cook for a few minutes until the garlic is fragrant. Add the chopped anchovies and saute until they are dissolved. Add the crushed tomatoes and stir until well combined. Add the capers. Simmer for about 5 minutes. Cook the spaghetti according to package directions. Drain and toss it with the sauce. Toss the parsley into the sauce. Top it off with the canned tuna and serve.

Bake pie crusts as directed using 2 pie pans for each batch of meat and potatoes quiche. Brown ground beef and drain well. Add potatoes and cook through. Add in cream and blend well. Add the eggs and seasonings and mix well. Pour mixture into pie shells and sprinkle with cheddar and bake at 350 degrees for about an hour or until golden brown and set.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl combine the pineapple and cherries. Combine the chocolate cake mix, margarine and coconut. Pour mixture over the fruit mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes.

In a 9x13 inch baking dish combine the water, rice, onion powder and seasoning. Mix together. Stir in cream of chicken soup. Pour over the rice mixture. Place the chicken breasts in the dish. Sprinkle with reduced-fat cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes or until the rice is tender. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Melt the chocolate and the butter in a bowl over a pot of boiling water and stir until it melts. Add the brown sugar and the eggs and beat well with an electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Add the cocoa and stir well until just mixed in. Add the flour and stir until it is just combined. Pour the mixture into a greased and lined 22cm round cake tin and place in the middle of a pre-heated moderate oven (180 deg C) for about one hour and 20 minutes, or until the cake is firm and cooked through. Cool the cake on a wire rack for five minutes and then turn it out onto the rack and peel off the liner paper. Cut the cake into squares and serve with fresh cream or your favourite chocolate sauce. Store the cake in the refrigerator until ready to serve again and it will be moist and fresh for up to five days.

In large bowl combine brown sugar and oil. Beat in eggs one at a timestir in vanilla and chocolate morsels. Add dry ingredientsmix until combined (batter will be thick). Pour into greased 9x13 inch pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until set and edges are light golden brown. Let cool before cutting into bars. Yield: 36 bars.

Preheat oven to 180 degC. Boil water and add rice. Cover and cook for 20-25 mins. Drain well. Heat margarine and fry onion and green capsicum till just tender. Add tomato puree and seasoning. Stir in drained cooked rice. Add margarine and stir. Place into an 180 degC ovenproof dish and cook for 20 mins. Sprinkle with parsley.

Cut each avocado in half around the pit. Remove the pits and scoop the flesh from the skin into a large bowl. Squeeze lime juice over the flesh and mash with a fork. Add the bell pepper and onion and mash together. Add the cheese and jalapeno slices and stir to combine. Add the hot sauce to taste and the corn kernel. Stir to blend thoroughly. Season with salt to taste. Serve with tortilla chips or toasted tortillas.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine cream cheese and milk. Add in egg and stir. Stir in whole kernel corn and cream-style corn. Add in muffin mix and stir. Lastly add in the shredded cheddar cheese and stir. Pour mixture into greased 9x9-inch baking dish. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Let cool. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray an 8x8-inch baking pan with nonstick spray. In a medium bowl combine the millet and puffed Kashi. In a small bowl combine the peanut butter and honey. Spread the millet mixture onto the bottom of the prepared pan. Evenly distribute the peanut butter mixture over the millet. Arrange the raisins on top of the peanut butter mixture. Arrange the wheat germ and mini chocolate chips on top of the raisins. Top with the oatmeal. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until the bars are golden and set. Cool the bars completely before serving.

Heat oil in large pot. Add onion and garlic and saute until onion is soft. Add zucchini and potatoes. Stir in broth. Sprinkle with salt. Cook until vegetables are tender. Puree in food processor or blender until smooth. Return to pot. Add more broth if necessary.

Preheat oven to 400 f. Grease a 13 by 9 inch baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. In a large bowl combine horseradish, lemon juice and zest, garlic cloves and fennel seeds. Place fillets in bowl and turn to coat. Pour 1/2 cup of seasoned panko in a small bowl and add remaining seasoned panko. Press panko mixture onto both sides of each fillet. Combine mustard and seasonings. Dip each fillet in mustard mixture and then place in prepared baking dish. Sprinkle remaining panko mixture over fillets. Bake 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through. Garnish with additional parsley if desired.

Wash baby carrots under cold running water. Cook in water until tender. Drain. In a small saucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to boil stirring until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Add wine vinegar and salt. Pour liquid over carrots. Stir. Cover pan. Let stand 5 minutes. Toss. Serve warm.

Remove the stems from the button mushrooms. Bring water, vinegar and 1/4 cup of the olive oil to a boil in a large skillet. Stir in the remaining 1/4 cup of olive oil and the mushroom caps. Cook over moderately high heat until the liquid has been absorbed. Remove from the heat. Toss with the mustard and lemon juice. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Combine margarine, peanut butter, vanilla and egg. Add dry ingredientsstir just until combined. Drop by teaspoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on cookie sheets 3 minutes. Transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

Place the dried mint leaves and garlic cloves into a food processor with the oil and blend to a paste. Add the cayenne and the tomato and process to a smooth paste. Add the vinegar and process until smooth. Add the salt and process until well combined. Adjust the seasoning with more vinegar and/or salt as needed. This recipe was inspired by the cookbook Lebanese Cuisine by Kiki Abdo.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine all filling ingredients in blender or food processor until smooth. Pour filling into deep dish pie shell. Bake at 375f for 15 minutes or until filling is set. Cool on rack for 1 hour before serving. Store in refrigerator.
Mix dry ingredients together. Add the oil and milk and mix well. Add eggs and vanilla. Mix well. Add apples and blend. Pour into greased 9 inch pan and bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes.

Prepare crust as directed on package for quick oats and place in a 2 quart casserole dish. In a saucepan, combine morsels and butter and cook over low heat until morsels are melted and mixture is smooth. Add brown sugar and cook until mixture boils, then remove from heat and stir in flour and cinnamon until well blended. Spoon filling over crust and sprinkle with apples and pecans. Cover and bake at 375 for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted into center comes out clean. Let stand for 1 minute before serving.

Heat the sunflower oil in a heavy casserole dish over medium heat until it just starts to smoke. Add the oregano, the whole garlic cloves and the sliced tomatoes to the pan and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the diced mushrooms to the pan and cook for another 5 minutes until the mushrooms are softened and the liquid has reduced. Pour in the beef stock and bring to the boil. Cook for another 10 minutes until the liquid has reduced by half. Add the chopped sausages to the pan and cook for another 5 minutes until browned on all sides. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve with the black olives on top of the sausages.

Sprinkle each pork chop with 1/4 teaspoon of pepper and 1/4 teaspoon of salt. Dredge each side of the pork with flour. Heat the vegetable oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Brown each side of the chop for 2 to 3 minutes. Set the browned side down in the pan. Place the pan over medium heat. Stir in the wine. Cook and stir for 3 to 5 minutes or until the liquid is reduced by half. Place the pan over high heat. Add the cornstarch. Stir and cook for 1 minute or until thick. Add the beef broth. Bring to a boil stirring constantly. Cook and stir for 1 minute. Add the browned side of the pork. Reduce the heat to low. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes or until the meat is tender. Stir in the onions and cook until tender. Serve.

In a large pan, saute the red onion in the olive oil for 10 minutes. Add the celery and garlic cloves and saute for 2 minutes more. Add the vegetables and saute for an additional 10 minutes until they are softened and the onions are translucent. Add the tomatoes with their juice and a splash of water and bring the mixture to a boil. Turn the heat down and simmer for 10 minutes until the flavors are well-combined. In a large bowl, stir together the flour and the salt and pepper with the cumin. Add the hot liquid from the pan and stir until you have a thick paste. Transfer the mixture to a greased pie dish and bake for about 30 minutes until the top is golden brown and the filling is bubbly and hot in the middle.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Line a large baking pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper. In a saucepan combine almonds and 2 cups of water and bring to boil over medium high heat. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 10 minutes. Drain almonds and reserve 1/4 cup of the cooking liquid. Lightly grease baking pan with butter and place fish fillets on top of prepared baking pan. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste and drizzle with cooking liquid from almonds. Place almonds around fish on pan and drizzle with additional cooking liquid from almonds if desired. Bake for 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork and almonds are golden brown. Serve with lemon wedge and parsley sprinkled on top of fish.
Slice beets, place on a cookie sheet, drizzle with margarine and maple syrup. Bake at 350 for 45 min. until tender. When done, drizzle with lemon juice and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour two 9 inch baking dishes. Combine ground lean pork, onion, apple, parsley and garlic. Mix well and form into 12 equal sized meatballs. Combine breadcrumbs and barbecue sauce. Dip each meatball into the breadcrumb mixture. Place meatballs in prepared dish. Pour barbecue sauce over meatballs to cover. Bake for 25 minutes. Serve with your favorite barbecue sauce.

Pour orange juice concentrate and lime juice into a glass measuring cup and add curry powder to taste and stir until blended. Drain tofu and pat it dry with a paper towel. Place tofu in a lightly greased 2 quart square or rectangular pan and pour curry juice evenly over it and marinate for at least minutes. Preheat oven to degrees Fahrenheit and bake for minutes or until heated through and browned on top. Serve with rice and your favorite vegetable side dish.

Trim the bottoms off of the brussels sprouts and then cut in half vertically. Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the brussels sprouts and cook until browned on both sides (do not stir), about 15 minutes total. Season with the nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Cook the bacon in a large skillet until crisp. Drain the bacon and reserve the drippings. Add the sugar, butter, and soy sauce to the drippings. Cook over moderately high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Add the drained green beans. Cook over moderately high heat, stirring until the sugar dissolves. Add the drained green beans. Cook for about 3 minutes until the sugar caramelizes. Remove from the heat. Stir in the garlic powder. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly grease a 9x13-inch baking dish. Place shallots and 2 tablespoons olive oil in a 12-inch skillet over medium heat. Cook, stirring occasionally, until shallots are tender and begin to brown. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and cook until golden brown. Remove from pan and set aside. Place bread crumbs on a plate. Season with salt and pepper. Dip each chicken breast into egg and then into bread crumbs. Arrange in prepared baking dish. Top each breast with a slice of portabella and 1/2 teaspoon butter. Bake at 375f for 25 minutes or until the breadcrumbs are golden brown and the chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with parmesan and parsley. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings.

Wash and dry the fuji apples. Using an apple corer, core out the middle of the fuji apples. Remove seeds from the core with the back of the corer. Fill the core with the cranberries. Fold the cored fuji apple halves and place on top of the cranberries. Pour the heavy whipping cream into a pan. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved. Place the pan on medium low heat and cook the cream until it thickens. Remove the pan from the heat and stir in the walnuts. Spoon the whipping cream over the apples and cranberries. Place the salad in the refrigerator until it is cold. Sprinkle the salad with powdered sugar. Serve.

Fry onion in oil until softened. Stir in bell peppers, garlic cloves and salt. Saute until vegetables are tender. Add frozen hash browns, stirring constantly until browned on both sides. Add ham or bacon or both to the pan. Stir in 2 cups of cheddar cheese to the mixture and mix well to combine. Add hash browns to greased 9x13-inch casserole dish and top with remaining cheese. Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted. Cut into squares for serving.

Mix mayonnaise with pickle relish and mustard. Add tuna. Add remaining ingredients. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve as a sandwich filling or as part of a salad plate. Can be made up to 24 hours ahead. I sometime use chopped coriander to replace the parsley.

In a saucepan melt butter. Add celery and onion. Cook until soft. Add apple pieces. Add flour. Stir until a paste forms. Add curry powder. Add salt and pepper. Add water or apple juice. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 5 minutes.

Preheat oven to 180c. Butter 20cm square cake tin. Melt 50gms butter and 25gms dark choc in bowl. Beat eggs and sugar in large bowl till thick and creamy. Stir in cooled choc and espresso. Then add flour and salt. Pour into tin and bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven, cool in tin then cut into squares.

In a large heavy soup pot over medium heat melt butter and cook onions for about 10 minutes until soft. Add carrots, celery ribs, apples, red wine, port and broth, bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender, stirring occasionally. Puree soup in batches in a blender or food processor in a blender until smooth. Strain through a fine strainer into a large pot or pan. Bring soup back to a boil over medium heat then reduce heat to low. Simmer for about 10 minutes or until soup has reduced by half. Serve hot or cold.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a large bowl beat together white sugar, eggs and oil. In a small bowl mix together the all-purpose flour, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon. Stir together the dry and wet mixtures. Fold in the grated carrots. Pour batter into a greased bundt pan. Bake for 45 minutes.
